text: A few years back, this was the spot we used to go to for fancy but fun group dinners. Now... they have happy hour! Even better! Great tapas specials plus sangria! This is my fav happy hour spot in Lincoln Park at the moment.
The best for big groups/parties. Had a family get together of ALL ages and everyone was so pleased with the food as well as the drinks. I recommend getting the sangria! Also vegetarian friendly

Let me start by saying Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba has some good   Paella!! Like really really good! I was in Chicago and needed to find somewhere for my family and I to eat so what better place than to look on than ole faithful.. Yelp! I really enjoy tapas so I typed in tapas and Chicago and Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba popped up. We were staying approximately 45 minutes away. Something told me to call and see if they were packed seeing all the reviews that had been posted, I could tell they were a popular spot. Good thing I did because the wait was 1.5 hours. However, they do call ahead seating. This was great and they put our name on the list. When we got there we walked in, checked in and a nice couple was leaving the first come tables in the bar. The girl walked over to us and asked us to follow her so we could have their table. How cool was that, no wait! The server we had was very nice and helpful on what to order.  BREAD - Ok. Honestly nothing special. It had a slight jalapeño taste by I didn't see any jalapeños so I'm not sure. It was typical bread that you get from any restaurant.  SPICY POTATOES WITH TOMATO ALIOLI - Very Good! These potatoes and Alioli had a great taste. The potatoes were just typical cut up chunks of potatoes and slightly seasoned with a little spices. The Alioli is what makes this dish. It is very good and adds the perfect flavors. An overall good dish! ROASTED CHICKEN EMPANADA - Good. This empanada was pretty decent. It wasn't as good as other empanada places I have been to but it wasn't horrible. The shell was a little different than most we have tried. It was more of a flaky crust rather than a pie shell type of crust. The filling was good. It was seasoned and the chicken was nice and tender. It also came with a cream sauce that added another little pinch of flavor. SPINACH & MANCHEGO-STUFFED MUSHROOMS - Meh! Honestly this dish was not anything special. It was mushrooms with sauce, spinach, a little cheese on top and bread crumbs. The flavors/ingredients didn't really go together or flow. It honestly just tasted like mushrooms and cream sauce. Nothing special and my husband who loves mushrooms wasn't even crazy about them. It honestly just lacked in flavor.  GRILLED OCTOPUS - Very Good! This dish consisted of grilled octopus, heirloom tomatoes, crispy chickepeas, roasted garlic, arugula, and garlic-chili vinaigrette. This dish was very good! I have had plenty of octopus from restaurants and this place is on the top list. The octopus was cooked perfect, nice and tender. It wasn't very chewy and had a good flavor. All of the side ingredients helped make the dish come together and added more depth of flavor. PAELLA VALENCIANA (Pork Paella) - AWESOME! This dish was amaze balls!! I loved this dish! It consisted of confit pork shoulder, crispy pork belly, chorizo ibérico & chicharrónes. My husband and I usually don't eat a lot of pork but for whatever reason we decided to try it. I'm so glad we did. It was packed full of flavor and all the meats were so tender and flavorful. All the ingredients were a nice balance of flavor. I didn't try the other paella dishes however I can definitely vouch for this one! TRY IT!  Overall, we had a really good experience at Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba and the food was good as well. I would definitely come back and recommend them for others to try.
Delicious tapas - especially octopus dish. Paella was good but could have been better. Potatoes omelette was delicious.

I have been coming to Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba for years. You can always count on this place for a good meal and good service. Whether it's a girls night out, date night, or a very large group dinner, I've never had a bad meal here. I always order the same classic tapas: patatas bravas, goat cheese baked in tomato sauce, bacon-wrapped dates, etc. and then I usually like to order some seafood tapas such as Gambas al Ajillo or scallops and maybe throw in a few specials. And you can't forget the sangria! Great food. Great service. Great ambiance.

5 stars for the food! Hands down, the food is amazing! We did not have a single bite that wasn't delicious. We've ordered the tuna special: raw tuna, which was very delicate and fresh. The lamb special with a warm puree underneath was perfectly cooked and tasted amazing. We've also ordered the shishito peppers, which are really hard to find, but they were chargrilled to perfection and served with a little salt on top: so good. The dates wrapped in bacon are a classic, and it did taste just like I remember it from Spain. While we were pretty full after that we still decided to order desserts, and they were just the perfect size: the flan was the right texture and tasted really good, but my favorite was the cheesecake, which reminded me of the way my mom would make it, with quark, instead of cream cheese. It was soo good I wish I had a whole pie of this cheesecake. While the food was outstanding, I would not recommend the drinks. Maybe the bartender had a bad that, but the strawberry basil caipirinha tasted pretty bad.  Plus, we were seated at the very end of the restaurant, in what felt like a private room where a party of 15 people or so took up almost the entire room, and we were sitting in the same room with them, next to a hallway that was separated by a curtain. So sadly the table and the room didn't make for the perfect experience.

The selection of tapas is as robust as it is rich - you will leave here with a food coma if you do it right.  The ambiance is loud and vibrant, just what you would expect from a place serving Spanish food.  Major points because the roof opens up at night in the summer.  Each patron is encouraged to order ~2 tapas so the table has a chance to share and taste everything.  I highly recommend the brussels sprout salad, the spicy potatoes, and the burrata.  My only complaint is that our food came out in small waves with no perceived order and our waitress was snippy/unhelpful when we inquired about the rest of the dishes.

My six person last minute brunch reservation is eternally grateful that you had a table available. I assume it's because this is not a typical brunch spot and I hope it stays that way.  Shared a pitcher of the mango sangria and pretty much every one of the chef recommended plates but, when we saw the table next to us get the paella we immediately regretted not trying it. The food was slightly overpriced for what we got but that is the way with tapas it seems. Every plate was well thought out and executed. Our server was attentive and knowledgeable so, no complaints there.  My friends and I will be back!

Great restaurant! With a fantastic i'm ambience!  Told some work colleagues that I might be going here for dinner and to my surprise a lot of people had been there before. Nothing but good things can be said about the food, service and the drink specials.  I'm excited to say that everything that my colleagues said was truthful! This is a Great establishment and will be definitely coming here again.

when you need to catch up and a friend asks, when can i see ya? the perfect answer pretty much is: brunch at cafe ba-ba-reeba located on halsted in the heart of Lincoln P. you'll want to make a rez and try to get there early because it's no secret that cafe ba-ba-ree is the best for spanish tapas and if you can agree, say si! settle in with sangria. at least six kinds, you can choose: cava, white peach, classic, 'del dia' black raspberry, passion fruit brunch menu: sat & sun it's 9am to three. their happy hour from 4pm to 6 deals from their menu daily (...and they have gluten free) we had 4 plates to share our table in half shade-sunshine. come in the summer and sit outdoors their patio seating is divine bocadillo sandwiches ham hash w jamon iberico so many pinxtos to choose from even shrimp & grits with chorizo my only worry with tapas (which isn't serious at all) is that I can eat forever and forever. bite-sized plates intentionally small get your free dessert with Yelp check-in I chose the spanish affogato. it was the perfect ending to our meal the verdict: delicioso!

Not from Chicago, but got recommended to come to this place! First we ordered black raspberry sangria, delicious!!! Not too sweet and also not loaded with liquor. We ordered the heirloom tomato salad, meat charcuterie and chicken empanadas. The heirloom salad sounds a lot more fancy than what it was. It was 3 huge pieces of lettuce with 2 big pieces of tomato and then some green dressing. The cucumbers and onions in it looked old and dried out (9 dollars). The charcuterie was terrible. The only good thing we're the side cup of olives. The meats had funky flavors, the bruschetta was on hard stale bread and not appetizing. The cheese was not good and only came with 3 tiny thin slices. (20 dollars!!!). The chicken empanada only came with one, it was the better of the three. (6.50). Overall, I was not happy with my experience. If the sangria was bad, this place would have gotten 1 star.
Love the happy hour here!  Great way to try a lot of different food. Also got a free dessert per person when I checked in.

Definitely one of our favorite brunch spots. We had reservations for Sunday, and it was pretty crowded so I recommend making reservations for a weekend.  We started with two sangrias and a pintxos platter. The platter has all 6 of their pintxos including deviled eggs, chicken sausages, and short stack of pancakes. The portions are decently sized to share for two people.  We then ordered the beef Benedict and sausage-fried paella rice and 3 sides (bacon-wrapped dates, chicken sausage, and spicy potatoes). Everything arrived in a timely manner and they tasted great. I really liked the bacon-wrapped and the sausage-fried paella rice. The Benedict was okay, but it wasn't as great as the other dishes.  I would definitely recommend this place for brunch and intend to go again.

The most delicious tapas place in Chicago! My boyfriend and I had the most delicious food and sangria here. The plates were small and decadent, the olive order lasted the entire meal and the sangria was absolutely incredible. The entire experience was one I would recommend vehemently and I only regret not reviewing my meal sooner as well as taking photos to post. The employees were extremely professional and very quick to help and offer suggestions. This is my new favorite restaurant and I gush to my friends about it. I can't wait to come back and get the lamb and olives and sangria again!
Best tapas in Chicago.  On par with San Francisco standards.  Amazing brunch if you haven't tried it.

I visited for the first time during happy hour with coworkers. We called ahead as we were a group of about 15. When we got there the host, who was very curt, directed us to sit only at the bar and high top tables.  I don't know if this is because happy hour is at the bar, but this was not a good first impression. Once seated, our waiter also was what I would describe as friendly. I was already over this place but then I had the food. I highly recommend the spicy potatoes. They are soo good! The beef empanadas and red sangria aren't bad either. And maybe best of all, we spent almost no money! Overall, I wouldn't go out of my way to come here again, but if I was in the area, I'd happily pop in. And I'd recommend it to others.

Cafe ba-ba hoo bah?  Baba wa bah?  Boobah sheebah? However unfortunate the restaurant name is, the food is utterly delicious - so don't let appearances fool you. Came here for dinner on the Fourth, sun-dried, haggard, slightly disoriented, and with high expectations.  Although I'm utterly disdainful of the whole "tapas" fad in the U.S., the quality of the food here made up for it.  And for the course of one glorious mouth-watering meal, I forgot that I was in a bourgeois yuppie Spanish-style theme park.   Had the beef skewer, the grilled octopus, croquetas, and patatas bravas.  Everything we ordered as a true delight.  The croquetas were certainly the highlight for me - perfectly fried rolls oozing with potatoes, ham, and cheese.  The beef was also excellently cooked and was complimented nicely by some horseradish.  The citrusy-sourness of the octopus was a little overpowering for my seafood tastes, but my partner enjoyed it, so perhaps it's just me. Overall, quality food.  Will definitely be returning.

Fives stars for the food and the service!   Our server went out of his way to accomodate best friend's food allergies.  He even got the kitchen to make a beautifully prepared flank steak without the allergen-riddled sauce and best friend loved it.  He was back and forth several time to the kitchen to answer questions and clarify ingredients.   I know they're famous for their sangria but it didn't do a heck of a lot for me (then again, I'm not a big sangria person).  Their smoky mezcal cocktail, however, (and I drank enough of them that I can't remember the proper name) was a thing of beauty.  Containing a list of unlikely ingredients, this magical beverage had a bevy of interesting, complex and complimentary flavors.   The food was also fantastic.  I was dubious about the baked goat cheese in tomato sauce but GET IT.  It works so, so well.  So many wonderful bites and nibbles that I can't remember them all.   The restaurant is also super cute and looks like a prime spot for day drinking.

I went here for my birthday this past weekend and the food was good however the drinks were horrible. My party ordered a mojito, the smoke & spice, gin & tonic and a sangria. We also order the seafood paella and the pork paella. I would not say they were the best I have ever had but they were decent. Space is definitely an issue here, I was with a party of 7 and we had to constantly move our chairs around because the waiters kept bumping the back of our chairs or the back of our heads. I don't think anyone from the party would suggest this place to friends or be back.

One of my favorite places in Chicago! Catching-up-with-friends, taking-out-of-town-relatives, sunday-brunch-on-the-patio, team dinners, double dates... I've been to Ba-Ba-Reeba so many times and always had great experiences. I love both the food and the vibe, and the price-to-food ratio is more than reasonable. First off, get the SANGRIA. I typically prefer white sangrias but love the red one here. My bf and I once finished a pitcher between the two of us... what a great start of the night. The seasonal offerings are usually quite nice too; I particularly liked the apple cider one. Tapas menu is pretty big. My constant favorites include the bacon wrapped dates (it's on the restaurant yelp profile picture... so get it), patatas bravas, baked goat cheese, short rib, scallops, and seafood paella. Totally brings me back to Spain, and even better than many tapas I sampled there. They also have happy hour 4-6pm daily, with tapas at the original 1985 opening price ($1-$3) and reduced-price drinks. It's always a happy time.

First of all, our server, Erin N., was phenomenal. Extremely friendly and easy-going -- she made our tapas experience extremely pleasant. I give her extra props for dealing with our loud and scattered crew of 12.  SANGRIA: Delicious, authentic. Not too sugary. We ordered a few of these.  TAPAS: My favs out of the vegetarian options: Moroccan stew was very flavorful. Spicy yet sweet from the yellow raisins. Unique.  The potato and onion omelette was delicious. Warm, fluffy, savory. The egg puffs it up, but wishing there was a little more flavor. It would be nice to have a jam pairing in addition to the aioli.  Stuffed Mushrooms were hearty and flavorful.  Goat Cheese in tomato sauce  Codfish croquette was delicious, as was the cheese with jam Squid was well-cooked and buttery, but I wouldn't pair it with the arugula.  PAELLA: We ended up trying the seafood, pork and chicken paellas. I personally thought it was slightly salty, but I'm not a huge paella expert though, so I wouldn't trust my review. Get slightly fewer servings than the # of people you have if you are trying to purchase other menu items.  DESSERT: We tried every single dessert. Our favorites were the Butterscotch Custard, Caramelized Banana, Passion Fruit Sorbet, and the Marcona Almond-Caramel Bar.  OVERALL: Really great for groups. Friendly staff. Fun & delicious food all around. Will definitely come back.

Ba Ba.. Best Tapas in Chicago! After living in Spain, I would say these was the best Tapas meal that I ever experienced. I am not the biggest fan of taps but how can you not love ordering and trying almost everything on the menu wish dishes coming to your table every 5 minutes. Combine the mass amounts of food with Sangria, and your result is a lot of happy customers on a Friday night! Dare me to say it but Cafe Ba Ba Reba might fall in my Top-10 list of favorite Chicago restaurants. Located in Lincoln Park off oh Halsted Street for the last 35 years, Ba Ba Reeba paved the way for a popular row of restaurants, mainly all Lettuce Entertain You, on Halsted St in Lincoln Park. My very smart girlfriend knew that this would be a great restaurant for a larger group (8 of us) to sit at a round table and enjoy a lot of the Tapas. I previously mentioned that I wanted to go here but she said wait for a special occasion with a larger group. Of course she was spot on with this decision as we enjoyed her Birthday dinner @Ba Ba Reeba last night.  I know that I have already mentioned this a few times but it is fun to go to a Tapas restaurant with a large group because you get to enjoy so many dishes. I want to highlight A handful of my favorite dishes from the meal last night. I would definitely say the Patatas Bravas, Shrimp with garlic sauce was excellent, the Burrata was super soft and sweet, the short rib which was melt in your mouth good and the Brussel sprouts salad was stellar too!! I also really enjoyed the sangria as we got a pitcher of blackberry sangria. On top of excellent food, we dined at a round table next to the window facing Halsted white and enjoyed the beautiful night in Chicago. The service was also top notch as our Waiter was super quick and the Manager made this is a very special night too. I would only think that this restaurant does extremely well financially because of its size, speed of distributing dishes, quality of food, and maintaining and even improving their quality reputation over the last 35 years.  I will definitely be back to enjoy more Tapas at Ba Ba Reeba!

I've been wanting to try this restaurant for a while. It's very cute and busy on the inside but has a open atmosphere. I mostly stuck with breakfast items. I liked the egg and potato small bite I had. The French toast stick bite and deviled egg were just ok. The Nutella waffle was good but I was pretty full by the time I got it (it came very late but the waitress apologized). I did not care for the chicken waffle stick, it was like a corn dog with chicken sausage, gross in my opinion! I checked in for a free dessert which I appreciate however my dessert was awful!!! It was passion fruit sorbet and it was soooo sour that it wasn't even edible and I'm not one to pass up dessert. I don't know how anyone could ever eat that, I think it was a poor choice by the restaurant.  I was really hoping that I would like cafe ba Ba Reba more Than I did especially because I'm from the suburbs and it took me an hour to get there. I'm hoping their dinner will be more impressive than their brunch. I do love the concept and I felt full and that their pricing was fair.

I absolutely loved this place. Sangrias were so good. I highly recommend ordering the papas bravas! Also for dessert try the caramelized banana. I'm only giving 4 stars because the waiter took too long to get to my table. I suggest they hire more staff.

Came here while still underage unfortunately so didn't get to try out their sangria BUT still had a terrific time. Met my family there, and the servers were very patient with us taking our time to catch up before looking at the menus. The food was absolutely delicious and very well proportioned for us!! Even though they have a two serving minimum of their paella, it was very worth getting the extra food and having some leftovers for the next day. Definitely need to come back here sometime soon!

Go for happy hour and feel liberated as you order every tapa on the menu, a pitcher of sangria, and still not be frightened by the bill. Fantastic patatas bravas, tortilla, chorizo and peppers, croquettes, garlic and tomato bread (a ton of it) and sangria. Fun, very group friendly environment and great service.

If you love delicious tapas at affordable prices, check out Café Ba-Ba-Reeba!! We came here for brunch on a weekend day. It was pretty crowded, so I recommend making a reservation ahead of time! We got 4 tapas to share for 2 people. We started with the shrimp and grits. Classic brunch item with a spicy kick to it. Very creamy grits and flavorful shrimp! Then we got the citrus French toast with the MOST delicious butter I've ever tasted. We finished off with the buttermilk fried chicken and the lamb kebabs. The fried chicken was SO good! It came in a huge portion for the money you pay. I was not a huge fan of the lamb kebabs-- they were way too salty. Keep in mind that all of their items come out individually. There was a gap of up to 10 minutes between some of the tapas.  If you check in on the Yelp app, you get a free dessert tapa!!  Overall, we really enjoyed our experience here and can't wait to come back!

By far one of my favorite restaurants in Chicago.  Delicious food, Great friendly staff who allow their guests to experience a meal without being to pushy for the next tapas round order. We love coming here and Cafe B truly has a special place in our hearts, in fact we got engaged here! Always a 10/10 for overall experience

Can someone help me to understand why this place is so popular? Despite it being terribly difficult to make a reservation ahead of time, calls to the place gave you the impression that the open-seating bar would be just as much of a challenge to get a table.  Interestingly enough, there were plenty of seats at the bar when we arrived on a Saturday night in July. We scoped out what most of the guests were having around us and we concluded that it was mostly the traditional tapas dishes that were being consumed. We skipped the paella with it being just the two of us and wanted to go for dishes that we could get a greater variety. Unfortunately, nearly everything was super greasy and two dishes oddly has a mayo-sriracha based dip.  Moral of the story: don't believe the hype and spend your precious time and satisfy your appetite elsewhere.

Good food just such small portions... i get that it's tapas but expensive and small portion just makes me think of taste plates at fancy restaurant and not a place that's kind of aiming for a homey feel to it

A member of our party was restricted to a gluten-free diet. They provided gluten-free bread (which was actually tasty) and the gluten-free menu was extensive.  The server went beyond the specialized menu to explain which items the table ordered could be consumed and why certain items weren't gluten-free due to cross-contamination (i.e. the burrata could be eaten, but isn't included on the gluten-free menu because it comes with toast and the patatas bravas aren't gluten-free because they're cooked in the fryer with breaded foods).  They were very accommodating and the food was excellent, as always!

Cafe Ba Ba Reeba is my favorite tapas place in Chicago.  I've been multiple times: my friend has his birthday dinner here every year, and I recently came with a large party for a work dinner.  The venue is a bit dark and lit mostly with candles. Great for a date! It's usually bustling as they have great happy hour deals as well.  Pros: I've gotten almost everything on the menu... favorites are the bacon wrapped dates, burrata, heirloom tomato salad, grilled octopus, short rib, hanger steak, and the white peach sangria. They're also a Lettuce Entertainment You restaurant (probably one of the top options, too).  Cons: We got the vegetable paella once which was mostly like fried rice -- not worth it in my opinion and there are many other fantastic vegetarian options. Their food can be on the salty side and they are strict on checking IDs - my friend's license was taken to the manager.

The food is good, and the service is very friendly and upbeat. It's a very loud environment, and definitely an energetic and busy environment.  The portions are average for tapas, and I would definitely recommend getting the seafood paella.

Are you kidding me? This is one of my favourite restaurants in the city of Chicago. Talk about tapas...everything I've gotten here has been orgasmically delicious. It is pricey, but my friends and I save up and go every few months. A check-in will get you a free tapas desert! I love the Chicken piri piri and also the sangria is to die for. The wait is usually 2 hours on a weekend, but we just hop over to Marquee bar and Cafe Baabs texts us when our table is ready. Good system! Less busy on weekdays, usually no wait before 7PM.

This is one of the top tapas places in Chicago, the only reason I bumped it down a star is because I went to iberico first. Between the two Iberico is personally my more favorite of the two. I still recommend trying this place as they have some pretty solid dishes.
The bacon wrapped dates and red sangria are to die for. Portions are small even for tapas

This place was so cool!  Honestly I was so stuffed when I went that I didn't try the food, but it was really nice inside with great decor.  I loved the hanging meats!  Seriously it looks cool.  The drinks were tasty, and the service was great.  Though the bartender took a while to get us our waters like we asked, and I was parched AF.

Yum!!  I enjoyed dinner here with a large group for dinner. We pretty much ordered at least 1 of everything on the menu and it was all delicious. The sangria was also a hit!!  I would recommend this place if you are nearby, just be sure to make a reservation as it can get busy come evening hours.

Favorite restaurant in Chicago! Perfect for date nights or a girls night out. Not too expensive and the food and drinks are to die for. Pitchers of red sangria, orders of spicy potatoes, meatballs, goat cheese bread, and the shrimp is what a perfect night entails! You. Must. Go. Here.
Great place! Food was delicious and perfect portions for the price. Spicy potatoes, buttermilk fried chicken, and stuffed mushrooms were our favorites! Make a reservation because it gets pretty busy!
Food is always great and so the service ! Everything on the menu taste great . I would take one star off since it's always loud and crowded
Sangria and stuffed mushrooms are to die for!!! Service is great and mashed potatoes were amazing
The atmosphere was idle for summer. The restaurant has a hip/ comfortable vibe. Highlights were the honey milk chicken and chorizo dates. The dessert menu was dynamite!!
The passion fruit sangria is to die for!! My favorites are the octopus and patatas! Definitely recommend. Everyone is friendly too.

This is a good place to get a great appetizer and sangria! My wife and I come here occassionally for dinner.  The seafood paella is great.  My wife enjoys the spinach stuffed mushrooms. The staff is friendly and can't beat the convenient location from our home.

I always take people from out of town here. They have reasonable priced pitchers of sangria. My favorite is the passion fruit, but a lot of people really like white peach too.  Favs:  Chicken & Ham Croquetas, bacon wrapped dates, Buttermilk-Fried Chicken Thighs, Spicy Potatoes with Tomato Alioli, Grilled Ibérico Pork -Chicken & ham croquetas are one of my favorite things here. Delicious and creamy and fried!  -They have bacon wrapped dates and also something in the Pintxos section called "Chorizo-Wrapped Medjool Date & Cheese". The bacon wrapped dates come with more dates and just leave out the cheese. The bacon wrapped dates plate tastes better and you get more!  -The chicken thighs are so yummy. The piri piri sauce tastes similar to buffalo sauce.  -The potatoes are simple but delicious. Not a must-order, but pretty good.  -The pork melts in your mouth! It's perfect.  -The butterscotch custard is one of the BEST desserts I've had in Chicago. It's a small portion so you don't even feel guilty afterwards.  Mehs: Goat Cheese Baked in Tomato Sauce, chicken empanada, Grilled Hanger Steak, the seafood paella!  -Goat cheese in tomato sauce is nothing special. It's yummy, but nothing special.  -Grilled hanger steak is kind of bland. It's cooked well, but it's lacking a bit in flavor.  -Chicken empanada is small and is nothing special. -The seafood paella tastes like fried rice. It's too salty and kind of dry. The seafood flavor isn't incorporated into the paella like it's supposed to be, it feels like they made the rice separately and threw the seafood on top. There are a good number of clams though, so at least they didn't skimp.  Overall a fun place to go with big groups so you can try more items. Also a great place for (first) dates! Go without a reservation and you will be forced to hang out at the bar until your table is ready, not a bad thing if you're trying to get to know someone. I've recommended this place as a date spot to many friends.

I have been a patron of Ba Ba Reeba for years so I was ecstatic to learn that they held events when I was planning my rehearsal dinner. I worked with multiple staff members throughout the 10 month process who were all attentive and quick to answer all emails and calls. I was able to customize the entire menu and drink options. My 32 guests had an incredible time and everyone is still raving about it. I highly recommend their rooms for your small gatherings such as showers, rehearsals, and even weddings. Thank you to the Ba Ba Reeba and Lettuce Entertain You team!
I had never had tapas before. This place has set the bar pretty high for me. Everything here was fantastic! Drinks are excellent too! Get the white sangria. It tastes like summer to me.

For the higher price point and all the great reviews on here, Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba didn't quite meet my expectations. The tapas were good - especially the chorizo-wrapped date & cheese and the beef tenderloin. The chicken paella we ordered was super salty (not sure if it is usually that way or just an off night). The service was really great though. I'd recommend making reservations ahead of time if you plan on bringing a larger group.

Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba is really just one of those restaurants that never disappoints. Been here a couple of times and every single time they nail the food on the head. Look, if you're looking for tapas and some great paella then look no further. On my most recent visit we got a pitcher of Sangria, the appetizer sampler, and a paella loaded with all sorts of meat. I've got to say, the meat paella was significantly better seasoned than the seafood paella I had had previously. With that said, it's difficult to decide which is better, so I guess you should just try both! Overall Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba is and will remain a Chicago favorite for years to come. Their wonderful selection and flavorful food makes them a star.

I've been here twice for brunch and once for dinner! This place is great for groups or just a couple on a date. This place is actually quite large, but reservations are recommended. The two times I came here for brunch on weekends I did not have to wait more than 30 minutes. Service is always great and the price is reasonable! Tapas I have ordered: Spinach and Manchego Stuffed Mushrooms ($7.50): came with three mushrooms and were so delicious. Perfectly seasoned. Fried Calamari ($9): a little bit pricey, but was large enough that I could not finish it alone. Grilled Squid ($9): loved the grilled flavor, just a bit too oily.  Sausage-fried Paella Rice ($7.5): came with a poached egg on top. Loved it! Spicy Potatoes ($6.5): fried to perfection. So crispy and delicious. Rioja-braised Short Rib ($12): small portions, not too memorable. This place also had a check-in offer so I got the chocolate truffle cake ($3.5) for free. Was a good portion and super rich and delicious! Would recommend this place to everyone!

Normally I have a fabulous experience at Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba, but this past time I was a let down due to our server. I went for my birthday celebrations because it is my favorite place to eat and I NORMALLY get a really great server. To say I was let down is an understatement. We had a young man with a buzzed haircut who acted as though he didn't have time for anyone and I saw him roll his eyes both at our table and other tables around us. When we sat down he didn't welcome us or ask if we had dined at their restaurant before. He  didn't take our menus, I had to ASK for the specials for the day, barely checked in, never refilled our water and was overall a jerk. I get it- you hate your job, but you also have a job so be thankful and treat your customers who are just trying to have a fun evening out with respect.  Definitely taking a break from going here if that is how I am going to be treated.
So good here! Really good tapas and customer service. Everything in the menu is delicious and as long as you order something that sounds appetizing to you, you will enjoy it!
Great service and amazing menu! So many options to choose from and a very attentive wait staff that was able to answer all my questions. I recommend this place to all of my friend visiting Chicago!!

It's definitely a party place with all the noise and so many people around, but great for a date as well. My favorite is the patio, though. The prices are decent and the food is pretty great. The staff is friendly and accommodating. I just wish they took reservations because they're always crowded. That's a good sign, though.

Good tapas joint but there are better throughout the city and suburbs. With that said, Cafe Babareeba has been at this location for more than 35 years so they're doing something right. Still a good place with a great location and consistent food.

My friend and I had a great time here! I finally was able to make a reservation at this place after being unsuccessful a few weeks before. We made reservations for 7:30pm on a Monday and I was surprised at how crowded this place was! The sangria reminded me of the sangria I used to drink in Barcelona! All the tapas were really good too. I loved loved LOVED the bacon wrapped dates and the patatas brava were just the right level of spice. The one thing I wouldn't order again was the sea scallops. I just wasn't a big fan of the flavor and there were probably other things on the menu that I would have liked better. Our server was so fantastic too! She was on top of her stuff and just a great, enthusiastic waitress who really helped to make this experience top-notch. Overall had a great meal here, but would highly recommend a reservation before trying to come here!

My favorite place for brunch in the city! I've been here at least 10 times and each time is just as wonderful as the last. Their brunch menu is amazing. Not only do you get the full dinner menu, but all of the brunch options as well. I always have to get the potatoes and bacon wrapped dates, but every dish is excellent. The bloody marry bar is an added bonus to the great food!

I went here for lunch with my best friend who was in town visiting from central Illinois. She's not a big city fan, so I wanted to take her somewhere fun! Atmosphere is always great at Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba, and this day wasn't an exception, though the food came out cold (the stuffed mushrooms were literally ice cubes), and the bathrooms did not have any toilet paper in them. Myself and other women waiting in line to use the bathroom had to use paper towels, since we had no other option, nor was the bathroom attended to at all. Not the first time the bathrooms here were a bit dirty, to be honest. The staff also just seem like they're over-it (again, not the first time I've experienced this). It honestly stinks to write this review, as we had my friend's bachelorette dinner here, and I've come here many times and have enjoyed it. It just seems like the place went down hill a bit. I'd love to come back again to some hot food, happy staff and maybe some well-kept bathrooms.
Not great food. Appetizers are good, entrees were pretty boring. Mainly, the place is big, crowded, and NOISY. Has more the feel of a sports bar than a restaurant.

Hands down my favorite restaurant! I love the tapa style and we ordered all the popular dishes on the menu! The burrata, octopus and paella were awesome and we loved the white sangria we well. The paella was very rich and creamy, and the seafood tasted really fresh with a natural sweetness. Pork belly was very crispy and rich, and the potatoes were out of this world! Would definitely recommend if you are looking for Spanish food and family style dining!

I came here for their happy hour upon so many recommendations from my friends, but honestly I was kind of disappointed in my experience both in terms of the service, the (error in) billing, and the portions (which I guess can't be helped).  I came to Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba with a couple of friends. We got a pitcher of sangria which unfortunately I did not try (had some work to finish later that night! :( ) for our group, which serves around 6-7 drinks per $16 pitcher. I tried several of the tapas/pinxtos. Out of the pinxtos, I only got the chorizo with pepper: not bad, good flavor and texture. Out of the tapas, meatballs: only 2 per serving. tasty, but tiny portions and tasted like something you could probably make at home. Chicken/ham croquetas: DELICIOUS, great texture and the dipping sauce was great as well. Beef empanada: the flakiness of the crust was amazing. the empanada was a decent size as well. Overall, the portions are pretty small, but I guess that's to be expected for $1-$3.50 tapas. I left feeling a little less full than I expected I'd be. The service was one of the lows of my experience here. Maybe it was because we were sitting near the back of the bar, but I'd still expect better service given that when we arrived, the place was relatively empty. We had to hail the bartender several times to get his attention to order more food, and often it felt like he was ignoring us. The wait times on our orders were decent, so no major complaints there. One of us checked in on yelp to claim the free dessert, and not the initial bill, but the bill that was handed to us to sign, had that dessert on the bill (charged to us). We noticed the bill discrepancy, and it was only after we asked our bartender that he changed this for us.  I came to Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba having heard a lot of hype over this place, but my expectations were definitely not met. Maybe if the service had been better, I might have said otherwise?

Went on a date here with my boyfriend a little while ago and had my first tapas restaurant! Great atmosphere, seemed like everyone else there were also on dates. It's the date spot! I love places that give you fresh bread and olive oil and this place had the bestest olive oil I've ever had. I ended up calling a few days later just to ask what kind they use, but didn't have much luck finding it in stores. Haven't been back since, but def want to!
Great place for a large group! The red sangria was delicious. The scallops, short rib and potatoes were also a table favorite! The paella is huge even for the  smallest serving.

My boyfriend and I went to Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba! while visiting Chicago for the July 4th holiday. We pigged out hard, and ordered nearly everything the chef recommended on the menu. We ordered the basic white wine sangria and it was a perfect pairing.  Things we ordered ranked:  1. Grilled Octopus 2. Burrata with Catalan Tomato Bread 3. Grilled Hanger Steak 4. Pintxos Platter 5. Citrus-Cured Salmon 6. Heirloom Tomato Salad 7. Grilled Ibérico Pork The service was amazing. The second we would finish one plate, the next plate would be making its way to our table. For such a popular place, it was easy to get a reservation through OpenTable.

Come here twice in two weeks. This place is awesome !  For drinks, my personal favorite is white peach. More fruit flavor in wine, and tastes more sweet.  For food, you must try bacon wrapped dates. Tastes like heaven ! My friend dislikes anything sweet, but she really enjoys this dish. The heat maximizes the sweetness and softness of dates, while the crispy grilled bacon adds some salt to this dish. Grilled pork is a bit over medium this time. But still the quality of meat saves everything.  Grilled squid is so tender, as I almost doubt it is served directly from the market without cooking.  We also try garlic shrimp, spicy potato, friend chicken, citrus cured salmon, They all worth you to have a try.,  The only dish I dislike is beef empanada. Too dry and too plain.  For dessert, chocolate truffle cake is quite amazing. You can taste rich chocolate flavor, but not over sweet at all. Small bite, but enough for dessert.  I will definitely come back again to try some new dish and order bacon wrapped dates once more !

Went here for my birthday my beautiful niece and her awesome hubby took the family for some outstanding tapas. Since they have been here before (and we will try just about anything), we let them order. We had pitchers of white sangria and I'm happy to have been able to walk out of there with one foot in front of the other. One tapas was better than the last some of the mouth watering dishes in order of my favorites and it was really hard to place these in order were Bacon-Wrapped Dates, Roasted Chicken Empanada, Beef Tenderloin & Blue Cheese, Garlic Shrimp so good (they give you bread for the table that is really crusty and good also perfect to soop up the garlic oil from the shrimp), we place two orders of the Fried Green Peppers & Coarse Salt some were a little spicy but mostly they were mild. and the Meatballs with sherry tomato sauce. I know we ordered more but this is what I remember the most. The tapas were a generous portion, hot and incredibly delicious. We had my darling little great nephew along with us - this joint is genius - they try and seat all the tables with children in an enclosed room so the other diners are not disturbed. But my nephew was an angel because he likes to eat and enjoyed the different foods placed in front of him. Great spot, excellent service, awesome food. Thankful for family.
delicious! avoided this spot due to popularity and highly regret it.
The paella is to die for, and the tapas were all amazing. On a Friday it was very loud, crowded, and disorderly, but still a good night.

A friend of mine John suggested that I try this restaurant and I said what the heck I'm always trying new things this is a very pleasant experience. When we entered the restaurant we were greeted by very friendly person and was given our seats the waiter was extremely friendly very helpful and explained every detail of any questions I had regarding their entrees that they serve being this is my first experience here. We decided to order about five or six different items off the menu and I must say the shrimp with garlic sauce was by far the best ! During the course of our meal a gentleman named Mark Sotelino and asked how things were doing . Which I thought was really great experience to see that later that I found out that he was the general manager and he took the time and consideration to make sure all his customers were 100% satisfied with the service here :-) . This is a restaurant that I would recommend to my friends and family and especially to someone who wants to take your girlfriend for a nice romantic dinner which I'm going to do some time in the near future with my girlfriend
I came here several times . Best tapas in town with good service. Make reservation early! Since it's super popular, sometimes you have to wait a little bit for seats. But totally worth it.

One of the best restaurants I've been to in my lifetime! The bacon wrapped dates, calamari, short rib, charcuterie board, and burrata were amazing! Redeemed free desserts also! Would definitely come back again !

One of my and my friend's favorite restaurants in Chicago. Ba Ba Reeba never disappoints! Perfect for any meal or any occasion - I've hosted and attended multiple parties and showers there and it just never gets old! This place is the best crowd pleaser.
This was great! Best thing was the buratta for sure. Their sangria was delicious as well. Garlic shrimp was also amazing. I will definitely be back.
have been coming to this place for more than 10 times. My go  to.place  if I don't want to make dinner. Every dish is so good. some are even better than I had I'm Spain.

Although this restaurant gets a high grade, i do not think it deserves it. First, the taste is just okay. I tried another Spanish restaurant in downtown before, actually that one is better than this and is less crowded. Also be carefully about the tip reference they give you!!!! I split my check with my friend but the tip reference was calculated on our whole order. We all gave the number on the reference without doubting the number!!! It was so disappointing to dinner there and I felt I was cheated. I would never go there again!!

Cafe Ba Ba Reeba is one of my absolute FAVORITE restaurants in Chicago. The ambiance is incredible, service is amazing and the food is always delicious. I definitely recommend trying their Sangria. Make sure to make reservations as they are normally pretty busy.

A great tapas place, excellent sangria, and cool beer choices! Go early or later, not in between, you'll have a heck of a wait! The bar is an option too. Lots of tvs to keep up with sports. The patatas bravas is a good (not great) choice. The pinxtos are a great small bite option for those dieting or too hungry to wait 30 minutes for paella.
Excellent food and atmosphere. Went to celebrate my birthday and had a fantastic time!

I've been coming here for years and I went there Saturday night around 9pm and we were seated right away.  But once we got to our table we had to replace one of the cups of water because it was dirty.  When we went to grab the plates we noticed that there was food stuck on the inside of the plate and there were food crumbs on four more plates.  The waitress had to just replace the whole stack of plates.  When it came to getting our food we didn't receive any bread until we asked for it and when the food came the bacon on the bacon wrapped dates were burnt.  Lastly, for dessert we ordered the caramelized banana which we've had before and it was supposed to be a banana with a caramelized crust with sugar which they brulee the top what we got was a raw banana with some caramel sauce on top.

First time to this place in our daughters recommendation and we were so glad we went!! Tappas menu was great and the food was even better!! The bread they bring out was soooooo good with olive oil on he table already! Full bar menu and we split a bottle of Cava rose sparkling it was so cold and yummy!! Make a reservation and give this restaurant a go!!

Came here for my 21st birthday brunch and was wowed by the service. Our waiter gave us a sample of all the sangrias before we committed to a 1/2 pitcher of the passion fruit. Here's what we ordered: 1. sausage-fried paella rice 2. grilled squid 3. garlic shrimp 4. buttermilk fried chicken thighs 5. bacon mac'n cheese The chicken and shrimp were really amazing. The breakfast paella tends to take around 45 minutes to cook so we didn't order it this time, but I'd love to come back with a big group of friends

The service here is always top-notch, and you can't go wrong with their happy hour deal ($16 sangria pitchers, $1-3.50 tapas)! My favorite tapas were the bacon-wrapped dates (perfect combo of sweet and savory & nut-free too, unlike most places!!) and the croquetas (a classic). I found the patatas bravas cut too large and too spicy. Also not the biggest fan of the meatballs or the slice of chorizo served with a pepper. I thought the red sangria could be fruitier too. Otherwise, a good go-to that's good for groups!
We LOVE this place! Perfect for sharing and tasting lots of items to try. Their sangria is to die for! So so great!
Quarentinos and BabaReeba are a close tie. I prefer this location because of the atmosphere, scenery and a more extended aray of foods. Their desserts are awesome and their service is great.

My absolute favorite place in Lincoln Park! I always bring friends here when they come to town! Everything is delicious, not too expensive ... and the sangria is amazing!!! Make sure to make a reservation well in advance.

I love this place for tapas. Great sangria (and other drinks!) with an extensive food menu with a wide variety of items you may or may not have ever tried.  Cost is certainly decent and the atmosphere is great - not too loud, but not too quiet & serious though either. Festive without going overboard. All around good place.  Recently took my friends from out of town & they loved it! "Perfect" was the word they used :)

Small plate places have a special place in my culinary heart.  Especially when the atmosphere and service are cranked to 11 like they are here.  Ordered multiple items throughout the evening and none of them disappointed, I hate chicken salad but their chicken curry salad made a believer out of me. Deserts are very tiny, but just enough to leave you with a delightful taste reminder as you finish up.  Also Taylor Fladgate 20 year tawny on the menu was a big bonus for the last course.

Before you even get here, make a reservation as the restaurant is always super packed! It is also pretty loud, as this place is way bigger than it seems, so if you're looking for a nice quiet dinner this is not the place to go.  To start off with, I got the pinxto platter, and I was such a fan of the Bacalao Croquette and the Deviled Egg. For our tapas plates, as there was only two of us, we got 4-one from each of the sections. We got the spinach and manchego stuffed mushrooms, moroccan spiced lamb kebabs, seared sea scallops, and the chicken and ham croquetas. I was a fan of all of them, especially the croquetas and scallops. The croquetas practically melted in your mouth, and the scallops were just the right consistency.  The only thing I will say is that they were sending our dishes out super fast at the beginning, and then we waited about 20 minutes for simply our scallops. It seemed like they weren't spacing the dishes out very well.  Overall, I think it lived up to the hype, and I will definitely be here again to try everything else on the menu

Made reservations for Wednesday night at 9 PM. Didn't get to see all of the inside but I love the decor of the place from what I saw.  We ordered the following: -Spicy Potatoes: For how many reviews I read that said these were amazing, I was expecting a lot more. It tasted like normal potatoes. I wish we passed on this and ordered something else more enticing on the menu.  -Spinach and manchego stuffed mushrooms: These were delicious and really flavorful. Favorite thing that we ordered.  -Goat cheese baked in tomato sauce: Can you really go wrong with goat cheese... yummm. I also got the blackberry sangria. It tasted like straight up juice. I like my sangrias a little more alcoholic.  In conclusion: I'd come again - they have a lot of vegetarian options that I want to explore.
This place is the bomb. Worth it if you're in this neighborhood. They have about 20 delicious tapas to choose from and a great wine selection to accompany. Beautiful dark and Mediterranean ambiance.

Definitely the place to be for tapas and paella! Everything here is delicious but my favorite thing is the olives and paella. They have definitely imported the best olives and perfected the art of paella. Also, don't forget to add their delicious sangrias to complete your Spanish fiesta.

They claim to be authentic, and it's perhaps authentic enough, but I think it's a bit over rated.  Friends love to go there and I never say no, so it's good enough to go, but it really is just not as authentic as they claim to be.  Years ago Cafe Iberico used to be more authentic but the quality there has gone done.  There used to be a tapas place on Halsted about 3500 N that was owned by a guy from Spain and his Spanish father (who owned a Spanish place around 3000 N Clark).  Those were truly authentic.  So, Ba Ba Reeba... it's fine, just kind of Americanized.

Great graduation celebration with a delicious paella - cooked to perfection w rice perfectly seasoned and crispy. Great selection of savory tapas. Potato salad, curried chicken salad, bacon wrapped dates, shaved Brussels sprouts among others. Amazing desserts, including butterscotch pudding. Highly recommend for a family celebration.
Pleasant ; ate in far back room - quiet - nice .  Appetizer sample tray was the best !
Miss this place sooo much! What a unique dinning experience! It's definitely worth trying! Beautiful patio. Terrific food & culture! Very romantic!

After living in the city for seven years this place is still in my top five favorite restaurants. Yes its trendy, popular, crowded and over run by Lululemon/Kate Spade types but its still So Freaking Amazing.  My recommendation to anyone visiting for the first time is try the specials (off menu/verbal specials) and drink sangria by the pitcher. On my last visit to Baba Reeba my girlfriend and I got a cute table near the kitchen and went to town ordering. We each got one dish just for ourselves, she had the hanger steak and gave it a 10/10 and I had the raw tuna with jalapenos and it was also diving 10/10. To share we had a half pitcher of both the passion fruit and peach sangria, we both feel that the passion fruit is a more fruit forward  sangria and better pairs with the menu. In addition we split the burrata, spicy potatoes, bacon wrapped dates, and pan seared peppers. Every bite of every dish surpassed expectation.  Its easy to over order here so i would suggest buying 2-2.5 plates per person. Cafe BaBa Reeba is great for groups, dates, brunch, dinner, families and even buyout parties.

My favorite restaurant in Chicago! Every time I go I have to get the bacon wrapped dates and patatas bravas. I recently tried their brunch items and they are also great. Perfect ambiance for a date or night out with friends.

The pork paella was so good. I can't wait to eat my leftovers for lunch tomorrow! The meatballs and beef empanada were amazing too. Those 3 orders were a perfect amount of food for 2 people. Most definitely coming back to try other tapas dishes. Yummy!
Great meals and awesome customer service! I ordered bacon wrapped and it was tasty. In addition, I ordered sangria but it was mediocre. Had a fantastic time! I would certainly return.

Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba made for a really nice Sunday brunch.  The venue is very nice, with lots of natural light.  We ordered several tapas and the Citrus French Toast, the Braised Short Rib, and the Fried Chicken.  They were all great, but our favorite was the seafood paella.

Great food and great service!  You can't go wrong with anything you order.  We had seafood paella, tried all the pinxtos (amazing!), braised short ribs, spicy potatoes, goat cheese and washed it down with sangria.  I'm getting hungry again, so need to go back!

Great spot for a date night or with big groups. They have delicious pitchers of sangria for a affordable price. Their tapas are delicious as well and cater to all types of eaters (vegetarian, seafood, gf)
Perfect place for a great brunch with a big group of people. I always order the mac & cheese with bacon and the short rib sliders. Also, the sangria is phenomenal.

Great lunch...garlic shrimp satisfies my garlic requirement for 6 months - LOVE IT!   Potato salad is my favorite..so good.  Add the croquet and you've gotta awesome lunch.   The screaming group of drunk women sucked but What ya gonna do.

It's time for Spanish food. We came here for lunch today. Great ambiance. We tried all pintxos. Quantity is very small. It's only one bite of all. Spicy potatoes were extremely spicy as the name gives. Garlic shrimp is the one must try item which I really loved. Finally seasonal sangria is so good. Especially ask for seasonal one, otherwise you would get classic sangria. I had sangria with pomegranates and red wine.  Over all food is very delicious.

The food at Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba was honestly amazing. There are so many great restaurants in the city that it's hard to keep returning to the same one but I'll be back again and again. I visited during a Wednesday evening and took advantage of their happy hour special. Although, the happy hour menu has limited options on it, they are all a hit. Meatballs, amazing. Chicken and ham croquettes, so good! Even the bacon wrapped date, which I expected not to like was tasty. I will say, I think the food significantly surpassed the service. Someone else described it as "somewhat attentive but doesn't look like happy to see us" and I understand why they would say that. I almost felt like we were bothering him by sitting in his section and placing an order. However, the food was so good I could honestly not care less about the server's demeanor.

It was my first time to check out Cafe Ba-Ba-Reba. We came in early dinner on a weekday. I've tried tapas before with other restaurant. So here's my review. Ambiance = 4 Stars Servers = 3.75 Stars (somewhat attentive but doesn't look like happy to see us, still gave him 20% tip) Food = 3.5 Stars Price = 3.5 Stars Cleanliness = 4 Stars I would've rated it overall as 4 Stars but... 1. When my husband ordered his drink, the glass that was use to serve his alcohol has a visible crack on it. (I went to the bar and had it replace) 2. The water glass given to me has chip on the lid 3. When I checked in, I showed my server that I'm suppose to have a tapas desert but didn't serve it. Will I be back? Maybe but I'll try some place first Will I recommend? Maybe

There is a Spanish aphorism that I love, "Tapas are tiny presents for happy drunks."  Whether you're drinking or not, tapas does feel like little presents and Cafe Ba Ba Reba knows how to throw a great party. Mercat is more refined and authentic, but sometimes you just want to have fun. Cafe Ba Ba Reba is festive and bustling. And it's Lettuce Entertain You so you get points.  Food is solid. We ordered the bacon wrapped dates (tapas menu), chicken and beef empanadas, beef kebabs, meatballs, goat cheese, patatas bravas, tomato bread, grilled squid, sausages, and brussel sprouts. Everything was delicious.  Was it 100% authentic? Maybe not. But hey, we didn't eat at midnight either like the do in Spain so I can live with small compromises. It was delicious and we had fun. So I'll take it.

Good food, adequate service, Bohemian dive bar vibe. We were mostly vegetarian and ordered mostly vegetarian dishes. Mushroom and goat cheese dishes were excellent; the Moroccan chickpea stew and brussels sprouts salad were a little too sweet but otherwise tasty. They have a good deal for wine flights, which I enjoyed (even if one of the glasses arrived wet, i.e., freshly washed but not dried). I wish there were more green things on the menu, but this is a chronic problem with the tapas I have experienced. Desserts were mediocre. Our server was extremely conscientious and polite, but other employees who checked in on us forgot to bring us more water, a second glass of wine, and a serving spoon. The women's bathroom was a little gross. The place is crowded, loud, and feels a little skeevy to me, but it's solid all around.
Was visiting Chicago and went here on the recommendation of a local. Impeccable service and delicious food, loved the sangria. Great environment for a date or just a night out with friends.

This place is by far my favorite Lettuce Entertain You restaurant in the area (and there are so many!)  Brussels sprout salad, meatballs, paella, mushrooms, cauliflower specials, you name it! It's all so tasty. I've always had excellent service too.. I'm so happy you can make a reservation online because this place is always packed!  I hope to be coming back here for years to come!

Absolutely amazed at what a great dinning experience I had this evening. I can honestly rave about this place for days.  Here's the simple breakdown.  Ambience : Noisy , crowded with vibrant sounds of laugher and chatter with tables closely seated. ( some tables are even communal with dividers)  Food: tapas style ( small plate portions ) with endless flavors and options to chose from. Lots  of vegetarian, cheese and meat options.  Here's some of my favorite, that I think personally are worth ordering:  SPICY POTATOES WITH ALIOLI: crispy with a slight hint of spice makes these dangerous addictive  SPINACH AND MACHEGO STUFFED MUSHROOMS: CHICKEN EMPANADAS: warm, fresh and the chicken inside is perfectly seasoned  FRIED CALAMARI:  MEAT BALLS:  BACON WRAPPED DATES: Not sure who discovered this divine combination of sweet and salty combination. But the bacon is crisp to perfection.  Plates are shareable. Highly advice ordering multiple different stuff to try amongst your group because everything was amazing.  Plates range from as low as 3 dollars to as high as 13 depending on the item.  2 people should expect to pay between $50-100 depending on how many drinks/food is ordered.

Amazing food, great variety, delicious sangria, and romantic atmosphere.  This place is great for a date night with your SO or dinner with a group of friends!  I recommend trying a little of everything and also asking the waiter/waitress for their recommendations.  The goat cheese with tomato sauce is one of my faves- simple yet so delicious!

I want to try this place but when I tried to make a reservation the staff on the phone was extremely rude & uninterested in helping. I've heard great things about the restaurant but if I can't even make a reservation....?

The service was fabulous and the food was pretty good. It wasn't the best Spanish food I've ever had, but my boyfriend and I were very content (and full) at the end of our meal. I definitely recommend coming with a group of people so that you can try as many dishes as possible!

I never really was a tapas fan.  But this place blew my mind.  Everything I tried (and I tried a lot) was amazing. The chicken empanadas was so good and the garlic sauce that came with it made it even better. The cherry sauce meatballs were delicious. The spicy potatoes with aioli sauce was so good. They had a bacon wrapped date which I never even thought that combo would ever go together tasted so so good. I can't wait to go back. This place has easily become my favorite place to eat.

Definitely the best tapas place I have been to in Chicago. The sangria on tap is always fresh. The wait is usually around 2 hours, but you can generally find a spot at a high top table or the bar and avoid the long lines.
Amazing Sangria, loved the atmosphere and food was delicious. Never though mashed potatoes could be what I tasted. Seafood Paella was great. No complains

The food and sangria are both delicious. It is nice because you can try lots of different foods for a reasonable price. They have a large menu that caters to people of all tastes. The server even brought out a sample of the sangria to make sure we liked it before deciding on a pitcher.

I am in love with this place.  This was one of my first tapas experiences and it was great.  All the sangria is excellent as I split all of the flavors with my date.  You really can't go wrong with anything on the menu.  Some of the best things- the baked goat cheese, the spicy potatoes with tomato aioli, the beef empanada and the beef skewer.  I wish I could have tried everything but you know, money.  This is the perfect place to have a fun night out with friends or a date as well.

Ba-Ba is always a good time! You really can't go wrong when you come here, but my only suggestion would be the more, the merrier. If you go here by yourself, you limit how many fantastic dishes you can try! I'm not usually big on fruity drinks either, but their sangria is definitely the way to go! Stick to the original house red sangria for a nice treat; not too sweet and just the right amount of buzz to get you going to really elevate those tapas!  From my multiple visits I've pretty much had their entire menu, minus the paella.  I would say on average all the tapas are above average, but the stand outs are the patatas bravas, bacon wrapped dates, anchovies, and the garlic shrimp. This place definitely gets super busy so make sure either make a reservation or fend for yourself at the bar. Overall, a nice place to get social, taste some treats and relax!
Came here last weekend for my bachelorette dinner. Everything was great, from the service to the sangria, the food to the area we sat in. Thanks Baba Reeba for an amazing start to a fun weekend.

Absolutely delicious. Even though I am a cautious eater (read:picky), the menu was so large and diverse that it was easy to find items that were enjoyable for everyone. We tried so many things that it is hard to remember, but I will say this- YES TO PAELLA!!!! We had two different paellas and they were both wonderful and crispy on the bottom and just yum. My only gripes were that the floor was SUPER slippery and our server seemed to hold some sort of grudge against me. Like he would fill everyone else's waters but not mine even though I was sitting the closest to him. No big deal, though, I had sangria.

Who doesn't love tapas? As maid-of-honor I wanted to plan a fun night and was looking for a pre-fix to anticipate costs. They have many levels of pre-fixes and I chose the cheapest one because by the time you add in the taxes and fees and gratuity. It ends up being about $50/pp. But then no one is fighting over the bill. It's all fair and equal. And with an added touch they make a personalized menu which is a nice touch. Since we didn't end up making any hard and fast plans for dinner it ended up being a 3 hour dinner. Lots of great food. Just a word to the wise, if you have a large party you need to start the planning at least two months in advance to get a desirable time.

Came here for a Sunday night dinner based on the strength of the restaurant's Yelp reviews. Was surprisingly underwhelmed by the food, restaurant, and service. Food: This is a classic tapas place - nothing new, nothing different. Very solid menu but it lacks inventive dishes. To boot, I don't think the flavors or ingredients were that good. The paella was extremely salty, the sauteed shrimp tasted like frozen shrimp from Trader Joes, and the brussel sprouts were a snooze.  Restaurant: The space is huge. I read that CBBR is romantic and intimate - I couldn't disagree more. Feels like you're in a cave packed with other diners Service: Mixed bag. Our waitress and the seating hostess were very nice, but the busboys were the complete opposite. Dropped baskets of bread on our table, never refilled our water glasses, unhelpful when asked if he could help us track down our waitress.
Love this place! Always busy, always good. Can't wait to go back soon for more good eats and good drinks!
Excellent! Joe is great, will guide you to ordering and having a great time! Food very good.

Was randomly poking around OpenTable on Friday and quite fortuitously, somebody had canceled their 7:30 pm reservation at this place.  No other reservations available until 10 pm, nearly 3000 reviews and 4 stars on yelp, reviews mentioning 45 minute to two hour waits, plus having been to Barcelona before with good memories of Spanish tapas - it was perfect. This restaurant is has a very unassuming outward appearance but inside the place is huge, always packed and quite loud.  The parking across the street is free; the parking in front of the restaurant is usually available but is metered.  The food is great - especially the paella.  Order the seafood paella immediately when the waiter comes to the table - it takes 40 minutes for them to prepare it, so you want them cooking it while you decide on everything else.  We had four people and a 2-serving paella plus 7 tapas was too much for us.  6 tapas probably would've worked. We had: - Paella - Amazing, aromatic and delicious. - Stuffed mushrooms - These were very good, really liked the melted manchego - Catalan bread - Simple but quite authentic and typical of Spanish tapas - Short rib - Didn't actually think much of this.  It's a meat and potatoes dish with nothing special. - Empanada - Not Spanish but it tasted good. - Octopus - This was probably my favorite dish of the night.  Loved the mix of flavors. - Chicken and Ham Croquetas - These were cooked well, not over-fried. - Potato and onion omelette - Somewhat overcooked, it was fine but not amazing. Will be back.  If another reservation opens up.
Damn that butterscotch custard............ also the stuffed mushrooms were unreal and hanger steak made the vegetarianism break real worth it ya ya

Our friends hosted a b'day party in the Granada Room and I was thoroughly impressed with the different courses of tapas brought in by the unflustered waiters....it was tightly packed for a crowd of 50 including kids but the service was top notch with the drinks and all! certainly see why we all keep coming back here!!

We were there on a Friday night. Very busy. We called to be on their waitlist and then showed up and then they texted us when our table was ready. Very easy. I am gluten and dairy free and our waiter (maximiella) was awesome about knowing the food. We got a ton and everything was great. And everyone was happy. And for a super busy place, it wasn't as loud as I was expecting. And the service was actually very fast and really great.   Items sampled:  chorizo wrapped dates (gooey, hot and always good) salmon with confit fennel (so good) deviled egg (1 tiny 1/2 egg. good. Nothing special) patatas bravas (got a kick, very good. lots of food) brussel sprout salad (raw. Very good and light.) garlic shrimp (not kidding with the garlic) chicken and chorizo skewer (1 skewer, small, good) hanger steak (very unique flavor and cooked perfectly).   The desserts sounded great, but we were full!

I went here on a date and although I won't be going back with him I definitely have brought my family and friends here afterwards... The beef with horseradish sauce is amazing and i love the sangria pitchers... They had a delicious ahi tuna dish that they no longer make which is so disappointing because I loved in and got it every time.. I was obsessed.. Bring that back Café Babareeba loll.

What a great time and awesome food. Portion smalls duh its tapas but keep in mind the bill racks up fast. Well worth it and would defiantly go back again. Service is fast and quick. Try to get a seat in the outdoor area.

This was my first time visit, and as soon as I entered the room, someone was there to greet you. They were very busy on a Wednesday night. We had a reservation so we didn't wait long but if you don't, the wait was an hour and a half. You can stay by the bar area until your table is available.  We ordered different tapas. I loved the beef empanada, grilled steak, and garlic shrimp. Some were very salty like the squid. I didn't realize that it takes a long time for the paella to come, which was unfortunate because by the time it was out, I was full. I ate a little bit of it, but I found it really salty. I added lemons to mine and it was palatable after that. The acidity from the lemons muted that saltiness of the dish.  it was my friend's birthday and the server was so sweet! There was a dessert sampler, and that was amazing. The flavors were rich and not overly sweet. We also had a white sangria, which I LOVED.  I would come back here again for the tapas but steer away from the paella. I would love to try other dishes since there's many options!

I don't think there's much I could say here that hasn't been said.  First: prepare for a wait- this place is always, always crazy busy. But it's great for a group, especially small celebrations, so it's worth it.  Bacon wrapped dates are worth the trip in from the burbs themselves, so please be sure to try those.  The sangria is obviously a go-to, and I have liked almost all the flavors I've tried.  My least favorite thing I've had here is the paella. I think I'll stick with the unique small plates from now on- this is the place to try something new because you're almost guaranteed to love it.

Oh Cafe Ba Ba Reeba... if only I could bring you home with me. I've loved this place since my sister took me 10 years ago when she lived in Chicago, and I have to say my heart broke a little when I found out there is one in Las Vegas the week after visiting. Seriously, this place is so good it may be the answer to world peace.  I've never had a single dish that is bad and this trip was no different. Definitely try to more traditional tapas - tortilla espanola, croquetas, patatas bravas, pulpo... it's making my mouth water just to think about it! My husband and I also shared 1/2 pitcher of the pomegranate sangria that was a feature and it was phenomenal. 1/2 pitcher was about 3 glasses each as they are short glasses. A couple glasses of sangria and some tortilla and you'll feel as though you've been transported to a bar in Puerto del Sol.  The space is surprisingly big but I would still highly recommend a reservation to avoid an hours long wait. Even though I would totally hours to eat here. I can't wait for our next Chicago visit and next Ba Ba Reeba experience!

What's not to love? Tapas! Great service! Great food, I love the scallops but I'm a scallops kinda girl you know? Couple two tree scallops make everything gorgeous!  I like to go here win big parties of people and have a great time they have excellent sangria and deserts omg so good.

Ok. This is my second time here and I really enjoyed the service and the food. Everything was spot on!  I had Mezcal Mule and it was awesome - a small kick with the pepper!  Loved it!  Try the goat cheese in tomatoes sauce. It was great!  Don't eat the free bread - it will just slow you down!

Everybody knows that CBBR is a happening spot. I'm not sure if it's because it fosters the kind of camaraderie that is only forged when you share too-small amounts of delicious food, or the drinks. Seriously, though, you only have to show up most any night to see that there are a whole slew of people who had the same idea you did: eat good food with good friends, and have a great time. Recommendations: Patatas Bravas Escargot, when available Fried Chicken Thighs w/PiriPiri Sauce Grilled Hanger Steak Burrata Marcona Almond dessert Creme Brulee, when available White Peach Sangria

Got one of the "pinxos" which actually means tapas in Euskara (Basque language) - so don't BS me with your marketing lol --- got the Iberico chorizo one...lackluster and they really put an American spin on tapas and chisel you, it was literally a toothpick with a slice of chorizo...unbelievable -Then we got the spicy potatoes - those were good for potatoes -The beef short rip - pretty good I guess -The fried calamari - yeaaaah, nothing special there -And the famous chicken thighs - give me a f'ing break, it was like grocery store frozen chicken that you serve to your unhealthy kids because you're too tired to cook after work -....oh an for dessert we had the chocolate truffle cake --- tapas size!?!? Get outta here! And the service....the epitome of an American experience. Rushing you out of the restaurant. Literally every 7-10 minutes was, "Is everything alright?" and when we weren't even done she was pushing the dessert, we were taking our time talking, kept coming back, like 3-4 times to ask if we were ready. I almost asked her if she wanted us to leave. It's like, please let us enjoy our company with each other and talk after a long day, I'll call you when I'm ready, please go away! *sigh*...so it goes...but I won't be going back. Tapas in the USA is a gimmick!
The best restaurant in Chicago. The service is always fantastic and they are great for groups and privatizing rooms.

Came for happy hour and loved it! Bar seating can get tight but the atmosphere is lively an fun so we didn't mind waiting. Jug of sangria + bites of perfectly layered tapas + good conversation = great evening! We'll be back.
Great food and awesome prices! The braised short ribs and mashed potatoes were great. The chocolate truffle is to die for!
The bacon wrapped dates were delicious. & the sangria was GREAT. everything we had was great.

Super fun place. Sangria- yes please! Try them all. We had- stuffed mushrooms, olives, potato salad, egg& potato pancake and veggie paella. Happy. Full. Great service . Great vibe. Great food. Excellent night ! Do it! We will be back. : ) P:S: we walked right in at 6:00 on a Thursday night, sat at the bar for our first sangria, and were seated by 7:00.  If it's a weekend or later at night, obviously make a reservation.

The food is always amazing here! My personal favorites are the patatas bravas, bacon wrapped dates, and the burrata but you really can't go wrong with anything on the menu. The atmosphere is lively and Cafe Ba Ba Reeba is a go-to whenever I have friends in town.

Cute and interesting tapas bar with great food and drinks. It seems to be a very popular place with almost all the tables and bar full. Service was a little slow but it was also busy. Overall quite pricey for what you get.

I have no idea what all of the fuss is about this place.  The tapas was OK.  I have had much better.  Our waiter was great.  He was friendly and very good about making recommendations.  If you are a Spanish tapas fan you can do better.
We hosted our daughters party here  great staff and food , everything was perfect .
I lived in southern Spain for 3 years...the food reminded me of Spain.  Everyting tasted exactly how it shoild. Definitely recommend to anyone wanting to experience Spanish food!

Lame. Food is average at best. We ordered several plates and all were ok, but just that. Service is slow, everything took time, even the beverages. On top of these, the place smells all the time. We got out with our clothes and hair smelling. Bad experience overall, I can't recommend this place.

Great tapas and sangria! I loved all the dishes we tried from the spicy potatoes to the bacon wrapped dates. The short ribs were amazing and tender and the chicken and ham croquette were scrumptious. Make sure you go early because the place is alway packed.
Tapas were portioned well and had flavor. Will try the others on another visit. Paella was reasonably priced but was a bit salty- ordered the pork confit for two.

Was first treated very rudely by one bartender, super inconvenienced and arrogant. HOWEVER, I need to mention that our time was made much more pleasant once Luis took over. He smiled and was more than willing to keep us at the bar. Very kinda bartender, he also took off a mistake the other bartender made once we got our bill.
