Not to mention I saw he tried asking the rude bartender about it and was treated the same way we were. Keep smiling and being amazing Luis, because of you we will be back and hope to sit with you.
My favourite restaurant in the city! Worth the wait for sure. Also amazing tapas dishes.
This is one of the best spots in chicago! Food, service and overall experience is phenomenal. Highly recommend if you like small plates.

This place is one of the best in the city for Tapas style food. The Cafe offers a wide variety of dishes for everyone's pallet. They have wine flights, decent beers on tap, and great deals on sangria pitchers. If you don't want to sit at a table, the place also has an extensive bar with TVs. While the place is pretty big, you will likely want to get a reservation as this place is pretty popular. If you are lucky, you may be able to snag one of the 2 tables that are located outside. Bring your friends and you won't be disappointed.

This is going to be one of those places that you cannot avoid going to if you live in Chicago. I really think this place is a solid 3.5, but rounding up, because I think rounding down is just mean. I think this is a solid option if you need to go somewhere with a large group of people. There aren't that many tapas-style restaurants in Chicago, and this is usually one that is generally a crowd pleaser. The Bacon-Wrapped Dates, Brussel Sprouts, and Goat Cheese are my favorites on the menu. The menu is GIANT though, so I think you will be hard-pressed to find something you won't like. Especially if you go for brunch, because you can order off both the brunch and dinner menu. This restaurant is certainly not a destination in my mind, but it does the trick if you need to go somewhere with a lot of people, and you might have some picky eaters in the crowd. The Paella is absolutely a pass though. I've tried it multiple times, and never liked it. They also have certain days that only happen a couple times a year, where if you come in wearing pajamas, they give each person at your table a $25 gift card. Look out for those, because those days are pretty clutch.

Not worth waiting 2.5 hours if you don't have a reservation... If by chance you happen to eat here, great, but not worth it in my opinion...  3 stars is for: 1. Not sweet red Sangria, which is hard to find these days for some weird reason 2. Tender octopus 3. Tender short ribs If the review was based on paella, it would have gotten 1 star... The paella was subpar (we got their recommended pork paella), and they took away the paella pan...who does that!  That's the best part about paella! The way the rice crisps on the bottom of the pan & keeps the paella warm as it sits on your table... Instead the server brought the paella in the pan, but divided it up in portions & served it in regular tapas plates...fail!  The deviled egg was not worth it for $2.5 for a half an egg that was way over cooked & the filling was meh :( Overall, I don't understand how this place got almost 3k reviews at 4 stars... Def a tourist attraction.

A friend of mine and I wanted to get out and try some place "different" so did some searching "Best Restaurants of Chicago" then realized...I get discounted parking in Lincoln Park, why not go there? So I searched "Best Restaurants of Lincoln Park" and found this place, I've heard of it, but never been there and it's been a long time since I had some good Tapas.  Thankfully I was able to make a reservation on Open Table for either 6:30 or 8pm, I took the 6:30 - the place was packed the entire time! There is $13 valet for those looking to drive there and not look for parking by the way... I'm not sure if it was loud in there or our speaker just spoke softly, but it was a little hard to hear him.  I ordered a few different things off the menu, my friend ordered the chicken paella for two and ate the entire thing.  We ordered a pitcher of the raspberry sangria...it was great!  And...free dessert with yelp check in!   The best thing was, I was full...not food-coma full, but pleasantly full and with tip paid about $50 each, which isn't bad - I've paid much more dining at a good place in the city minus all that! It was a great experience overall.  I already have a few things in mind for when we return.

Who doesn't love tapas. Amendment: who doesn't love tapas at a place that has 5 varieties of sangria. My sister and I were in the area, and it's her favorite restaurant. We didn't have a reservation, but we thought we'd try out luck. At 5:15 on a Saturday, we were seated no problem. We found our table and immediately were presented with a basket of rustic bread- crusty outside, soft inside. And that was just the bread, friends. First order of real business was ordering sangria. I'm not one for sweet drinks, so we went with the Cava variety. It was pretty good. Still a little sweet, but not bad. We ordered a whole pitcher for 2 people (ambitious, I know). It was a lot of carbonation considering how many glasses we ended up having, but tasty nonetheless.  An order of the Brussel sprout salad, albondigas, and chicken & ham croquettas later, we were feeling full. This is when we started to regret filing up on all the bread and sangria. We paused as I checked-in on Yelp. To our surprise, there was a check-on offer! And very serendipitously, it was for a free dessert tapa. We took that as our sign to return the dinner menu and take a look at the sweet offerings they had. We went with the butterscotch caramel custard. It was pretty good.

Great brunch with room for large groups if you get a reservation. We ordered small plates to share, and it was extremely affordable while we were able to get stuffed. Our favorite dishes were bacon Mac, short rib bocadillo, and citrus French toast. Have a fun Bloody Mary bar to top off your brunch. I am excited for next time to try the breakfast paella.

Great food and atmosphere! Very lively on a Friday night. We sat at the bar and enjoyed our drinks and food, including: red wine sangria, seared cana de cabra with jam & honey, patatas bravas, stuffed mushrooms, hanger steak, and the spanish affogato.

Came here to celebrate two birthdays and it was great. The service was amazing and the food was delicious. I would recommend a reservation if having dinner. Between the two times we were there we had everything on the menu and about 90% of the menu items I loved. Highly recommend

One of my favorite restaurants in the city! Always get the sangria and the brussels sprout salad (#22), or goat cheese baked in tomato sauce (#32). They have amazing small desserts and port wine, as well. Definitely get a reservation on the weekend, even the bar is busy, but worth the call ahead and the wait. Also, bar is full service, so you can eat at it!

The experience I had here was pretty good. The tapas I'm used to are from hole-in-the-wall, very authentic flavored and strong Spanish-inspired plates. I understand tapas are supposed to be small, but the portions for the price were almost bite-sized.  We ordered the salmon, bacon-wrapped dates, chicken and ham croquetas, Jamón, chicken empanada, and the short rib. Everything was pretty average, all lacking flavor and spice. In no way would I say what we ordered was bad- the dates, short rib, and chicken empanada were above mediocre and enjoyable to eat. We also ordered the confit pork shoulder paella which was definitely worth the money. We followed the server's advice and fried an egg the next morning to put over the left over paella which was a great mid morning snack. We also ordered two sangria pitchers which were both very good. I really liked that they added vodka to the sangria to give it that extra kick. The only advice I'd give regarding the pitchers would be to bump it up with some better fruit than apple. But I understand since their sangria is on tap that the fruit isn't soaking in the sangria to add flavor, it's merely there for garnish. All in all I would return again, but I won't be going out of my way!
love, love, love this place! we visited Spain and I realized how close the food is at Baba Reeba to the actual Spanish tapas. Love their peach sangria!

Sooooooo DELICIOUS!!!! The menu is vast and everything we got was amazing! The spot is great for big groups, date night, or girls night out. It's super casual and laid back but the flavors are anything but casual. Definitely recommend the house sangria pitcher... So yummy! The location is outside the city so might be tricky for some people to get to but the train brings you right there. Real cute area and nice break from the city. Eventho this is tapas we left super full and less than $100.. Worth every single dollar spent. The ambiance and staff complete this amazing experience.

I came here for brunch. It had everything you like for breakfast just small plates so you can have it all!!! Very busy place so I don't recommend coming here with a big crowed unless you have reservations.

The Brunch Tapas menu here is literally the best. I live out in the suburbs and getting brunch at this restaurant is worth the trip. I first went with a group and ordered the peach sangria, the hash, and the Nutella waffles. I was not disappointed. My cocktail was crowned with delicious chunks of fruit, including apples, which I let sit in the cocktail and absorb it for a delicious after cocktail treat. I definitely recommend ordering at least a half pitcher especially if one in your party orders it as well. The buttermilk waffle with marcona almond Nutella and bananas is deep wonderfully balanced and not too sweet. A great dish if you're craving the sweeter side of breakfast. If you're craving the savory side of breakfast I loved the ham hash with vegetables, potatoes and poached egg, it was perfectly seasoned and a great way to start off my meal. 10/10 brunch recommendation. I went back a second time and ordered the same thing. I can't say enough good things about this place. If I had one complaint it would be that the place can get loud if you are seated near large groups.

A+  A+  A+  A+   Is all I can say about Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba.  Absolutely Outstanding!!  I have never in my life been to a tapas establishment where every single entree that came out was off the charts delicious and excellent in creativity and presentation. When we walked up to this eatery it was packed inside.  There were people in front of us who said "This place is always packed", let me tell you, I can see why!!!   I came to this place many years ago on a very lame blind date and although the date sucked to high hell the food was great then and it is still great now, true love doesn't die LOL!.  That being said on to the love/yum fest:   #43 Octopus With Shishito peppers, charred romescu, smoker fingerlings and pearl onions=  I give this one an A+!!  And please forgive me for being so excited about this dish that I started stuffing my face before taking a photo of it.  But take my word, it was great.  There are so many amateur chefs out here who don't know how to cook Octopus but not here, it was done to perfection and the integration of all of the other ingredients makes this a master piece. #51 Rioja-braised short rib, manchego mashed potatoes, roasted vegetable and rioja wine glaze = A+++  Meat so moist and full of flavor that it just melts in your mouth.  These chefs here have mad skills.  If you follow any of my other reviews you know of my constant complaints of some of these people out here who cook meat so poorly, where it is so dry and tough that it is like chewing on a leather bag or what I like to call "meat gum"!  Not here my friends, not here.  Everything at Cafe Ba-Ba is done to perfection.  They should open up a chef school and teach some of these other places how it's done.  And the glaze and the veggies on the plate were superb.    #63 Chicken and Ham Croquetas = A+++++   Another winner. I think Cafe Ba Ba is the first establishment that I have ever given As out on every single dish, I guess that makes them the valedictorian of restaurants. I should also add that the service was also good.   We sat at the bar and even though the bartender was super busy he still gave good service.  I was driving so he made me a Virgin Sangria that was also, you guessed it, A+++. And for food that is so good, I have to say that the prices here are really reasonable. I wish every review I wrote could be this good, but unfortunately that can't all be, but I guess that is what makes it all the more special when it does happen.  Cafe Ba Ba Reeba deserves 100 stars.

My sister decided to host my bridal shower at a private room at Cafe Ba Ba Reeba last weekend, and I cannot stop raving about it!  We were seated in the larger backroom, which comfortably fit about 28 people, including the two staff members. My sister picked the middle package (paella, salmon and bread, bacon wrapped dates, eggs benedict, french toast) and it was ALL delicious. The guests (and myself!) could not stop raving about how good it was, and the service was phenomenal. We did a drink package for two hours, and the servers were very prompt with filling the drinks that no one even noticed when the bar service ended.  Again, the staff made the event so easy! With all the commotion of picture taking and gift opening, I ended up accidentally knocking over a pitcher (whoops..) and the servers immediately cleaned it up...without making me feel bad/disrupting the event.  Overall, I would absolutely recommend Cafe Ba Ba Reeba's private event space for a bridal shower. It was a wonderful day I won't soon forget :)
Happy hour is such a deal. Good food and service. Bacon wrapped dates are to die for.

While I don't dine at Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba more than a few times a year, it certainly gets 5 stars from me. The restaurant is very loud with high energy, so keep that in mind! Their sangria is a must, and I recommend a pitcher if you're with more than 2 people. It's ALWAYS busy, so you should make a reservation.

Haven't been here in years and am in town for work and decided to head back. I love tapas and this place is perfect for it! Usually order 3 plates for each person at your table for sharing. We ordered the passion fruit sangria- very good and they use real fruit. For plates- goat cheese with tomato, Brussel sprout salad, beef empanada, bacon wrapped dates, spicy potatoes, and garlic shrimp. Everything was so good especially the dates and the empanada. Also by checking in you get a free desert- caramelized bananas were so good!! Would go back again- cool atmosphere and great service!

Been here a couple times mainly for the good vibes and the sangria + tapas combination (their pomogranate sangria is so refreshing!) Make sure to ask your servers about the portion for each dish, since sometimes 3-4 can be filling for one person, but sometimes 2 is enough. Their paella, short ribs, and spicy potatoes are my favorite dinner dishes, and most items from the brunch menus are delicious. Dessert-wise; the butterscotch custard probably stands out the most. The chocolate truffle cake is also good, but nothing special about it, and the pomegranate sorbet was waaay too sour. However, it's a great place to hang out and have good conversations over a wide variety of dishes and sangria (plus the good service) so I'll be back again! Tips:  - Reservation is definitely recommended since Cafe Babareeba is almost always packed (yes, even on weekdays).   - If you check in here on Yelp you also get one free dessert tapas per PERSON. So... the more people you bring, the more dessert tapas you get ;D

5 stars for being my own personal brunch dream come true. I am a die hard fan of brunch, paella, tapas and sangria so this place obviously is right up my alley. Every single thing on the menu is excellent. Some tapas are bigger than other but you can always ask the server. For example, the sandwiches are much bigger than the tapas and Benedicts. The Pinxtos (one or two bites) are so clever, who doesn't face the classic dilemma of sweet or savory for brunch!? Well here, you can have it all! Including multiple sweet and savory. The paella definitely serves more than 2-3 as it claims. We had a party of 9 and didn't finish it (granted we all got one other thing plus some Pinxtos). We loved the seasonal sangria, Pomegranate and we downed it quick. Next we go the classic red sangria, and after ordering, we kind of regretted getting it for brunch, only because I think a lighter wine/sangria suits brunch better, but thats just all up to personal taste.  Personal top recommendations: White Wine, Rose or Sparkling Sangria of any type, Chicken Stick, Berry Waffles and Cubano!

My wife and I goto Cafe Ba Ba Reeba for the seafood piyah!  This is a tapas style restaurant, with a cool mellow vibe. The sangria is a must, the wait is a bit much though, even if you make a reservation be prepared for a wait. Overall good spot for a date

This place brunches So Hard! And the service is spectacular! Thank you so much to Seba for influencing my table to get the breakfast paella. He also was very accommodating to my no dine on swine rule and made the switch to Chicken Sausage.   Then the butterscotch custard was literally To Die For

Fun environment and surprisingly large restaurant, have been here a few times always busy but not overwhelming. Definitely recommend reservations on weekends as the wait can be lengthy, but if you are just a couple, there are two bars which you can typically slide right into and eat at the bar. The tapas are very filling(which isn't always the case with tapas) and priced reasonably, I always plan on getting the paella but end up too full from tapas!  and I'm always a fan of a place that offers wine flights- the sangria is amazing too! Also close to other bars if you do have a wait!

Spanish tapas & sangria? Count me in. It was our first time here and I'm sure there will be plenty more visits in the future. Don't forget to make reservations ahead of time, especially if dining on the weekends. We were lucky enough to get last minute reservations on a Friday night. The place was already packed even before 6 p.m. Right off the bat we got a pitcher of the white peach sangria. Had just the right amount of sweetness and was super refreshing. Probably could have drank the whole pitcher to myself it was THAT good. For the tapas, we got a little too excited and ordered more food that our stomachs could handle. Between the two of us we ordered 6 plates and a dessert, which were: - Chorizo wrapped dates (#1) - Deviled egg (#5) - Spicy potatoes & tomato aioli (#30) - Citrus cured salmon (#40) - Octopus (#43) - Serrano ham, salchichon, & chorizo (#61) - Caramelized banana Very satisfied with all the items we ordered. Everything was delicious! Can't wait to come back and try more, especially the paella.  They also have happy hour at the bar Monday-Friday from 4 to 6 and Friday/Saturday 10 to midnight, which includes $16 pitchers of the classic sangria, $1 pintxos, and select tapas for less than $3.50. *Don't forget to check in on Yelp to redeem a free dessert! Highly recommended the caramelized banana.
Long time Chicago staple.  Great for groups...spicy potates are amazing!

Great food. Everything is delicious.  The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because of the service. Our waitress took away our sangria pitcher before we had finished it. A bus boy took away our basket of bread even though it was still full and we were still sitting there munching on it.  Everyone there seems to be in a rush. Like, stop taking away our food and drink please. That's what we came here for. Don't take that away from me.

This was the best food we have ever had!! The atmosphere is so chill yet elegant at the same time. The food is planned so well and the flavors are unbelievable. We are so glad we found a hip yet delicious place to come for date night

One of our favorite spots, lots of changes In mgmt, menu, food and few drinks... Some dishes have changed and even flavor but still enjoy it as well as the atmosphere. Summer time is busy so make reservation!!

We've been here twice for tapas!  The service is good, sangria options are great!  I like that they have Open Table as well.  Everything is fresh and yummy- great sharing portions for a group of people.

Loove this restaurant! It's truly a wonderful dining experience from the moment you walk in.  The atmosphere is what you would find in a Spanish restaurant and the service is superb. The tapas are tasty and flavorful.  Each dish has a unique taste and the restaurant is fast to bring them out.   Sangria is to die for and they always have various flavors to suit many palates. Overall if you're looking for a great tapas in Chicago, you have to checkout Babareeba.

Really enjoyed a romantic dinner for two at Ba-Ba-Reeba. Between the two of us we ordered about ten plates, all of which were great. We especially loved both of the stuffed date dishes (yes, we got stuffed dates twice) and the sangrias. Perfect place for a date, dinner with friends, or if you want to try a little bit of everything.

This is my 2nd favorite restaurant in Chicago.  (I'm still on the quest to find the 1st) Love the atmosphere, the music, the service and the food.   I've been coming here since they opened and have driven from the N.W. suburbs just to get food to take home.   I don't mind waiting it out for a table on a Saturday night either.  I really like this place.
Had Karl for a server this evening and he was great. He helped us choose some dishes and all were great suggestions. Enjoyed the good as well as the service and ambiance.
It was my first time here and I was absolutely blown away. Will be back for half off wine bottles on Tuesdays!!

Ba-ba-Reeba definition: being quick to deliver excitement There aren't very many tapas restaurants where I come from (and it's not in the middle of nowhere or the country). Simply put - tapas are not good in my hometown. I had a bad experience where they just plopped some pre-made stuff onto tiny plates and called that tapas. Upon stepping into this dimly lit place in Lincoln Park called Ba-Ba-Reeba (with a lunch reservation this time, I've finally figured you Chicagoans out!), we were seated right away in a snug but romantic corner near the back.  Frantically flipping through both sides of the menu we didn't know what to order since what we wanted wasn't on their menu. The night before, we compiled a list of numbers we wanted to order ahead of time. We were given a lunch and brunch menu, but all the numbers we chose weren't on there. Where's #41 - anchovies and #43 - the fried green peppers?!?! Rest assured our awesome server, Tim said anything goes if it's online. Now why in the world would they hide these delectable dishes? I'm sorry if anchovies and hot peppers offend you. Maybe that's why those numbers are invisible during lunch/brunch hours. The build your own bloody mary bar seemed interesting as you can put whatever skewer shit you want in there as the server gives you a shot a vodka. I saw a guy with like 6 skewers jammed in his cup! Where we were seated, I don't think I would've made it down the stairs, to the left, between all the tables, servers running around, just to get to the corner of the bar without falling after my BAC is probably above the legal limit in my state. I settled with the classic red sangria which wasn't too sweet, quite strong, and topped with fruit. It was tasty and I soon found out I felt buzzed, walking down a few steps to the women's bathroom which had 3 stalls, 1 sink, and I couldn't effing see anything in there let alone find the TP in the stall. The girls line was long when I came out. I'm assuming these girls had one too many drinks and needed to tinkle bad like me. Drunkness aside. The food was FANTASTIC imho. Anchovies topped with an olive tapenade paired well with the complimentary bread and evoo. Toasty catalan tomato bread topped with arugula and Manchego cheese triangles was delicious. The meatballs with sherry tomato sauce was simply divine as I sopped up the sauce with bread. If you go, the charcuterie plate (plato de la casa) is a must if you're a cured meat lover. We also ordered a breakfast paella which took about 30 minutes and was served sizzling hot table side. Well worth the wait. The bomba rice was perfectly cooked and I loved the crispy rice bits. The bill for 2 was about $100 w/tips, but we dined like a king and queen. Was Ba-ba Reeba quick to deliver excitement? I believe so, as I felt like a giddy kid in a candy store drooling, but in this case, over to-die-for sangria, tapas, and paella. This is redemption for having fake tapas in the past.

Vegetarian review--We didn't get the paella, so if I had maybe I'd have been happier. We weren't too impressed. And I was disappointed because it's been around so long and I felt like the only one left who hadn't been there yet. I have to say, when I ordered the roasted peppers I  didn't expect to just get literally 8 little peppers, roasted. That's it. $6. Seriously. No sauce or even 1 other thing on the plate. That was a condiment, not a dish. The garlic potato salad was ok, but isn't that American grocery store stuff? I only ordered it because I ran out of choices. Didn't say "Spain" to me. The waiter said paella takes 45 minutes...so after the first round its too late for that. Wish i knew that...45 minutes!!! Really? So people wait 45 minutes for a meal here? I was starving still after about 5 shared dishes that were sooo small, so I ordered the omlet. Two of them. They were huge and it was toward the end of the meal...I didn't want an omlet for dinner, but after trying pretty much the whole veggie section, they were they same price as the meat items and there was not enough food. Why on earth would there be an omlet on the dinner menu? Chick pea stew was pretty good and a decent size. They need to get something with some substance on the veggie menu. And get rid of the omlet, it wasnt even very good. But at least it made me full. The good: spicy potatoes, the mushrooms and chick pea stew. The bad: roasted peppers, potato salad, omlet, brussel sprouts salad (no taste). The ugly: $50 each with tip and only getting full because of the omlet. Now, I've been to other tapas places, and they were amazing. This place IMO, is not much, at least for a vegetarian.

Favorite tapas restaurant! Never a disappointment. Tried almost all tapas from their menu. Last time we actually ordered sea food paella, it was very good! Sangria is one of my favorite drinks and at Cafe they do great job making it and have a good variety. Our server gave us great suggestion when it came to desert.  Only recommendation is to make sure you make reservations before you go in. The wait can be a pain in you know what  Love the fact that they have 4 seasons porch.  They offer brunch as well as lunch. Are children  friendly with kids menu. Also offer gluten free chooses!  Thumbs up!

I usually like trying Spanish restaurants when Im visiting a city, and this was the best decision I made in Chicago. It was authentic Spanish food. Probably the best seafood Paella I have had in the US. The sangria was awesome and the gambas al ajillo are a must. Excellent service as well! Highly recommended.

Tapas isn't my favorite, but Ba-Ba-Reeba makes for a pretty consistently good time. I haven't eaten a lot of their seemingly tasty food, but I'd like to share a few little known treats. Let's not forget that when you say tapas to a suburbanite, the consistent responses are Ba-Ba-Reeba and Cafe Iberico.    Firstly, come to the build your own bloody mary brunch on the weekends. Those who know me understand that I've had a rather fickle relationship with this much celebrated tomato based drink. Brunch, itself, is a meal that rather confounds me, but I've made my peace with the bloody after discovering the world of 'build your own.' Not arguing that the BYOBloody is the best in the city... it's simply a solid selection of side items such as kosher dill pickles, tasty bacon strips, olives and of course, celery. Zing Zang is the standard in bloody mixes, and they keep it pouring at Ba-Ba-Reeba.  The other interesting factoid about this well appointed spanish themed venue, is that they offer an unbeatable deal for New Years Day. If you show up in your pajamas on the first day of the year, they'll provide a gift card in the amount that you spent. My friends call it eating your bill. The only catch is make a reservation... and invest in some warm pajamas!
Loved the open Bloody Mary bar and the food was really good.  The service was fast..and the staff is very friendly

Best Tapas menu in Chicago! The variety of dishes satisfy your palette because the flavors are there. Must have the bacon wrapped dates & always get the pitcher of sangria! Note: make a reservation regardless of party size.

Came here on a Friday night. We sat at the bar and it took a bit for the bartender to notice us. We ordered the planxa apps which were delicious! The octopus was great. It was in a red sauce. My fiancé thought it was a bit soggy but I enjoyed it! Since we both checked in we got the free dessert- chocolate fudge and cheesecake. It was the perfect size. They also have happy hour after 10pm which was awesome! The only reason why I rated this place 4 stars is because the bartender forgot about us and we had to chase him down.

I have been coming to this restaurant for 6+ years and LOVE IT. With that being said my experience on 2/24 was awful. We had a table for 11 and our server continued to mess up our orders. I have only ever dined at this restaurant as a vegan and have never had an issue, on this particular night every small plate I ordered came to the table without the correct substitution. I at one point asked where an order was and she put in another order for the particular item as it arrived to our table, I told her never mind we did not need the order to be put in again and she acknowledged that. About 10 minutes later another order for that same menu item arrived at our table... She was just awful all around, zero attention to detail, could not get a single thing correct. Who ever serviced the party of 11 under my name on 2/24 needs some serious retraining because that is not the level of service I have come to expect from Lettuce Entertain You establishments. Very disappointed that this is the caliber of employee representing the restaurant during prime time.

After being in Barcelona, I was happy to check out all my favorite tapas here. It's never going to be exactly the same, but it was pretty close! And delicious! Potatoes bravas, deviled eggs, croquettes, tomato bread...yum! Oh, and don't forget the pitcher of sangria!
Hands down best tapas food in the Chicago-land area! I went there for my birthday and our waiter was friendly and delivered solid service.

Excellent brunch! It's definitely a good idea to get more than one tapas item off the menu, and add some sangria to the mix!  The bread is amazing to start off with. The brussel sprouts salad is also delicious and a great appetizer. I shared the veggie Benedict with a friend and loved this fish. Very flavorful, and the patatas bravas are tasty and spicy. I also had the iberco ham hash, which was pretty yummy as well. Dessert tapas were great too. The flan was average, but it went well with the afogato, which is like coffee ice cream in a sherry float.  The service was slow on this busy Sunday morning, but we had a great time! I am always up for some good tapas!

We rolled in late on a Sunday (before President's Day) with about 20 minutes left until the kitchen closed. We were starving and trying hard to find a place we could quick eat before they closed. Trying to be good patrons (and attempting for servers not to hate us for coming in so late), we ordered as soon as we sat down: Burrata (#23), shrimp w garlic (#44), short rib (#51), and bacon wrapped dates (#67).  The burrata is alright - I'm a fan of savory burrata, and the bitter tomato paste was a little on the sweet side for me. Still delicious.  The shrimp was my favorite...spicy, but manageable. A perfect in-between for Clark and my tastes.  Short rib is tried and true - tender and delicious. I'm always sad at the fact that it's a "small" plate.  Bacon wrapped dates are exactly as they sound, and the vinegar and apples they sit in really add a perfect bite to them. This was perfect for the two of us to fill up but not be stuffed. It was a quick and expensive dinner, but we definitely ate well! We love coming here and will absolutely be back more and more!

I've been coming here for years and this was the first time where I've honestly felt no need to come back to eat. The sangra is great and our waitress was a dear. When our food (over cooked dates that were thrown on our table) we spoke to the team and they were kind enough to understand the situation. The service here has gone down hill in the last year or so and the tapas are hit or miss. The patatas bravas are decent, but if you're looking to eat a good meal I'd suggest going elsewhere. The sangria is fine, so if you're looking to just drink it isn't a bad spot for 30 minutes. Probably won't be coming back.
Absolutely love the Brussels sprout salad and sangria!!! Ribs and steaks are awesome as well.

Great service, good food. Favorites were the filet with blue cheese, salmon, and garlic shrimp. Cheese and charcuterie plate were very good. Favorite desserts were the chocolate truffle and the cheese cake.
Huge fan, always have been. Need a bigger restaurant ! Huge/delicious menu, and tasty drinks. Love the ambiance.

I know that this is the tapas "staple" for most, because it's in Lincoln Park. The space is great, and the service is awesome. Unfortunately, the food is disappointing. The paella was a glob of greasy rice, with very little bit of the burnt part that makes a paella enjoyable. The empanadas are pretty good, I'll give em that.  The sangria is ok. The patatas bravas were a bit under-cooked as well.  I get it, most people wanna go to a safe franchise type place. I like the Lettuce group overall for their efficiency, but the food here is not good at all. There are many great tapas places in the city. Please, go try something new.

Very good tapas menu and excellent Sangria!  I really like the white Sangria and the bacon-wrapped dates.  The Paella is also good. Restaurant Week menu was no better than the regular prices when we went, which is my only downgrade on the rating.

The best tapas bar in all of Chicago! Has a lot of classic Spanish tapas as well as their own creative versions. When I have people in town visiting this is one of my favorite spots to take them. I have been for both dinner & brunch and really enjoyed everything we ordered both times. Always excited to try one of their many Sangria selections which are all tasty & refreshing. Usually there is a longer wait if you don't have a reservation ahead of time, but there are also plenty of bar spots if you are aggressive enough to hawk.
So oooo Spanish. God damn this place has a long wait. Prepare to get drunk next door as you wait for your table.  Order sangria  Octopus was good too.  Yeah it is tapas, nuff said.
Great atmosphere and friendly staff!  The food was well seasoned and the bloody bar was not bad.  Will have to try it out for dinner/lunch.  The brunch is definitely highly recommended!

This is a great spot for most occasions! We showed up around 7:45 as walk ins and waited about 30-45 minutes for a table. We ordered the passion fruit sangria and snacked on some complimentary bread before deciding on the beef tenderloin with blue cheese, chicken empanada and spicy potatoes. I usually order these as well as a few more items, but yesterday we were really in the mood for some sangria! We had the truffle cake for dessert, which did not disappoint. Service was prompt and waters were always full. The spicy potatoes never came, but it was one of those "for the best" moments because we were already full. This is one of those places that I will always come back to!
I love this place!!! This is perfect for brunch. Go with a bunch of people and try as many things as possible!! Definitely get a pitcher of sangria too!

Went for dinner last night for a GNO. Great service was appreciated. Super packed night but felt our order came out spaced just fine. Recommendation of their specials were perfect, especially the lamb chops. Pomegranate sangria was refreshing and delicious. This place never disappoints.

Delicious tapas! Absolutely love so many dishes on the menu!  The Sangria is excellent. (My favorite is the classic Red Sangria) Always enjoy the Bacon-Wrapped Dates, Baked Goat Cheese, Beef Tenderloin & Blue Cheese,  Meatballs, Spicy Potatoes, and Seafood Paella.  Must try the desserts as well!  Perfect for any occasion.  Always a great experience.

A big thank you to Manager, Jack! He made my first time visit at Cafe-Ba-Ba-Reeba! memorable! I was tired and had not eaten all day. When I arrived on Friday evening, I was told by the hostess that there was a 2 hour wait for a dining table or I could sit in the bar that was extremely crowded (I was not prepared for that long of a wait).  Jack found out about my situation and was extremely accommodating; he found a table for me within 10 minutes. The wait staff was very knowledgeable about the menu. The food and Sangria were excellent! I will definitely be back again. Thank you Jack!

Pretty spot on with how they do it in Spain! I lived in Northern Spain where pintxos are a big deal and I loved everything about this place. We tried the patatas bravas, the pork paella, the grilled hanger steak, and the passion fruit sangria and everything was so incredibly good. Impressed. Definitely would recommend and plan on telling everyone to check this place out!

So it's been ages since I had dined here but I have to say the place is still packin them in a churnin out some tastee tapas. The space is larger that it appears from the outside so don't expect an intimate dining experience. Meter parking is an option but sometimes limited ...they do offer valet @$13. It gets packed but they do a great job accommodating the crowds and crankin out the food. Nice wine and beer selection and of course sangria. The tapas we sampled were all well prepared and fresh and although fairly typical defiantly prepared to order. The service was nice and knowledgeable and kept the ball rolling on a busy nite. So if your in the mood for some tapas this old standby is still working like a fine oiled machine. Oh and make sure to checkin to receive a free dessert.

Really cool place! Good for get togethers with friends, dates or family dinners! Went with 2 friends after work and we all split the short rib, brussel sprout salad, spicy potatoes, and stuffed mushroom tapas. Meal also included unlimited bread and olive oil for dipping. What we ordered would have fed 4 although we had 3. We also had a pitcher of the house sangria. The food and ambiance was great. Definitely plan on going back there again

This is one of my absolute favorite restaurants in Chicago! BaBa is good for both dinner and brunch (great value for brunch, incidentally), and it has a great selection of tapas and sangrias. I can't wait until my next visit.

Love love love this place!  Reminds me of being in Barcelona and sampling all kinds of tapas. Have not tried the paella yet but it looks good. I've over enjoyed the Sangria a few time and would return just for that. Favorites include the chicken, octopus, bacon wrapped dates, calamari and garlic shrimp!  It's easy to over order and over eat here!  Loud and lively

Visited last night, and oh my are these tapas good!! What we had (that I can remember): - Short rib - Lamb - Steak with blue cheese - Patatas bravas - Deviled eggs - Beef empanadas  - Southern fried chicken - Pork paella Everything was amazing! I especially loved the steak with blue cheese and the short rib was a major standout for the table. I tried a few different sangrias as well, and all were refreshing and wonderful. I preferred the peach over the berry sangria, however, both were extremely balanced flavors. I love that the sangria is on tap, too! If you don't have a reservation, the wait can be daunting. Although there is seating in the bar area, it's somewhat minimal. Regardless of the crowd and horrendous wait (1.5 hours for a bar table!) I'm so glad we stuck it out. Deeeelish!

Yum! Went here for an anniversary dinner with my wife and loved the variety and subtle gorgeous flavors of the offerings. Once of those places that you walk into and can tell just by the smell that it's outstanding.

My friends and I came to Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba for restaurant week at first, but then was attracted by their variety of tapas. So we ordered 4 tapas and 2 serving of seafood paella. Everything is delicious, and the service was also excellent! It gets crowded easily in weekends, therefore making reservation is highly recommended. But I think the food is also worth the waiting time~~~

Me and my husband had a great experience the food was awesome and the service was great. Our server was very nice but what made our night memorable was the bus boy Miguel he was great had great feed back on the food and what to try since it was my first time here. He was so nice and really made us feel at home! Thank you Miguel!!

Love Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba! The food and drinks are great along with the atmosphere.  Our favorite dishes are the potatoes, meatballs, and macaroni and cheese but we've had very few things that we didn't like here.
Nice decor. Each room was different. We had some really good dishes too. The portions were good for a tapas place. The spinach & goat cheese crepes and the breakfast paella were both solid dishes.

It wasn't packed, but we got stuck in a far back room, that no one else was in...in the back corner of that room. It was super weird.  I think we ordered the wrong things, cuz I know everyone loves this place. We got a cheese board, which was super lack luster considering I have cheese boards often.  We both had a different sangria, which were good - fine, nothing to write home about.  We did enjoy the octopus plate so that was a plus.  I'd give it another try at some point but you clearly need to know what to order.
Brunch was incredible. The service was excellent and the food was incredible! We will go next time we are in the area.
This place is a gem!  Great food, great drinks. I highly recommend getting dessert from here (the butterscotch pudding is to die for). Great place for date night or happyhour

Super busy Friday, but was able to sit in the bar area. The service was great and the food was excellent. The bartender made excellent sangria. The only complaint is the bread was very cold. I assume because we were in the bar area, but it would have been nice to have warm bread. That's all....

I was at Cafe Baba Reeba last week on a date.  Liked it so much I'm back for brunch.  Loved the brunch specials thanks to our server Patrick for his recommendations.  He was very knowledgeable and provided us with great service.  With that saying I told the manager how Patrick made our brunch experience an enjoyable one.  Food was made to perfection.  Portions were enough for my friend and I.  And the build your own Bloody Mary!!! Oh my that was fun how we can be creative by adding all the garnishes they provided.  Thanks again  but I just wish you can be in the west burbs :(

One of the better Tapas restaurants I have visited in Chicago.  Spacious inside but always good to make reservations in advance. Service was quick, dishes were being served within 5-10 mins of us ordering them. The red dishes on the menu denote the popular items, paella typically takes 35-45 mins so we didn't bother ordering any. Started with the Iberico chorizo with shishito peppers and the plate of jamon iberico, the jamon was good but wouldn't order the chorizo dish again. The Artisanal cheese plate and Meat plate with Serrano ham, salchichon and chorizo were really good. Meat balls were flavorful and the tomato sauce went well with some crusty house bread. The Short ribs and Shrimp with garlic dishes were decent too. Would definitely make another trip back to try some other dishes.

Huge huge huge tapas fan and was not disappointed by Cafe Babareeba. Went here for a work dinner with bunch 10 other people. The staples like the wrapped dates and the meatballs were on point, but the hangar steak and the goat cheese tomato garlic bread REALLY stole the show. Ordered the paella as well, but I was not a fan. Be sure to order the sangria -- it cannot be missed.

I lived in Madrid for a year, and I really miss the food. Ba-Ba-Reeba's food is amazing, and the most authentic Spanish food I've had in Chicago. The ambiance is also perfect, and really reminds me of traditional Spanish taverns. Highly recommended!
Needn't say anymore. My favorite Spanish restaurant in Chicago. Love every tapas I've tried. The best paella.

This place is awesome! We over did it the first time,but we were able to try out a good amount of food. They have a nice wine selection, we also had the sangria. We ordered a variety of tapas and the paella as well. The paella is really delicious, the seafood is fresh and plentiful with bits of charred pieces of rice.
Love the sangria and the goat cheese tapas. Great food and atmosphere.

Atmosphere/Ambiance: 5/5 Cleanliness: 5/5 Service: 4/5 Food: 4/5 Remarks: The paella, oxtail, and spicy potatoes were all good but not extraordinary. The hanger steak and octopus were mediocre. The dessert items (Natilla Flan and Chocolate Truffle Cake) were exceptional.

THE BEST SPANISH TAPAS IN THE WORLD (never been to Spain so I'm not an expert but take my word for it). Came here with friends (get a reservation the line can be long) and were seated in about 10 minutes. The sangria is on tap here and is amazing and honestly everything on the menu is 10/10. The bacon wrapped dates will definitely be a part of my last meal on earth. Obviously you have to get the baked goat cheese in tomato sauce and bread. The paella is also spot on and the portion is huge so definitely keep that in mind if you're ordering tapas as well. One of my favorite places in Chicago and the prices are very reasonable.

Cool atmosphere and delicious tapas but service was a little spotty. We ordered 4 tapas (baked goat cheese, mushroom soup, garlic shrimp and grilled hanger steak). We received the steak first, approximately 5 minutes after we ordered it, and it was cold. It must have been sitting out before we ordered, and it just got given to us. Not cool! It was yummy, though, but I wish it was hot. All of our tapas came out quickly, but then we waited 45 minutes before we saw our waiter again to order dessert. He had a lot of tables and the tables around ours were looking for him, too. Strange. Overall a good experience, and I would go back. I just wish the timing of the service was a little better!
This place is ok. Very touristy. There are plenty of better options for tapas in the city.

I've been coming here for years!!! I have yet to be disappointed! My recommendations to you are as follows: Dates wrapped in bacon, goat cheese in marinara sauce, patatas bravas, gambas al ajo, chicken empanadas, stuff mushrooms and the passion fruit sangria! Service can sometimes be a hit or miss but that still doesn't stop me from getting my tapas fix! It's great for big groups and/or a romantic date for two! Parking shouldn't be an issue they do have valet or there's plenty of side street parking on Armitage.

Even though this place has been around for over 30 years, I went there for the 1st time about a month ago.  I have been back 3 times since.  It is a very lively atmosphere and the food comes out quickly and is always spot on.  The staff will walk you through the menu and is very helpful in case you are unfamiliar with the tapas/small plate concept.
I have had better tapas but they obviously focus on their paella. It's amazing! The tastes are straight outta Spain.

Great place to go with friends.  Love their margaritas and their tapas are pretty decent too. Price is reasonable as well. My only complaint is not food related -- they have a long long wait typically, so be aware. However, if you're going with a few buddies, it's fun to hang out by the bar and wait for your table.

New Years Day we stroll in after a depressing movie and everyone is wearing pajamas! (Apparently there is some kind of promotion going on where you get a deal for showing up in PJ's).  When I lived in Seattle people just did that because it was Tuesday - but that's another story.  The atmosphere put our party of four quickly back into happy mode. We were seated promptly (without reservations). One of our group wasn't happy with our table (high traffic area) and they accomodated us graciously.  I love tapas! Because instead of ordering one entree you get to try and share many small dishes with your party. New Year's Day - they were all well done. My favorites were the baked goat cheese with tomato sauce and toasted garlic bread, the brussle sprouts salad with manchego and toasted almond (omg), the shrimp in garlic, pepper flake and olive oil... It was a great way to spend 3 hours. Good wine selection by the glass.  I don't normally like sangria because it's too sweet, but I tasted everybody's red and it was deelish!  Our server Matt was phenomenal and I can't wait to go back again soon!

Great good and drinks, but our waitress for the pajama brunch was pretty awful. We've been attending this brunch for YEARS, and always with a large party. They've always had no trouble splitting our check and keeping our order straight (we always let them know ahead of time) but this time she not only refused to do it (not mentioning that the policy about separate checks had changed when we told her before ordering we wanted separate checks), but she was very rude when we asked her about it after the check came. She kept insisting she had to talk to her manager (who we never saw) and acted super put out. I was very disappointed because we come here every New Year's Day as well as every Easter and now I'm thinking our families may have to find new traditions.

Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba! is in Lincoln Park in a cute little pocket area that reminds me of Toronto and heading out to the little micro communities for foodie exploration. My co-workers know this restaurant and they know it well. There was no problem getting a great seat (by the window). In the summer the roof comes off and exposes a massive outdoor seating area. In the winter, the roof keeps the restaurant warm and cozy. The food and drinks come fast and furious and the evening was a huge blur of tapas and sangrias and conversation. The food was good but got lost in the background of conversation. The fish and mollusk dishes were my favourite. Most can be made gluten free.
Best Spanish tapas joint in Chicago! I have been going here for over 15 years and they never, ever disappoint.

Big Disappointment! We placed an order for pickup to celebrate the new year at home and the food was terrible.. Spent $70 on awful food.. The seafood paella did not taste fresh. The quality was that of a two day old paella. #NeverAgain

Love it here! Prices are reasonable. We always share a lot of different tapas and get drinks and we don't end up spending too much money. The stuffed mushrooms, the goat cheese and the chickpea stew are all amazing!! Order something that looks interesting and just try it out, you won't be disappointed!
My favorite tapas restaurant in Chicago very good, super crowded all the time though. So many good choices and a vast array of selections you can't go wrong no matter what you choose.
Probably the best place to go for tapas.  Brunch is the strong suit here.

Brought my four daughters here for a pre-holiday dinner. Just as in my prior visits here - food is amazing!! Service is fabulous!!! And the pitchers of sangria were delish! Such a fun place to come to with a group to try an array of interesting flavors and tastes! This place is always solid!

Honestly, Chicago restaurants have really opened my eyes to what good food truly is.  This small-from-the-outside, but huge-on-the-inside establishment is a fantastic place to try out tons of different Spanish dishes, including their famous paella. I don't remember all of the dishes we got, but some standouts included the grilled hanger steak, the SPICY POTATOES (ridiculously good and cheap!), and of course, the paella.  While the place is pretty packed and loud (I wouldn't suggest this place for an intimate date or anything), it's a great place for a group of friends to hang out and get some great food at good prices. I can't say that the service was exceptional, as the waiter constantly spilled water on our table while refilling our glasses, but it certainly didn't detract from the experience. Overall, a very nice cafe that I would definitely recommend to people visiting Chicago that want a less upscale, but just as delicious option.

Love this place second time here and just can't get enough of their tapas! Every time I come here I have to have the sangria it is a must! Some of the few amazing tapas I like are the spicy potatoes and the Brussels sprout salad

Excellent service, waiter very good explaining menu,   glasses refilled before they are empty,  try the bacon rapped dates.., melt in your mouth.  Tonight we had the bison special.... Very tender... Unbelievable sauce. The sangria is flavored with real fruit.  Make a stop here..... I will again

Cafe Ba-ba-ree-ba. More like ba-ba-ree-BAE.  Decided to drop by after an excursion in Lincoln Park. It's a dimly lit Spanish tapas restaurant and deemed Chicago classic. A highlight of the menu was the sangria, but seeing as my companion & I opted to brown bag a green apple flavored Jack Daniels for later, we sadly had to forego imbibing this thing that everyone swears is the elixir of life. Ordered the sausage tapas that displays four different kinds--not a sausage fan (seen too many food docus) but the garlic sauce coupling absolutely killed it. I felt like Thor slamming this dish down. Enjoyed the goat cheese tomato blend & garlicy bread, but less so. I felt immoral eating the hangar steak with mushroom sauce. Partial towards tapas, but hey this place beats the other ones I've tried.
Try the sangria, very good.  Also in no order of greatness, octopus, fried chicken, and meatballs.  Make sure to make a reservation as it gets very busy.
The tapas a great, the sangria is my favorite! A little expensive, but if you come for a light dinner and some drinks, totally worth it. Make reservations as they are always full!
Have always enjoyed the bacon wrapped dates (of course) and red or white sangria. Can't go wrong with eating here, always a great choice.

This place not only has AMAZING food and sangria BUT their staff is amazing!!!!  I had a party of 17 for dinner reservations at 5:30...we were not able to be seated until a little after 6:00.  This was not their fault...there was a party there that had paid and sat for over 45min.  The manager and staff felt so bad that when we sat down there was pitchers of sangria waiting for us and also tons of appetizers (on the house).  We ordered tons and drank tons...the staff was wonderful and on it all night.  When we got our bill there was over $100 taken off our bill due to our inconvenience.  The food was FAB and we will all be coming back!!!  Thank you for a great night with our "ugly Christmas sweater" work party!!!

Delicious food, great prices. Our waitress was very pleasant and patient. The hostess was rude and so were the busboys. They would come by and pick up the plates off the table without asking us if we were finished. Busboy was pushing us around and telling us excuse me in Spanish in a very rude tone. I prefer Bulerias on Ashland over this overrated restaurant. Will not be coming back.
Great experience! The food was delicious - we got the spicy potatoes, calamari, goat cheese dip, and shrimp. All yummy!!

Fun place for small plates. Good tasting food. My only complaint was that I felt very rushed by our waitress to finish our food quickly and leave. They are efficient but I wanted a little more time to enjoy my food considering how much I was paying. The service was like an assembly line, not an inviting restaurant.

Such a fun, different place to go get dinner especially when you have people visiting you from out of town. The food is always delicious and you get to try new things every time because of the large menu and wide variety. Brunch is also great and the diy Bloody Mary bar (though a little expensive) makes for awesome bloodies overflowing with shrimp and bacon.

I went here during restaurant week and their tapas are amazing! Great for sharing in large groups. The ambience is relaxed, and the staff is attentive. They give you great suggestions if it's your first time dining with them.

Delicious! Absolutely love this place. I can't count how many times I've been here, but every time makes me want to come back for more! The tapas are outstanding! I love the short rib plate the best. It come with potatoes and the meat just melts in your mouth.  The sangria is also a reason you should visit! There are several different flavors you can try, but I stick with the classic red sangria. The bacon wrapped dates are a must try too. I really enjoy the goat cheese marinara plate as well. The garlic bread that comes with it is oh so yummy!  I'm looking forward to going back again and again. If you haven't been here, what are you waiting for... go!
Great food, great service, and great drinks I recommend  the passion fruit sangria if your there with friends or family
One of the best brunch!! Great portion, good for small and big party! And don't have to wait a long line. Like it!

Fun place with good tapas and pintxos. Nothing particularly outstanding, but some nice tastes. Wine prices are high, especially as the pours are not particularly generous. Expect a good fraction of your bill to be alcohol. Happy hour prices apply only in bar area.

I've been a fan of Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba! for years. They have all the best foods and all the best drinks. Server Amber is amazing and accommodating, so I recommend you to request her to be your server! From the sangria (black raspberry!) to the final taste of dessert, I'll keep coming back. Thanks Baba!

Date night was a success here! We went in early on a Saturday night@5! Got seated right away and pleasantly served. Our service was timely and our meal was excellent. I was surprised when the influx of patrons went from no one at 5pm to a full house by 6pm and the quality of our service did not change. Our waitress and the bus staff cleaned our plates rapidly and filled our water cups regularly. Our evening was perfection.  We will be back with friends!

An authentic Spanish tapas restaurant tucked away on Halsted in Lincoln Park. Can't find a single thing I did not love about Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba. As a Spaniard - and Spanish food lover - I loved Ba-Ba-Reeba's take on tapas. Some authentic and some with a fun twist. All delicious.

Came here on a Friday for a 5:30 reservation. The place is huge but I would def recommend making one as it was pretty crowded.  We tried the fried chicken, the scallops, the flank steak, marinated and spicy potatoes and they all hit the spot, although I could've done without the spicy potatoes. They were just okay but everything else was fantastic.  Will def be back!

We've been here a handful of times for date night. I love their tapas! The chorizo wrapped dates are seriously to die for as was the short rib. The sangria has been hit or miss but I'm there for the food :) The service has always been good and our experience pleasant. I would definitely recommend this place!

I came here with a large group on a Thursday night, and this place was packed. There's a cute courtyard with outdoor seating near the front of the restaurant in addition to the large dining space inside. We started off with a couple of pitchers of the classic red sangria which was delicious and not overly sweet.  The best way to do tapas is gathering a bunch of hungry people together and basically ordering one (or four) items from each of the categories - veggies/cheeses, seafood, chicken/pork, beef/lamb. Some of the standouts for me were roast dates with bacon and burrata with bread and tomato marmalade. I'm a big fan of sweet/salty, and the flavors of both those dishes were richly complex. I also really liked the brussels sprouts salad, mixed greens salad, grilled squid, and the ham/chorizo plate. I could have done without the fried calamari or garlic potato salad, but I think other people liked it. We ended the meal with the caramelized banana and chocolate cake which were both SO good.  I'm giving this place four, not five stars because some of the dishes came out a little cold, and the fried calamari was on the soggy side. The atmosphere was also pretty loud and crazy for a weeknight dinner, but I guess that is to be expected at a tapas place. The food and people made for a fun night, and I will definitely be back!
Great brunch menu and tapas! Love the vibe, but do think it's still a little overrated. There are better restaurants in Chicago to be hyped about, but still a great place!

This place is fun and a good time (and has excellent sangrias), but the food is quite hit or miss. I'd say I've had more positive experiences than negatives, but a few bad dishes do stick out in my mind.

I love this place! It is one of the only tapas places that I have been that I find filling and reasonably priced. The variety of plate options is great for different diets and the drinks are unique and tasty. We attended one of their Flamenco dinners and it was awesome. The dancers and music was great and we loved the entertainment to go along with our delicious food and drinks. I highly recommend the potatoes bravos!
This place was my first tapas experience and I'm hooked. The sangria was delightful and the food was so good. Everything we ordered was amazing.

Great restaurant, I love the tapas style of serving. You are able to try many dishes during the same sitting. I've been here a few times and always end up grabbing a bite or two off my friends small plates as well.  It can get quite busy and loud at times, but that's expected with any popular restaurant in the city.

Food was basic, service was ok, wait to get a table was long. All the food sounded good, but the dishes were not executed well. The plating was sloppy and the food lacked flavor. None of the food was hot. The beet salad was very odd looking and was over dressed. The location has potential, but the food need improvement.
I have been here 6 times. Never disappointed. One of my fav places in Chicago to celebrate a special occasion. Best Sangria and Tapas in town.
If it wasn't good enough this place exists.... they are also on Grubhub!!!!! By far one of my favorite place to eat in Chicago! The bacon wrapped dates are to die for!!!!!!
I love love love this place. D-LISH-ES-NESS. I take everyone here. I have a new phone so I can take pictures again !!!!:) gogogo

Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba is one of my favorite (if not my absolute favorite) restaurants in Chicago! I recommend making a reservation to ensure you get a table, as this place gets packed during peak hours and on weekends. I'm a fan of tapas, and Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba has some seriously good tapas. I highly recommend the bacon-wrapped dates, the sherry-tomato meatballs, and the garlic-red pepper shrimp! The candle-lit setting with its chatty ambiance and delicious smells from the kitchen make for a fun evening. We love the sangria options, and the sangria-of-the-day is neat since it's always something unique (desert pear, mango, blood orange, etc.). We've never had a server without a smile, and we've never left hungry. They also have a great Happy Hour at both bars from 4p-6p on weekdays and 10p-12a on Friday & Saturday that offers 1/2 price sangria and very, very discounted tapas dishes!  TIP: Join Lettuce Eats! It's a rewards/loyalty program that lets you earn points at Lettuce Eats establishments (including Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba) and gives you $ off your bill once you earn enough points, for your birthday, and for your anniversary!

This is one of my friends most favorite go-to spots when she comes to Chicago so of course with her raving reviews I had to come see it for myself. The restaurant is huge! Lots of space, a bar area for waiting and grabbing drinks and tvs to watch the game MUST GET THE SANGRIA PITCHER. sweet and light just how i like it. The food was a little on the salty side for me but the flavors were really good. I recommend the paella! We have 8 people and ordered 6 servings but it was wayy too much as its a large platter.Portions werent too small but a good size for a tapa. Parking is hard since its street parking and you have to pay meters on the street.

Came to Chicago for a work trip and found this restaurant on yelp. It has a great cozy atmosphere, the service is great, and the food is amazing! We loved every bite and the tapas experience is so much fun. I would definitely come back here again on another trip.

Went on a Saturday night for dinner.  Had a reservation through open table and did not have to wait. Great atmosphere. Food was very good.  We enjoyed the burrata, octopus and short rib the most.  Service was good.

This place is a great spot for a casual outing with friends or for a date. They have a great selection of drinks and tapas, and what's best is that the menu has certain popular items highlighted for you in case you're indecisive. We tried the hangar steak, the stuffed mushrooms, and the burrata, along with the caramelized bananas for dessert. I had a classic red sangria, which was great/decently strong. I recommend you get all of these! Very delicious, a great atmosphere and friendly service. It does get packed but we came on a Sunday at around 4 and were seated right away. The neighborhood is also nice to walk around in general after a meal.

I give this place 5 stars because I did think it was great...just wasn't my thing...if that makes sense. The environment is awesome and our server, Velibor,  Was amazing and on point. My husband and I ordered the chicken paella, and it had no taste. The other food was ok...I guess you would have to try it out for yourself. If you like authentic Spanish cuisine then I would say give it a try. We wouldn't go back, but wouldn't necessarily bad mouth this establishment either. It is defiantly different and we don't regret trying it out.

I came here several years ago and didn't love it, but I enjoyed it this time! Everything was very good - the chorizo-wrapped dates w/ goat cheese, chicken paella, butterscotch dessert, special sangria (pear), etc.

I have never been let down by a staff at a restaurant than I was by Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba! It was my Anniversary on a Thursday night. We didn't want to do anything extravagant as we were planning to celebrate another time on a weekend out of town. My Girlfriend was feeling like Tapas and where better to go than Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba! according to the internet. Called ahead and was told there's a 45 minute wait, I asked if we could put our names in line as we were walking out the door and would be there within 20 minutes. The lady on the phone was nice, took my name and number down and said no problem. Arrived 20 minutes later, walked up and there was a gentleman waiting at the hostess area. Let him know I called ahead, he looked me up and said "it'll be about an hour and 15 minutes.". I explained how I called ahead and what was said to which he said "She meant 45 minutes to an hour sir." We went back and forth a bit on this but he dismissed me and walked away as if he didn't have the time to listen to a customer on what another representative of his employer had said to a customer. So we waited.... An hour and half later I go back up and ask how much longer to which they said "We texted you it was ready quite a bit ago." To find out they texted the wrong number. They "apologized" and said they'd seat us next. We sat back down, right in front of the hostess table mind you and after 20 more minutes I asked again what the status was told yet again that they had texted me and hadn't heard from me. The lady repeated the number back to me and again they had it wrong (after 3 times of giving them numbers mind you). I even inquired as to "why couldn't you just lean over the counter and say 'Sir we can seat you now. You saw me sitting there but relied on a text?' to which she blankly stared at me. I asked to speak to a manager, she walked away and after another 10 minutes of waiting my Girlfriend and I left. You may do some things right Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba! Your Tapas MAY even be the best in Chicago. But your service and professionalism was absolutely horrible.

Probably not much to say that hasnt been said before--but this is a true Chicago classic.  Incredible food, great room and ambiance.... can get VERY busy depending on when you go.... but for Tapas on the Northside you really cant go wrong here.

Food was mediocre and very bland. Last weekend, their special sangria was a Pear Sangria, but unfortunately, all I tasted was Peach Schnapps. Not good. I used to really like that place, but since my last visit that has changed. I don't think I will be returning.

Delicious!! First, make sure you try the brunch. The sausage rice was one of the best dishes I have had at any time of day anywhere and it was actually a pretty decent size (though shareable would be a stretch). The chicken and waffles on a stick was also very tasty. The croquetas have a unique taste but were also good and you get four so you can share. Most items are between $2 and $8 so getting a wide variety together for a table can be done for a decent price. There are over 100 items to choose from though and so many things will look good so be careful. My only caution would be that most dishes were only shareable if you wanted a very literal taste of something. Though some dishes gave more bang for the buck like the bacon Mac and cheese and the the house plate of meat and cheese. See what I mean about trying everything...

I have been here several times and feel that I am qualified to write this review. The sangrias are great and strong so be careful not to keep knocking them back. Definitely order the patatas bravas as they are the most all-around-good menu item, enjoyed by everyone at the table. Everything else varies. I've had some good and not so good; although most of it seemed to be a difference in taste buds. I would also recommend the fried chicken with piri piri sauce. The service is good but last time I went it was incredibly slow. The waitress was just chatting on the side while I waited for my bill. It seemed almost impossible to get her attention.  Anyway, they have an extensive menu with lots to choose from!

This place is amazing! it is huge and has tons of space to accommodate a large group or if you're looking for a table for 2.  I've only been here for brunch, never another meal.  If their dinners are anything remotely close to brunch, you're in luck.  The food is always on point and you cannot go wrong with the make your own Bloody Mary Bar.  Seriously, do it! Its Awesome! Try all the food as its great and if you go with friends and share plates, it won't hit you in the wallet too much either.  Enjoy!

I went with a friend to this place on a busy Friday night and found two seats at the bar. We started with their half bottle red wine blend with Syrah and Cabernet, which had a dry, almost pepper like aftertaste. Very nice! The tapas we had were: Bacon dates (I want these at my wedding) Goat cheese in tomato sauce  Burrata with tomato marmalade Short rib with manchego mashed potatoes  Grilled Pork Fried chicken thighs All were quite delicious! Be aware that the portion sizes are not typical for a tapas restaurant. They are quite generous and each plate is good for two people.  I'm giving 4 stars because the service was so so. Our desert (espresso ice cream) took over 20 minutes to get to us and we had to wait over 20 minutes to get our check. No apology from our server, either. I would come back again though for those bacon dates. Those were incredible!
This is still my favorite Tapas restaurant but I feel it has slipped a little bit. Still the same charming atmosphere with excellent service.. Still keep going back.

This is one of my favorite restaurants in Chicago; definitely the best Tapas. The food is excellent and service has always been consistent during my many visits. Getting a reservation on the weekend is often difficult, and the noise level can be a little out of hand at times but the food is definitely worth it. Recommendations: Sangria (the specials are often the best), Pintxos Platter (gives you a little taste of everything... definitely a good choice if you've never been), spicy potatoes with tomato aioli, goat cheese baked in tomato sauce, **beef tenderloin and blue cheese, grilled squid with olive oil and garlic.

Tapas done the right way. huge tables allow for large parties to all sit together without being broken up. The menu has a broad selection with some of the freshest ingredients in Chicago. You absolutely have to have their sangria as well, incredible stuff.

Food was OUTSTANDING! Lauren who was our waitress was AMAZING! Give her a raise!! Lol .. Bacon wrapped dates are sweet and savory, the tapas are a perfect size. The Butterscotch pudding is tantalizing. It's light creamy texture is unforgettable. That dessert is highly recommendable.
Great place for tapas & paella. The sangrias are good - almost too good. There is always a fun vibe in this place too.  Can't wait to go back.

I've been here a few times and usually leave pretty satisfied.  The atmosphere is very fun and is great for groups.  Last time I tried the cava sangria, which I found to be very tasty.  The tapas are pretty good, but definitely not the best I've had.  The service is always friendly, which makes for a nice experience.

A go-to for birthdays and any other special dinners, occasions, etc, or just a regular meal of food. You can't go wrong here. I've never had a dish I didn't like. I DO, however, wish the sangria was a little stronger!
Very lovely cafe with amazing Spanish tapas! I especially love the yogurt served here. It is different from normal yogurt and more like cream and not too sweet.

This is one of my favorite restaurants in Chicago by far. Best Tapas choice by far. Great prices. First of all, I love the atmosphere. There are bar seats that you can pick up without a reservation but I do recommend that you make a reservation if you want to eat here. It's a great place to hang out with friends/have a reunion/get some light drinks and appetizers/date night with dim lighting/everything you would want.  To get: - Paella (Chorizo one is my favorite) - Sangria (Mango and classic are great and not very strong but delicious) - Bacon wrapped dates (Perfect!) - Goat cheese and tomato dip  - Mash potatoes and pork shoulder - Scallops - Brussels sprouts salad - Can't wait to try more! To eat for free: - I love their free bread in the beginning dipped with olive oil...maybe I was just hungry but I ate like 5 in a row.

Came as a group of 6 for brunch, ordered:  *pitcher of sangria, and one virgin sangria *seafood paella *bacon wrapped dates *burrata with tomato sauce *seared scallops *short ribs Everything was good and especially liked the sangrias!  Love to come back again.

SO SO SO SO SO SO GOOD! Would definitely recommend. the menu was explained to us and we loved everything we tried (you NEED to try the bacon-wrapped dates). We went for a dinner date and had a great time.

Very underwhelming for all the reviews we saw. My boyfriend and I ordered grilled squid  (way too salty), beef tenderloin with blue cheese (beef was dried and tough), Brussel sprouts salad (too much cheese, made the dressing too creamy and the beef empanada, which was delightful. The desserts were below par as well. We ordered caramelized banana and the flan, it just didn't have a lot originality.  The good part was that we got the desserts for free as a part of checking in via yelp. Overall, not very good food and was a disappointment given all the rave reviews.  Maybe we just ordered the wrong things?

I've been coming here for over 10 years now, even through different ownership, this place has been able to withstand the test of time. The ambiance is cozy, comfortable and chatty - a great place to go on a date or simply to grab a bite with friends. After coming here for so many years there's a standard list of things I always order: Spicy Potatoes with Tomato Alioli, Goat Cheese Baked in Tomato Sauce,  Roast Dates with Bacon & Apple Vinaigrette, and Chicken & Ham Croquetas. The rest are always fun to try!  P.S. If this place could bring back the creme brulee from years ago that'd be great.

Excellent service, excellent food, and excellent drinks. We had a large party, and they accommodated very appropriately, and everything we ordered was beyond expectations. The service was impeccable. 5 stars!
Food are tasty but a bit oily. We got octopus, calamari, bacon and dates, steak, spicy potato. Dimly lit nice interior.

Tasty and large selection of tapas with a nice atmosphere. However the tapas aren't particularly original and the sangria is lacking. Wish theyd hone the menu down a little and focus on what they do best. The service is slow and they can get very very busy, but the ambiance is fun. We enjoy it but more for the vibe than the food.

Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba is one of my favorite places in Chicago! The vibe is awesome and they are really great with special food diets! They even have a really good gluten free bread (important with their spreadable and soupy tapas items)! My favorite item on the menu is the broccoli manchego salad - it has a wonderful crunch and a ton of manchego!

Heard a lot of hype from Café Ba-Ba-Ree-ba but never really had an occasion to go here until yesterday, and was very pleasantly surprised after the experience. Not only because of the flavors and presentation of the food, but also because we surprisingly didn't break the budget doing it, spending around $20 per person(I was fully expecting to spend twice as much). First thing to note is that this place is gigantic. It has like 5 different rooms, two semi-floors, walls of bread and bundles of ham swinging from the ceiling. They really do try to capture the dim but bustling atmosphere of a restaurant in Barcelona, and in my opinion they do so fairly successfully. Ordered 7 tapas between 3 people, including the warm potato and onion omelette, spicy potatoes with tomato aioli, beef empanada, chicken and ham croquetas, buttermilk-fried chicken thighs, seared Spanish sausages, and skewered chicken + chorizo sausage. All the dishes were good, though my personal favorites were the potato dishes, the croquets, and the skewered Spanish sausages. The beef empanada was also good though for a single $6 empanada I would probably wait for happy hour. Speaking of which, they have a solid happy hour here, where their dishes are priced as they were when they first opened 30 years ago, meaning you essentially get 50% off a lot of their favorites(patatas bravas, empanadas, roast dates, chicken & ham croquetas, pintxos, etc.) along with $16 pitchers of Sangria. It's every day from 4pm-6pm, along with Friday sand Saturdays from 10pm-midnight as well, and you can definitely get full off of $10-15 or so if you come by around this time.
