All in all tapas are never cheap, though with the right orders, along with plenty of complimentary bread and olive oil, you can actually get fairly full without breaking the bank. We averaged around $12/person on just food, and with drinks it just brought it a little higher, which is not bad at all. Also, they knew it was our first time there, so they even brought us out a trio of desserts, on the house, which was a great way to end the meal and start off the night. For that and their happy hour, they are definitely warrant another half star(4.5/5)

Great ambiance/atmosphere and the service was impeccable! I especially appreciated how attentive the staff were, immediately removing plates when we were finished. Our waitress was incredibly helpful with offering up suggestions and explaining the tapas concept. Bread was given to us upon arrival and I don't know anyone who doesn't love a little freebie to begin a meal! The food came out rather quickly despite the large crowd on a Friday night. We ordered several small plates of food and two of our favorites were the short rib and the beef empanada. It was a bit expensive but a nice little treat!

The first thing you will notice when you walk in, is the beautiful ambience. About2 tapas er Erson would be sufficient. Mind you, it takes 35-40 min for the paella so order in advance.  We order the spicy potatoes, Moroccan lamb and the salmon. Everything was very good and exquisite!
This place is amazing. Hip, fun, and convenient. Great vibes already want to go back. Staff was so sweet too. Pretty people and great music.

I like it here. It's relaxed and unassuming, and the food is good too. It can get loud and crowded, but that doesn't bother me. They have some interesting cocktails and a bunch of sangrias. It has a low, red tinted lighting. Try the goat cheese in tomato sauce.

Johnny J is the best waiter I can remember in YEARS.  My husband, daughter, brother-in-law & I had dinner here last night.  It had been many years since any of us had been here - for various reasons - location being one.  My last experience here was 'meh' at best, but I'm sooo glad we gave it another try.  4 people is perfect to be able to order a dozen dishes.  Bacon wrapped dates - sublime, the cheese board was a huge hit - there was really nothing left on any plate as we waddled out of there..  But back to the star of the night - Johnny was friendly and knowledgeable and paced us perfectly.  He has a way with people and I wish him all the success in the world, as I have a suspicion he could be an actor.  If I'm wrong, he's just 1/1,000,000 as a waiter.  BTW, we're old timers who used to go the the prior incarnation at that location - Otto's Beer Garden.
Best tapas place around! Great ambiance with the outside patio and very knowledgeable staff. The chicken thighs are my new favorite dishes.I come here at least once a month!

We tried quite a few items from the menu and sadly nothing really stood out. Probably won't be back anytime soon.   -Grilled squid (ok) -Spicy chili oil shrimp (meh just oily) -Seafood paella (way too salty and the seafood was over cooked) -Lamb loin (ok, not gamey) -Steak with chimichurri (just ok) - Goat cheese in tomato sauce (good) Bill with tax and tip for 3 ppl and two drinks was ~$145.

Love this place.  They always have great food, and the prices are super reasonable.  Their brunch tapas are also very good, but their traditional Spanish tapas are still the best.  Also have great Sangria and wine. Also have done private events here, and the prices were more reasonable than most other places.

Great place for tapas and the prices are extremely affordable. The food is super tasty. I recommend the lamb and the short rib they both were super tender and cocked to perfection. The stuffed mushrooms with spinach and manchego are crispy and they melt in your mouth. I also recommend the goat cheese in tomato sauce creamy and very tasty. Overall, the food was excellent and the service was great. If you want to try an affordable tapas place come check this place
I'll be honest, it's the classic complaints about Tapas restaurants. Not enough food and too expenzive. Was it tasty? Absolutely. Would I go on my own dime? No.

My boyfriend, Mitchell, and I came here before going to a Sunday matinee of BYHALIA at Steppenwolf last month. We are both fond of sharing lots of small plates and this was the perfect place to do so. For starters, the bread that they brought to the table was fresh and delicious and I had to actively control myself and attempt to share with my hungry significant other  As far as drinks go, the Bloody Bar was both super "worth-it", compared to others we have had. The foods we shared, in order of most enjoyable to least, were: 46. Seared Sea Scallops (prepared to perfect savory tenderness) 53. Grilled Hanger Steak (the accompanying chimichurri sauce and fingerling potatoes were ON POINT) 67. Roast Dates with Bacon and Apple Vin (not normally something we would order, but a recommendation of the menu and very unique flavor/texture combo) 22. Brussels Salad (on the dry side but decent) 92. Deviled Eggs (nothing special) The menu is so packed full of enticing plates, that we would definitely come back for a second experience!
tired--hohum food, lackluster service, unexciting ambience

First time I ate here I gave a 4 for service. Since then, this has become my favorite restaurant. I love the tapas concept - trying new things and having conversations over the food. Never disappoints. Among my favorite dishes are the bacon-wrapped dates, the croquetas, and the roasted vegetables. Don't leave without ordering sangria!
Great for big groups. Fun for brunch and the sangria is the best in the city.

LOVE Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba! :) Food is reasonably priced and delicious. I especially loved the rioja braised short rib with mashed potatoes (#51), and you can't go wrong with any of their empanadas. I used to live in Lincoln Park and would go here at least once a week with my girlfriends for sangria and tapas. Service is always great, too!

I love this place! I've only come for dinner but It takes reservations, it's fairly priced, the food is delicious which there is a WIDE variety of, the sangria is really good, the restaurant is a comfortable size, it has a fun atmosphere, food doesn't take too long. I would come here way more if I wasn't trying to go to a different restaurant every time I went out since I live in Chicago and there are so many unique places. I recommend it to all my friends.

Pros: very reasonably priced tapas, great choices, great sangria, very large space and great atmosphere.  Cons: it's a popular spot so the wait time can be over an hour during busy periods. However, there's a bar you can grab a drink at while waiting.

Love this place! The tapas are all really tasty and it's easy to get a bunch and share with friends. The sangria is also amazing and once again, really great for sharing. Recommend for big groups or parties!

Came into Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba! on a Sunday morning to sort of wind down a great long weekend in Chicago. This was on a long list of recommended brunch places our friends picked so we ended up choosing to come here and I'm very glad we did!  We got a table for six pretty easily around noon on Sunday. The layout of the restaurant is pretty fun and there are pretty deliberately sectioned off parts of the restaurant. We were ushered to the back right of the establishment. Just glancing at the menu I knew this was probably going to be a great brunch. That, and the fact that there is an "!" in the name of the restaurant makes me expect big things. The menu was big. Like reallllly big. There were breakfast/brunch options on one side, and then more lunch/dinner options on the other. Lots of dishes to choose from. We split three pitchers of sangria between the six of us throughout the brunch and it was delicious. We got the regular house red and the white peach. They don't put way too much ice in their pitchers like you see at some places, for which everyone was thankful. As for the food, you'd think with a menu so big, everything might be one note and taste the same. That's definitely what I was expecting going into it. That was not the case AT ALL. We probably sampled 12-14 dishes between the six of us and each dish was unique and had its own flavor. Some standouts for me: The Pan Catalan, bacon mac and cheese, bacon wrapped dates, and the patatas bravas. All of these were incredibly tasty, and something I'd recommend you NEEDING to get while you're there. I thinkt the patatas bravas was my favorite. I've had them done a dozen different ways by different Spanish restaurants, but the sauce they put on them here really stuck out to me. It had a nice spicy kick but wasn't too much for people who aren't a huge fan of spice. Just really well done. The only thing I wasn't crazy about was the shrimp and grits and the paella. The shrimp and grits were a little bland and the paella I thought was just sort of "Meh." I'm not a huge paella fan so take that with a grain of salt. With all the dishes we had and the sangria, I'm pretty sure we all got out of there for less than $40 a person which was incredible considering we all had our fill of drink, and were stuffed to the brim with food. It's probably not the first place you think of when you hear "authentic Spanish cuisine" but it's pretty damn good. Only my second brunch in Chicago but I'd say if you're looking for some great food and sangria, this is your place.

Not sure why this place has 4 stars. It's such a mediocre place. It was my second time and last time here. The sangria's here are weak and the food is soooo bland. Nothing special about it. I don't recommend it.

Stepped in on a bright sunny Saturday afternoon for late lunch. Perhaps 2pm was nearing the end of lunch's busiest hours, but waiting for window seats was reasonably quick without needing to make reservations.  As I'm a serious fan of bacon wrapped dates, my agenda going in was to order both their toxpintos chorizo medrool dates stuffed with cheese and a tapas order of bacon wrapped dates. Both were delicious and I would keep ordering them if my tight pants have enough give for them.  Their banana caramelized dessert is also a solid winner. First bite was full of crunchy pistachio bits mixed with warm browned banana. Get it please.
Love this place! Their seafood paella is amazingggg!!! I usually go just for that! Of course I've tried plenty of things on the menu and everything is delicious!
Delicious Sangria! Delicious food (a little salty but worth it regardless). Great atmosphere.

BRUNCH! I have been here for both brunch and dinner and both experiences were great.  Brunch is one of the best in the city. There are so many breakfast tapas to choose from, as well as the regular menu too.  They have a make your own Bloody Mary bar, which is a meal within itself. They will bring you a glass of your preferred vodka and you go up to the bar and can make it however you like. There is bacon, shrimp, olives, etc.  They also make dank sangria.  The tapas are also exquisite. I would highly recommend the spinach & manchengo stuffed mushrooms and the goat cheese baked in tomato sauce. For brunch, the deviled egg and potato & egg bite are AMAZING!  The tapas are not as small as one would think, so I definitely had a lot to bring home. Also, can be pricey!

Food: truly delicious, I don't even care if it's not authentic. It's good. Service: very very good. Price: pretty reasonable. Good food, the good service, and the upscale neighborhood  Fun place to go. Loud and social Thurs-Sat nights. Definitely good for a date night!

Wow.  Just.  Wow.   I've been coming here for years and every time the menu changes it just keeps getting better and better - not many restaurants can say this.  I'll admit - the only thing on the menu that I'm not a huge fan of is the paella but it's still good!  The sangria is the absolute best in Chicago.  The patatas bravas are just heavenly.   Everything from the goat cheese to the bacon wrapped dates are always made fresh and taste amazing every time I come here!     Great vegetarian options as well.   The servers are always very professional and attentive - and personable!  This place has a very unique vibe and they do it well.   Always packed, but this only adds to the very cool atmosphere here.  Make reservations in advance, though!  The music is very cool and the area is very beautiful.   I bring friends here all the time and they become obsessed with this place.  The day this places closes will be a very sad day indeed for Chicago.

Tapas. So many options. So much sangria. Very authentic. Waitstaff sometimes forgets about you. Plan to be patient and keep eating and drinking. Worth it. Recommended: garlic potato salad, goat cheese baked in tomato sauce, grilled octopus and shrimp with garlic.
Food is tasty but it gets extremely pricey very quickly! Best to go with a couple friends who have diverse tastes to enjoy the tapas.

Fantastic food in subtle Spanish ambiance. Our server Erika was on point and table touched the perfect amount. Everything we ordered was cooked to perfection and very flavorful. The chorizo wrapped medjool dates were so good that I ordered seconds. The next time we visit Lincoln Park we will absolutely come here for a meal.
My absolute favorite restaurant! I recommend the sangria, spicy potatoes, and the seared scallops! YUM yum yum

Definitely come here. Very authentic Spanish food. I felt like I was back in Barcelona. The sangria is a must. Strong, flavorful, fruity. We ordered the originally and I'd recommend it! Food we ordered: Potatoes bravas: too spicy for our liking. Actually I couldn't even eat it it was so spicy. We told our waiter and he took it off the bill which was very nice of him.  Chorizo wrapped dates: good but you can go without  Stuffed mushrooms: must!! Best stuffed mushrooms I've had. Amazing crisp on top and juicy inside.  Brussels sprouts salad. loved this salad. Great flavor. Crunchy and fresh.  Don't forget check in on Yelp for free dessert

I've been to Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba a few times over the years, but it's fitting to review it now because it wasn't until recently that I noticed how sizable the space was. I've always sat towards the front of the restaurant and didn't pay that much attention...the tables are still small as heck though. Good thing that the servers are typically quick to pick up used plates because there's not a lot of room to place the various tapas that you will undoubtedly order.  As for the tapas itself, I can't think of a single one I've tried thus far that I didn't either like or love. What falls into my love category?  1. Baked goat cheese 2. Pretty much anything with chorizo in it 3. Last but certainly not least, the bacon wrapped dates. I don't even eat bacon, but I will if it's wrapped around those dates! I went for weekend brunch and you get to order from both the brunch menu and the regular one. Highly appreciated.  Price is reasonable but keep in mind, because these are small plates, and depending on the size of your party, it may take you quite a few to get satiated. In other words, don't be surprised if your bill falls into the $30-40 range. The one cost-effective tip I'll give you: if you have a party of 2-3, split a sangria pitcher, instead of going glass by glass. I split a pitcher of red with another person and felt like I got a whole lot of sangria out of that thing...definitely my money's worth.  Ba-ba-reeba is consistent and I've yet to have an awful experience. Great place to celebrate a birthday, introduce out of town friends/family to tapas, or have a date.

Good food but a bit pricey for my taste. I very much enjoyed the ambience. Nice music, and rustic decor. I ordered the pintxos platter, shrimp with garlic, buttermilk-fried chicken thighs, and seared sea scallop. All of it was good, but the best thing I tasted was the buttermilk-fried chicken thighs. BEST FRIED CHICKEN I HAVE EVER TRIED.

Great food and much less crazy crowded than other tapas places.   I like their sangria pitchers (good prices too).  I wouldn't call this 100% authentic Spanish tapas, but the food is all very well prepared and serves a variety of tastes.

This place has grown on me each time I seem to come back. The food has always been good here and I've always enjoyed their paella and sangria options, but note that you can easily surpass $30/person price point making it a $$$ experience rather than $$ as listed.  On our last visit here, we did the rioja-braised short rib, summer melon salad, buttermilk fried chicken with piri piri sauce, seared Spanish sausages, grilled octopus with potatoes and olives, & porky paella (pork shoulder pork belly, chorizo, & chicharrones). Overall a solid meal. If there were items I could live without, it would be the seared sausages and the buttermilk fried chicken. Sausages were good but nothing that really stood out for me and the buttermilk fried chicken was tasty but kind of out of place in my opinion for a Spanish tapas bar. My favorite was probably the braised short rib due to how tender and flavorful the meat was. The melon salad I really enjoyed the serranos and the smoked vinaigrette they used. The grilled octopus was good, but some of the pieces of octopus were had a bit too much char in my opinion. And lastly, for the pork paella... be ready for a mouthful of pork flavors and textures. Really good, but after a few bites I was definitely overwhelmed and needed to balance it out with other bites from the other dishes. On a final note, their classic sangria is my go to and goes great with any of the food here. 'Til next time, cheers!
Fantastic tapas! The brussel sprout salad and bacon wrapped dates are always phenomenal

Food is great, especially pork paella! My tips for you is: Order paella (min. 2 orders, choose from chicken, pork or seafood; you can mix n match) before you even sit down, cause the wait was 40 mins!  Chorizo wrapped date is good, worth trying, one per person will be good enough cause it's a bit on the sweet side. Grilled octopus .. Hmmm, I saw lots of compliments here so I ordered it. But mine was over-cooked, and tasted blend. I don't recommend it. Red Sangria is a must!

Had a ton of tapas and tried the standard red sangria.  Try the grilled octopus and bacon wrapped dates! Red Sangria was good, but not out of this world.  Overall a great time and the place is deceptively huge! Best tapas place in Chicago hands down!

Fantastic tapas! Loved the goat cheese with tomato  and the spicy potatoes. Also the shave Brussels sprouts salad was delicious-lots of texture with the addition of the nuts they add for flavor. The sangria was tasty but definitely a bit weak. Celebrated a birthday and they brought out delicious dessert tapas as well...the chocolate cake one (can't think of the exact name) was amazing. Cute place and friendly service-a great place to celebrate with a group or a fun date.

I have always loved Cafe Babareeba, but recently went this weekend and had an amazing experience. You cannot go wrong with what you order. The bacon wraped dates (stuffed with cheese) are insanely good. I also love the calamari and potatos with the spicy aoli sauce. Service was amazing AND we had to wait past our reservation so the manager comped our pitcher of sangria. That is great customer service. Will always be one of my favorite spots!

The staff was very accommodating. We didn't have a reservation and there was a two hour wait but the hostess told us about their full service bar area and we were able to find a table. Cafe Ba-ba-reeba is cute. It looks small from the outside but much bigger once you go inside. There is an outside area that's covered. Food is tapas style. So we started with spicy potatoes with alioli, goat cheese baked in tomato sauce with bread, grilled hanger steak with charred green chili chimichurri & fingerling potatoes, shrimp with garlic, olive oil and red pepper flakes (least fav), buttermilk fried chicken thighs, piri-piri sauce and shaved vegetable salad (my fav). We also ordered the chicken paella which takes 40 minutes to cook and it was so good! Usually places only have seafood paella or paella with pork...they have those plus vegetarian or chicken so I had to try it! Cafe ba-ba-reeba is located in Lincoln Park. Overall an enjoyable experience. I will go there for Spanish food any day!

Had dinner in the bar area on Saturday night.  It was AMAZING!!!  We knew we had picked a good spot when we walked in!  The aromas from the food were fantastic!  Cannot say enough great things about the food and the service!!!  They were packed too by the way!

An awesome place for a date or for a big group outing. The menu has a lot to offer and there's always something new to try! The bacon wrapped dates are amazing. A few of my favorites are the spicy potatoes, scallop empanadas, calamari, ham croquettes, and buttermilk fried chicken. You really cannot go wrong here. The sangria is amazing too.

Went for brunch a few weekends back and totally fell in love. We order a ton of tapas plates but I was totally obsessed with the Nutella and banana waffle. I've dreamt about it ever sense. We called ahead and got seated right when we sat down so I definitely advise that. When we told our waitress that it was our first time she gave us the most delightful truffle dessert on the house. Overall I left full and happy. You should for sure stop by.
Awesome food and drinks!!!! Great tapas options.....ordered almost all of them and all of them were really goood.
Food alway good, just remember to make a reservation. The place is always crowded.
Great food and great service every time. Make sure to make a reservation if you want a table, but there is always room at the bar if you're not picky.
Great food, great service! The bacon wrapped dates are a must have as well as the Pork Shoulder with chorizo stew!

A very nice selection of small plates, served quickly. We shared a number of the tapa offerings and they were all very good. Often times the calamari (squid) is rubbery but this dish was very well prepared and flavorful. Not rubbery at all. We shared a pitcher of sangria and really enjoyed the fact that we were able to taste a few of the offerings before finally landing on the preferred flavor. The servers were all very pleasant and efficient. I'd go back if I were in that neighborhood again.
My fav tapas place! love it! been many many times and had a few birthday parties there. Drinks are amazing! All their sangrias are delicious!
Love this place! Always get the spicy shrimp, patas bravas, brussel sprout salad. Can't really go wrong here.

Really disappointed with this place. I was here once with colleagues and the food was delicious, service left something be desired but I said I'd give this it the benefit of the doubt and return. I came back with my mom and boyfriend. Our server could not have been ruder, she corrected my mom on her pronunciation of a beer, and our entire table got the impression that she felt we were beneath the place. We also got a really poor table when there were plenty of other, much better seats available.
Café Babareeba is amazing! Order a few tapas for the table and don't forget to try the red wine sangria! The dates and the melon + proscuitto are on point

I'm surprised I've never reviewed CBBR before because I'm such a big fan of it! The numerous options are great for foodies and trying things with friends. There are plenty of options for picky eaters as well, if you've got someone with vegetarian/GF type restrictions or who is just plain picky. They do a great job of accommodating large groups as well so if you plan a group outing here it is easily doable!
Haven't been here in a while, decided to give it another go. Happy to say the food is as delicious as I remember, they keep their standards high... And as long as they do I'll keep coming back

Their food and drinks are second to none! For a tapas restaurant, I'd have to say they are my favorite! I tried shrimp and grits for the first time here and it was quite tasty! Their spicy potatoes are also a huge hit amongst my friends and I. Last but not least, if you're a wine drinker, they serve the absolute best sangria - with many flavors to choose from!

What a cute place! Ideal place for girls day/night out. I went for brunch but ended up ordering just the lunch menu items. I thought the menu was small for a tapas joint, maybe it wasn't the full menu. We ordered: Passion fruit sangria (Delicious, you can't taste the alcohol at all!) -Grilled Octopus (Octopus is not as soft as other tapas dishes I've had but the flavor of the grilled/charred octopus is pretty good) -Goat cheese dip (The bread it comes with was too hard but the dip is tasty. It's better with the bread that they give you at the beginning of your meal.) -Brussel spout salad (This was good but nothing special.) -Seafood paella (I asked our server to cook the paella a little longer and it was good.) Caramelized banana (I always order this dessert at tapas restaurants and like it every time.) Chocolate truffle cake (Not my favorite..) I would return to try other dishes, maybe for dinner to see the full menu. The paella was not on the menu I had so I'm assuming that there is a fuller menu. The dessert portions were small and presentation wasn't as good but it tasted good.  When the paella came out, I asked the person who brought out the food not to mix the food yet so that I can take a photo. He waited for me to take a photo but said "I'm very busy". That wasn't nice...
Servers were rude, practically tossing the serving dishes on the table. Over priced. Poor food quality/presentation. Will not be going back soon.

Poor service but excellent food.. Been coming here for 10 years but last night was a major disappointment as far as the service was concerned. The food was excellent as always but part of the dining experience is your waitress and the overall service. Inattentive waitress after she had taken our order. Had to ask for bread twice... Bus boys had to be asked to refill water... And that's after they had passed by our table a few times. Had to track the waitress down to get the check.  Short of staff or bad training ? I'll let the MOD determine that. Wouldn't return in a hurry based on last night.
Solid tapas.  Good sangria.  Nothing fabulous but always consistent.

Five star for Management!  Thank you for taking care of us after our Paella was never made!   My family has been coming here for since it opened and I was a kid. We came back  to celebrate my Mom's 81st birthday.  5 stars:  -Mushrooms with mancheko? Cheese.  -Beef medium rare with garlic mashed potatoes (special of the day) -octopus sauté in garlic with greens I want to eat these again just writing about it.  Cooked just right and flavor was delish! 3stars for Chicken Paella: it was salty, rice overcooked, and tasted burnt. I don't think I would order again. 3 stars for kids penne pasta with red sauce. Flavor was ok, edible. It  came with mini vegetables that were gritty so no one ate. Beware of the bread that sits out uncovered in the racks and at service station: Bad cross contamination ?! !! Have to say, was not happy about the busser who serves cuts and serves bread with the same dirty hands he just wiped tables and cleared dishes with.  We didn't realize this until there were more tables. Although, He was very efficient and attentive. Loved the $3 dessert menu: Best: -Butterscotch pudding -hazelnut bar -flan -chocolate cake with vanilla (very rich) Pass on cheesecake, minimal flavor, not memorable.

Food was amazing! While my friend described his previous experience here as mediocre, he too enjoyed this dinner so it likely depends on what dishes you choose to order. As a group of four, we ordered 6 different tapas along with the pork paella and also tried a few yummy tapas desserts. My favorites were definitely the bacon-wrapped dates, the short rib, and the goat cheese in tomato sauce. My friends also enjoyed the pumpkin empanada dish. The pork paella was also quite fantastic too - it contained pork belly, sausage, and pork chops. The desserts were also very delicious, with my favorite being the dark choclate crema in orange marmalade. We especially enjoyed mixing and matching the various sauces that came with the ones we ordered. To add on top, it was a lovely dimmed atmosphere lit with candles. Overall, a very wonderful experience.

As LEYE restaurants go... meh.  It wasn't bad. But it wasn't what I've come to expect from that brand either.  In fact, they brought us one wrong dish, a misunderstanding, but since our server didn't come by for at least 10 minutes, we just ate the wrong one at that point.  We had paella, which was alright (we had seafood one)...  The manchego mushrooms were ok, but not special. Our friends liked the short rib a lot. We ordered about 16 things and most were just not noteworthy.  The best dishes we had? Octopus, burrata, and nope, those were the best two  I'm in no hurry to go back. I don't discourage people, especially if they're tapas (or sangria) fans --  but if you're just looking for something that lives up to the hype for a special event? This isn't it..

Made a day-of reservation for 9:30 on a Saturday. I was a little apprehensive about eating so late because that's not my usual style, but I think eating late and embracing the Spanish/European habit of eating late made the experience all the better. This was my first time here and I was amazed by the sheer size of the restaurant. There are so many different rooms that all have their own atmosphere. My friend and I were seated in one of the back rooms, so it was quiet and made for a really pleasant and private dining experience. Our waitress was really nice and attentive, and gave good recommendations. We ordered a half pitcher of the Classic Red sangria. It was delicious, and red wine is not usually my favorite. We really debated between the Classic Red and the seasonal special, which was white with mango. Next time. This is definitely a menu you have to approach with a plan. Because we were only two people, we wanted to maximize our plates, so we ordered one plate from each category: 32. Goat cheese baked in tomato sauce. 42. Grilled squid with olive oil & garlic. 51. Short rib with mashed potatoes. 58. Meatballs with sherry tomato sauce. They were all AMAZING. I wouldn't change what we ordered and I would order them again -- but first I would try everything else on the menu. I was seriously impressed. The meatballs came out first and they were the perfect start. When we finished the meatballs, we dipped the table bread in the sauce -- YUM! The squid, short rib, and goat cheese came out pretty quickly after that. The goat cheese was so fresh and creamy and the tomato sauce complemented the cheese very well. With the garlic bread that comes with the plate, these 3 make the perfect bite. Amazingly fresh and vibrant flavors. The squid was wonderful. I'm not used to having grilled squid and it was so refreshing to actually taste the flavor of the squid and not fried breading. The sauce was really light and made this dish a great choice for something lighter, especially compared to the short rib. The short rib was definitely the heaviest of the dishes and wasn't my favorite. The short rib had a great flavor but the mashed potatoes were kind of bland and eh (IMHO). The veggies that came with also weren't mind-blowing. I'd like to try the other meat choices. We also got a free dessert for being first-timers (so I got to save my check-in dessert for later!!!). After the richness of the meal, I probably should've opted for a lighter dessert choice, but I couldn't resist the chocolate truffle cake. It was deeeeelicious. Definitely super rich and maybe not the best choice after such a rich meal, but it was amazing. I would for sure order this again. Overall, an amazing dining experience. I want to come here for brunch now, too, to see what they have to offer.

Yum, love this place. The best Spanish food on the northern side of Chicago (the best on the southern side is Mercat a la Planxa oh yeah oh yeah). It's a great place to come with friends and the food is super solid. You'll have a great time - definitely recommended.

We really enjoyed this restaurant. The prices were reasonable and the service was good. It was our anniversary and the waiter surprised us with a complimentary desert. No complaints here at all. If we're in the area again, we'll definitely be back!

sausage fried paella with egg iberico ham hash buttermilk waffle with berries patatas bravas bacon wrapped dates chorizo stuffed dates red sangria tried and true spot from those college days. tapas style dishes. great place to dine with a group and taste a bunch of dishes.

Nice place to come for a quick bite after work.  Food is ok. Drinks are ok. I am not too crazy about their food but it's to bad.  prices are reasonable, the staff is friendly. this is a place to come every now and then when in the neighborhood.

Fun place, good food, great drinks. This is THE Chicago tapas institution and theres a reason. It is a happy place to be and the ambiance is great. Even the old standard of goat cheese in tomato sauce is still delish. Good octopus, olives, potatoes. Yum.

Amazing food, great service and really cool atmosphere. The goat cheese & garlic bread, grilled hanger steak, pork paella (2 servings for 4 people was plenty), and the calamari were all AMAZING. Oh and they make a really tasty gin & tonic (THE Gin & Tonic) that has mint & cucumber in it.
Great place.  I try to go there every time I am in the area.  The tapas are just right and good to share.  Had a many different tapas to choose from.  Live it up a little!

Went out to dine in tonight. Haven't been back in two years and it was way below par.  The lamb was overlooked, veggies burned, octopus was tough. Sangrias are watered down and with a ton of ice. $85 bill for four small plates and a pitcher of sangria was not worth it. There are much better, authentic tapas restaurants in Chicago. This place sucks.

Amazing place! Spain is one of my favorite countries in the world and I was glad to be there as it almost felt like I was in Spain. It must be the smell of jamon haha. Anyway... My friend and I ordered white classic sangria, which was so good! I'd definitely recommend and also paella valenciana, patatas bravas, and garlic shrimp. Honestly, didn't finish the paella because we were already so stuffed on tapas, so we ended up taking most of it to go. Overall I'd give 10 out of 10

The food was pretty good, but it was served with dirty plates and silverware!  Our waitress was understanding when I sent back a stack of plates, but then even some of the replacements had stuck-on food (and most were wet- gross).  Same with the silverware.  There are plenty of other tapas restaurants that take a little more pride in their presentation and cleanliness.  I won't be back.
Semi pricey tapas, my dessert was delicious. Didn't get any paella but regretted it later. Large restaurant with a mixed crowd of families and younger people.
The biggest problem I have here is deciding what I want. There are so many great options and everything is always so great!!! One of the best spots in Lincoln Park

The food itself is just average as well as the sangria. But the dining experience is always a pleasure and its great to be able to share and sample a bunch of small plates. When trying to do dinner with picky eaters, this is highly recommended. There's bound to be something for everyone.
This is a great venue if you're going to have a large party. I've come for private room parties of 50, parties of 15 and also just for dinner.  The small plates are delicious and fun to share.
AMAZING happy hour from 4-6pm.  Estrella Damm (sp?) beers are only 3 bucks.  Tapas are dirt cheap (the servings are small, but fine for the price).
Everything on the menu here is amazing.  Its got a great vibe, the service is always really nicely paced, and the Sangria might be the best in Chicago.  Highly recommend.

I wish I could have had one of everything. Went for a large birthday party and everything was outstanding from service to the meal. The dishes came out to the table in time to enjoy and order the next item. And the bread! Restaurants are usually judged by the first thing a diner eats and it's the bread that will make or break for me.

I can't say enough about this place. I've had dinner here twice with friends and will be coming back again & again. The staff is friendly and attentive, the sangria is amazing, the menu is broad and diverse and the food is consistently incredible. It's a great casual atmosphere and surprisingly affordable (our group of four had several small plates and a pitcher of mango sangria for just over $100). Also, I could eat those bacon-wrapped dates until I pass out.

The food was really good but they didn't seat us until 35 minutes past our 10:00pm reservation. Then they bus boy was cleaning the table (blowing out candles, taking napkins, threw us dirty looks etc...) as we were winding down our meal and signing the check. I understand you want to leave but you still had guests in the restaurant, that was downright rude!

I remember going here for a 7th grade spanish field trip. 8 years later, my taste buds never forgot the taste of the delicious food at Cafe Ba Ba Reeba!! I couldn't wait to try this place out again. I have been raving about it to all my friends whenever they ask me if I know any good Tapas places. This place is always at the top of my list.  RECOMMENDATIONS: -Patatas Bravas: has a slight kick to it, and comes with a very tasty sauce which complements the potatoes.) -THE CHORIZO WRAPPED DATE AND CHEESE: Seriously. Get this. It is part of the pintxos platter, but honestly just order 3 of these babies (2 per plate) and taste buds will thank you and you will thank me. Other things I tried: Goat cheese baked in tomato sauce: So I saw many people on here recommending this so I gave it a shot. Unfortunately, it didn't make my list of must-haves. It sort of reminded me of garlic bread dipped in Ragu spaghetti sauce, with a hint of goat cheese.  Grilled Hanger Steak: Maybe it was just me getting full, or maybe after eating the potatoes it made this dish taste a bit bland but these were just OK. It came drizzled with a green sauce and a side of chopped potatoes, which were delightful. Buttermilk Fried Chicken thighs: The crunch on these oh my. The outside of the chicken was perfect. Just the right consistency. Think buffalo wild wings but with more crunch. It was good, and it also came with a piri piri sauce but it didn't really taste like anything. Overall, still my fav place to visit. If you check in to yelp you get a free dessert, who doesn't love free?!
Get the bacon wrapped dates, or die. You really can't go wrong with anything you order, but those are definitely my favorite.

Beyond the wonderful Food, and exquisite service of Amber, the manager Scott was more than welcoming, accommodating and pleasant. It was such a rememberable night filled with good friends, delicious food, and a delightful  atmosphere. Thank u to the amazing staff for their hard work on a busy night.  Paella, buratta, and bacon wrapped dates were out of this world.

The food is delicious. For the most bang for your buck, I'd suggest to order the pinxos combos. Patatas bravas are my absolute favorite! The atmosphere is a bit sexy, so if you're like me and just rolling by after a rough day at work, you may feel underdressed. It's okay, though. All customers are treated equally :) more detailed review on my blog  ciao-chicago.com/chicago…

Let me start off by saying that I was pleasantly surprised with the whole experience I had with this restaurant. I was given the task of picking a restaurant with good drinks by my date. Luckily, I thought ahead and chose one with not only good drinks but good food as well. This place did not disappoint. First off, I was able to make a reservation for two with ease. When we got there it was packed with people for a Sunday night which shocked me even more at how simple it was to make a reservation. When we first arrived, it did not take long to be seated once we walked in the door. I came prepared to eat, and the food had exceeded my expectations. I'm also not big on sangria but it came highly recommended. Needless to say, before I knew it we finished off a pitcher between the two of us. I was expecting a typical "Lincoln park" experience but it definitely held its own with their food and drink menu. I would definitely recommend this place and look forward to returning.

Went here for brunch. Unreal good. Simple bites at a decent price. killer sangria. I am a bartender so im pretty picky with my sangria and this place has great options! Amazing staff who showed our large group a great time!

Ba-Ba-Reeba is our go-to Birthday dinner location! Born in Spain... I just love a good Tapas place. And Reeba does NOT disappoint!! Every time we go we find new dishes we love and the specials are always phenomenal. Their drinks are DELICIOUS! Every time we bring family here they are always impressed. Highly, highly recommended.

I LOVE THIS PLACE! I love it so much I went for my birthday this year. We actually just got back from Spain and the food here was just as good. I also love the amount of vegetarian options. Highly recommend:  Red house sangria (obviously!)  Tortilla Espanola  Patatas Bravas  Burrata with Bread and Tomato Marmalade  Fried green peppers with course black salt  The two times I went the service was excellent and the food even better. Highly recommend!!

This place was less than mediocre. Very surprised by the high reviews. They don't seem to use good ingredients. We had a watermelon and cheese salad in which the watermelon was pasty and old and the cheese tasteless. We tried many dishes and I'd rate them as 1-3 on a scale of 5.

The exclamation point says it all. (NB: This review is for brunch-only.) The idea of tapas brunch seems, at best, infelicitous. Portions are awkward while choices are starchy, and so one doesn't know how much to order. Our selections arrived incredibly quickly (or while I or my partner were in the restroom), and yet, were lukewarm at best. The potatoes had that classic, leathery cafeteria potato texture (with a great seasoning). The eggs were all perfectly cooked. The coffee was insipid, and the Bloody Mary buffet was amusingly undersupplied. Our server was attentive and informative. Although he suggested that we'd ordered too little food (we hadn't: one pintxo and three tapas for two) he did not rush us. There are families and children everywhere. (One overzealous father even rearranged the chairs at our table, without apology or remark of any kind, when their double-wide stroller couldn't clear the aisle.) We were reminded of a dining room in a resort hotel or (we imagine) Disney World, rather than one of the best breakfasts in the city. I've always sneered at people waiting 45-minutes for a table at Lula Cafe, but now I feel their pain.

I have eaten at Cafe Ba Ba Reeba probably 12 times this year. It's always my go-to for visitors or for celebrations. It's just so FUN and so reliable and so good and so reasonable.  Last week, I messed up my reservation and made it for the following day and was SO sad. They were completely booked but still tried their best to be accommodating. They sat all 6 of us at the bar and then gave us an awesome table when it was ready. It didn't go unnoticed. This is absolutely one of my favorite restaurants in Chicago.

We had some friends visiting from New York City, so naturally we had to choose a place that would impress.... And Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba was it. Brunch is fantastic, but I LOVE their dinners. Truly one of my favorite restaurants in the city.  I like the way they designed their menus with favorite items and/or chef recommendations highlighted in red. Because they do change the menu pretty frequently, it's nice to automatically know some of the newbies you should try.  Some things you should absolutely order: -a pitcher of sangria. We shared it among 4 people and we each got two full glasses and then some. The pitcher costs $26, while a single glass costs $7. Huge savings, and well worth sharing among a small crowd.  -on the pinxtos menu, the date stuffed with cheese wrapped with chorizo is to die for. Embarrassingly enough, I always order 2-3 just for myself. They have something similar on the full size menu, but it's not identical, and these are sooooo fantastic that I don't even chance it. Get more than one. It's all of the flavors you would never expect to work that just do.  -spicy potatoes. They aren't over powering, and contain just the right amount of kick... And that chipotle mayo sauce is delicious! -beef tenderloin with blue cheese = perfection. It's cooked medium rare and has a slightly salty taste from the cheese. Mmm, mmm, good! -goat cheese with tomato sauce. It's super creamy and warm, and when placed on top of the garlic bread, it melts.  Some other menu items we thought were tasty (though not at the same 5+ star level as the above list): -ham and cheese croquettes. They came four to an order and were jam packed with flavor. Although they look like mozzarella sticks, the cheese isn't melty, it's more cream-based.  -hanger steak. It was cooked medium rare and came with roasted potatoes and harissa sauce (which we all thought was similar to sofrito, but I'm not sure if it was the color or the flavor that led us to believe that!).  -octopus! It was many of our first times trying octopus, but it exceeded our expectations. Ever so slightly chewy, but great pop of flavor.  Tips: -Check-in on Yelp and you get a free dessert. Surprisingly, because we all checked in, they let us all get a free dessert. It was NOT one per table. We tried four different ones and passed them around the table in true tapas fashion. They were about 5 bites a piece and hit the spot! My personal favorite was the rich chocolate cake!

We stumbled upon this place on Yelp while visiting on business from NY and it completely lived up to the reviews. The food was amazing and the service was awesome ! I recommend siting on the patio but it gets a bit chilly. We had a bunch of tapas and then the vegetable paella which was great but HUGE.  There are SO many vegetarian options which was excellent for me as well as amazing seafood options for my coworker. Definitely   worth checking this place out!

We went here on a Sunday evening as part of a group of eight (one of our party made reservations - not sure if you can only do this only for large groups but if you can make them,I would recommend this as it was crowded on a Sunday at 7:30). We enjoyed a large assortment of tapas and all were excellent (patatas Brava, squid, Brussel sprouts salad were just a few). The paella is excellent and a larger portion than the tapas. The sangria (four varieties) is refreshing although the alcohol content seemed low - not a bad thing. The desserts (we tried two- the chocolate cake and the marcona almond caramel bar) were the perfect size to end our meal on a sweet note. Only complaint is that the noise level is a bit high so it made it challenging to converse with our group.

This place has great food and a great ambiance. Good for dates or large parties/gatherings. Saw a couple of bridal showers/bachelorette dinners.  Would recommend about 2-3 dishes per person. We tried the following: *Garlic Shrimp *Meatballs *Buttermilk Chicken *Hangar Steak *Bacon Wrapped Dates *Caramelized Banana (free with yelp check-in) Favorite was definitely the meatballs and the bacon wrapped dates. The hangar steak was also very good - smaller portions than the other tapas, but very tender meat and went great with the chimmichurri sauce. The caramelized banana we got as dessert was good and came with a scoop of vanilla ice cream, but it was nothing special.
Everytime I come to Chicago and in the mood for good food on a lazy afternoon I come here.  Never disappointing!!

Love love love Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba! We always get tapas and sangria when we come - they are all amazing. The place is usually very busy when we come, regardless if it is a weekend or weekday. I would recommend making a reservation, though the bar is first come first serve. We usually end up sitting and eating at the bar which is great. Must try: bacon wrapped dates, spicy potatoes, deviled egg.
Cool place! Fun for groups or date night. Love the tapas and they come in a generous portion. Fun outdoor patio as well.

This review is long overdue. I hosted my husband's 40th surprise birthday party here back in March ~ had a private room. Where do I begin!? I suppose with the menu. Below is the menu for the party: Cold Tapas: *Serrano ham, salchichon, chorizo & manchego cheese *Spanish caesar salad Hot Tapas: *Goat cheese baked in tomato sauce *Spicy potatoes with tomato alioli *Shrimp with garlic, olive oil & red pepper flakes *Skewered chicken & chorizo sausage *Meatballs in sherry tomato sauce *Wood-oven roasted market vegetables *Rioja short ribs & manchego mashed potatoe Desserts: *Marcona almond tart  *Chocolate truffle  *Seasonal flan  Sangria, beer & wine package Everything was on point and delicious, a hit with my guests. Thank you Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba ~ Michelle in Special Events and employees assigned to the party for being so accommodating! I definitely will return.

I was there once and the food was fabulous as well as service.  The second time, we had a reservation and they made us wait in the br close to 30 minuts after our reservation, food only okay and our server was horrible.

Delicious, fun, and somewhat adventurous eating (if you want it to be). I went here with a large group (9 people) and we had a great time splitting pitchers of sangria and trying a BIG variety of dishes. The atmosphere, when crowded, is loud and fun but still somewhat refined. The waitstaff do a great job keeping up with the constant rotation of dishes, and the open kitchen when you walk in makes you extra excited for all of the delicious plates to come. I'd highly recommend this for any outing/ group.

Between 6 adults and 3 kids we spent over $250. For this price point I expect a restaurant to nail every (not just some) dish. What they were good at... Chocolate truffle cake, saffron flan and vegetable paella. Also enjoyed the bacon wrapped dates. Their plating and presentations were gorgeous. Where they failed... Shrimp skewers were charred and tasted charred, a different shrimp dish tasted really fishy, steak tapas were under seasoned, fried calamari was extremely over done, the mango sangria lacked flavor. The waitstaff was attentive and did a good job clearing our table, but they did clear some tapas that we were still working on.

Came here with a large group on Sunday night (made reservations on OpenTable beforehand), and I'm glad we made a reservation because this place was poppin. We decided to all get tapas and paella to share, which allowed us to try many different things. I would recommend getting a pitcher of their sangria (we got the classic red, but all of them looked great!).  Here's all of the food we got to split between 4 people in order from best to worst: 1. Chorizo-wrapped mejdool dates and cheese ($2/piece) - the BEST thing we ordered, you definitely need to get one per person because you won't want to share yours! 2. Pork Paella ($12/per order, min. 2 orders) - yum yum yum so much PORK! 3. Burrata with tomato marmalade ($11) 4. Iberico chorizo with blistered shishito pepper ($2/piece) 5. Grilled octopus with harissa ($12) 6. Shrimp with garlic, olive oil, red pepper flakes ($9) 7. Rioja-braised shortrib ($12) - still very tasty, but didn't taste new or exciting Overall, the food was all good, not the best tapas I've ever had, but lots of great Spanish options and very delicious. The paella and the chorizo-wrapped dates are a MUST order.  PRO TIP: If you check in on Yelp, you get a free dessert tapa! I really liked the marcona almond caramel bar.

First of all great service!  Even though it gets pretty crowded on the weekends the bar is a great place to sit and order food and drinks.  My favorite dishes were the bacon wrapped dates, and the goat cheese marinara.  If you're planning for a date night, make a reservation!
Delicious! This place took me right back to Spain - very authentic food. And the sangria was incredible! Don't miss this place if you're in Chicago. It's worth the wait times!

Where do I even begin?  Everyone always asks me what my favorite restaurant is in the city, and almost always I say, "I don't know, I have so many!", but now I can give a definitive answer and tell the whole world that Café Ba-ba-reeba is one of my all-time favorites.  This restaurant totally hits it out the ballpark, and I would reccomend it to anyone and everyone.  Café Ba-ba-reeba is equivalent to the eight wonder of the world - can you tell that I love it here? Like I said - where do I begin?  I suppose I can just start off by listing all the tapas thar we ordered, so here we go: 1. Potatoes and aioli 2. Spicy meatballs in sherry sauce 3. Beef empanada 4. Ham and chicken croquetas 5. Melted goat cheese in tomato sauce  6. Octopus with smoked potatoes Although I could just lean back, relax and tell you that each of these were phenomenal, let me just give you a brief description of each tapa we ordered. The potatoes and aioli are simple, but amazing; the aioli is finger-lickin good (quite literally).  The meatballs are juicy, and the sauce they are in is wonderfully flavorful.  The beef empanada was like a meat filled croissant - it was awesome.  The croquetas were amazing - that's all.  The melted goat cheese in tomato sauce came with garlic bread and the flavor mixed perfectly together - this was one of the best deals as well.  And finally, the octopus tasted like they fetched it straight from the sea; it had all the salinity your heart could desire, not to mention it was chewy but tender in the most perfect way.  Biased as I may sound, all of these tapas are a "must-get".  Yes, there's so many others to choose from but these were freaking amazing.   But hey, guess what?  The empanada, meatballs, croquetas and potatoes are all $3 or less during happy hour which is 4pm-6pm, Monday-Friday.  That way you can try more of their tapas for a little less money.  You can only take advantage of these happy hour deals if you sit in the bar area, but why not?  You still get the same great atmosphere and service when sitting in the bar so take advantage why don't ya?   Now, I'm not done - oh no, not even close.  My fiancé and I got the seafood paella after all those tapas.  I had high expectations for the paella since my fiancé has said it's the best he's had, and I was anything but disappointed.  The paella exceeded my expectations, and I can say it is now my favorite paella as well.  The saffron is very distinct, but not overwheleming, and the seafood was cooked perfectly.  I had some left-over and it still tasted just as good the following day.  That's impressive.  I don't usually have a burning desire to go back to the same restaurant twice, but I'd go here 10x over to indulge in this paella.   And after the paella, we had dessert - not one, but four to be precise (we pigged out just a little).  We had the black raspberry sorbet, caramelized bananas, natilla flan and the butterscotch mousse.  Don't even ask what my favorite one was there - they satisfied the sweet tooth like no other dessert ever has.  I'd say that you definitely should try the butterscotch mousse and the caramelized bananas...if you really have to choose.  Each dessert is only $3 and they're small so you should choose to get more than just one. And finally (as if that wasn't enough, right?) We got a pitcher of sangria that lasted throughout the entire course of our meal.  That pitcher is huge, and it's not filled to the brim with ice so you truly are getting a whole lotta sangria.  We got the red sangria which is only $17 for a pitcher during happy hour - hell yeah!  The sangria was awesome, maybe a little too awesome since I walked outta that place a little tipsy.  We also got some Spanish beer that was on draft and it was also very good...and yes, I was double-fisting it for a bit there. The atmosphere and the service made this dining experience even better.  The waiters and bussers were extremely attentive and always came through picking up our dirty plates.  We definitely didn't feel ignored, even though we weren't sitting in the main dining area.  In fact, it was kind of nice because it felt like private dining be for all the dinner crowd came. Ultimately, we left in some pain because of all that we ate, but can say that we came, we saw and we conquered.

I think I've been here and ordered bacon wrapped dates more than any other dish from any restaurant in Chicago. Their sangria is amazing too. I order a pitcher of sangria every time and I don't even like alcohol. I honestly have never eaten a dish I didn't like here though. Besides the dates I definitely recommend the platter, the spicy potatoes, and the calamari.  One warning though: there's always a wait, even on weekday nights. Be prepared to sit at the bar or fight for a high top table if you're hungry.

Sad news: my friend got food poisoning from there. Was either the garlic shrimp, wrapped dates, or the meatballs. She was sick for 3-4 days.  After telling other friends about her experience, they all seemed to have known someone who's also had food poisoning from there.  such a bummer cause my experiences have been good, but im not willing to risk it.

This was our first time visiting Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba, and we were very excited to try tapas during happy hour. We made a reservation ahead of time as the reviews stated that they are always super busy. When we arrived, we were seated in the dining room. When we asked the server for the happy hour menu, he seemed annoyed and told us very rudely that happy hour is only in the bar and that we had to move. You could tell he was just upset because he was going to lose a table and it was very uncomfortable. Once in the bar area, our server was very friendly and helpful. However, I was not too impressed by the food on the happy hour menu. It was just okay. Next time we will try the paella.

Seriously, the best sangria I have ever had. Order a pitcher...or three.  We over ordered for our group of 8 and the bill reflected that, but everything was delicious!! Our waiter was not very efficient or attentive, but we didn't let him ruin our experience.
Red Sangria was awesome.  We sat at the bar and the service was excellent.  Had lots of the tapas and Paella it was incredible.  Loved the olives and manchego.  Would go back if in the area again
Love this place. Food is always on point. Love the sangria ! Great place to take family, date night, or just a night out with friends. We always make reservations. I prefer to sit in the front room.

A fantastic order-by-number place!  Endless tapas! This place seems to always be very busy so definitely make a reservation in advance.  It is a giant restaurant and very loud.  Fun and upbeat loud though, not a turn-off. Order the croquets and sangria! Prices are average ($20 per person)

average at best. the tapas were not very impressive or flavorful. the only thing good was the bacon wrapped dates, which is the easiest thing to make and please the palate. so i will not be going back there anytime soon.

It brought be back in Spain. We were just in the area and was looking for a place to eat before we head to our summer event that evening. I checked my yelp and boom - found this place. My cousin and I wanted to try all of it. We ordered at least one or more in every section of veggies, seafood, beef.. I enjoyed the salad and the grilled quid with asparagus. We also had the tuna with melon slices (that was different) but good. Everything was delicious except the calamari - I've had better.  The different flavors of Sangria was just a treat! We had a pitcher of mango. The server's knowledge and atmosphere was a great addition to the experience.

Such a good place for big groups who don't mind splitting a bunch of small plates. They also have sangria pitchers that are a really good deal. I came here with 4 other girls and we ordered multiple items as well as two pitchers of sangria and spent $27/each which was way less than we were expecting.

W O W. Having the option to order two to four little plates, not having to choose one thing on a menu filled with mouth watering selections, where have you been my whole life? The service was great, the mango sangria light and refreshing, the food was delicious. Thank you for the memorable night!

AMAZING!!! I keep trying different tapas places but no matter what I always end up coming back here. I have been coming for YEARS and have never ever been dissatisfied. I do wish they would bring back their escargot to the menu!

I have dined in at Ba-Ba-Reeba several times, and I would say in general dining in is a 3.5 stars experience--it is loud and service is sometimes inattentive, but it is fine overall.  However, I just ordered delivery for the first time and was very disappointed. I live less than a mile away, but the food arrived cold and the scallops were way overcooked. Not palatable. I ended up making myself a salad from stuff I had in the refrigerator, which I could have done without spending almost $40 on Grubhub.  Go in person or order elsewhere.

We visited this place as a group and it was a good idea. The ambience is stylish, although a little crammed. There's always a huge, happy crowd. The food is all small plates and that gives you an opportunity to try lots of their wonderful dishes. We had a couple of vegetarians in the group who had a large variety to choose from and they enjoyed their dinner. The white peach sangria was delicious!!

Great tapas and sangria. would recommend making reservations in advance because this place can get very crowded during the evenings/weekends. Definitely one of the most sort out places for tapas in Chicago.
I am very disappointed. The grilled squid was salty and the Moscow mule was too sweet and not drinkable...

Tapas galore!!! I love the food here. A fave is the deviled egg...yum. It's got so many dishes and they are incredibly tasty. Tapas are always good when you want to try different types of dishes. It's a huge, busy, loud space that's dimly lit for the most part. Prices are decent and the cocktails are good! Make reservations ahead of time!

I really enjoy this wonderful Sevilla style restaurant. It's got the whole package: delicious food, great sangria, terrific service and very nice Spanish ambiance. Haven't found a tapas I didn't like here as all of the dishes are carefully prepared and high quality. Try the patatas bravas, croquettas, tortilla (it's like an omelette), and dates wrapped in bacon...oh, just try them all, they're all good.  Check in on Yelp and get a free small desert. The butterscotch pudding with a salted caramel sauce I had was delicious!

A bit pricey but otherwise excellent tapas. Between four people, we ended up ordering nine tapas and also got two free desserts thanks to Yelp. A couple of my favorite tapas were the burrata, the grilled octopus with green harissa, beef tenderloin with blue cheese, and the bacon-wrapped dates. Of course, you can't go wrong serving a hunk of burrata, and the grilled octopus was tender and had a delicious char to the outside. The beef tenderloin with blue cheese was a bit of a strange request, but ended up being delicious. The blue cheese topping was a perfect salty complement a well-cooked and tender beef tenderloin. Personally, I am a huge sucker for bacon-wrapped dates and have to order them whenever I am out for tapas. There is something so special about crispy, salty bacon wrapped around a warm, gooey, and sweet yet slightly crisp on the outside date. Perfect combination and Ba-Ba-Reeba's dates certainly did not disappoint! I found tapas like the waffles with banana and nutella and the hangar steak to just be okay. Nothing really special or super flavorful going on. For dessert, we had a mango sorbet, which was good, and a flan with nitilla, which was also good, although it was fairly runny in the center. Overall, this is definitely a classic tapas restaurant and never a bad choice. The menu is extensive and pretty much all of the dishes were ordered were tasty. The restaurant itself has a great atmosphere/vibe and drink list looked excellent so it's definitely a great place to come by and have meal with friends/family.
Fun atmosphere.  Really good food- probably the best tapas in Chicago.  Solid drinks.

We had three tapas: garlic shrimp, hanger steak, and a squid. The garlic shrimp and the squid were quite good, and I will probably order them again next time. We also had two servings of paella (we really wanted to order one, but two is the minimum), which was very good. The sangria was just mediocre, not impressive at all. But I have to say, everything is overpriced here...

My friend who lives in Chicago loves this place, mainly because it's still stylish and cute inside but it's not in the all time busy downtown area (about 10-15 min drive from there). Located in Lincoln Park community, Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba! was super busy on a Friday evening, with different ages crowd. The wait for a table was 1.5 hours, but luckily you can order off the main menu at the bar as well. We were there around 8 pm and were barely able to snag the last 2 seats at the bar. This place offers a variety of Spanish tapas. If you order a paella, make sure you specify for how many people. It was two of us and they must have assumed we ordered paella for two and boy was it A LOT of it! My favorite part of the evening was the passion fruit sangria - it was DELISH! Very easy to drink too hahaha The cafe offers valet parking, as well as plenty of Ubers driving around. I would go back!

Don't forget to check in on your Yelp app to receive a free dessert! :) you're welcome! The vibe here is very chill, I love it. It's a great place to work (there's free wifi) when they're less busy but when it's packed, it gets very loud and the wait can be very long! As per usual at a tapas bar, the portions are pretty small here and it can be very easy to rack up a big bill, so don't come in too hungry if you're not prepared to pay with your wallet! Rioja-Braised Short Rib - fell right off when I cut it, very tender and flavorful Shrimp with garlic, olive oil - this was a little too much for me, the shrimp were practically drowned in olive oil, taking away from my appreciation of the shrimp itself! Chocolate cake - delicious! I would like to come back and try their paella! Next time I'm ordering the sangria as well!

Good American style tapas. This is not authentic Spanish tapas, neither in presentation nor flavor. However, the menu is very clear about what you are ordering, and it's hard to go wrong since everything we had was good. The serrano ham tasted a lot like prosciutto, which was disappointing, but the bacon wrapped dates made up for it. We only tried the traditional red sangria, but it was excellent. Not too sweet or fruity, but had an ample amount of sliced fruit in the drink.

My girlfriends and I came here on a Sunday after hearing very positive things about this place. The service and decor was wonderful, but the food? Meh. We ordered a total of 4 tapas and then the chicken paella. None of the tapas were spectacular except for the short rib which was phenomenal. The chicken paella was so bland. I had to add so much salt and pepper just to make it edible!! Definitely not worth a trip. We won't be coming back.

Consistent and fun place to go with groups.  We've been here plenty of times and always love the food and service.  They manage to create an environment that's family-friendly, date-night worthy, and great for a girls-night dinner.  I would have given 5-stars but I wish the menu changed a little bit more often.  Definitely would recommend restaurant if you want good tapas and cocktails with a lively setting.  Our favorite dishes are the grilled octopus, grilled squid, citrus cured salmon, sea scallops, Spanish potatoes, & the scallop empanadas.  The sangria is good (maybe a little sweet for me but that's just sangria in general)

This is the kind of place you take your mom to when you're trying to prove to her you're not a complete fuck up.  The sangria will lull her into a sense of comfort while the moon roof hypnotizes her into believing you really are the best son/daughter in the world.  These comforts get her prepared for the endless trays of tapas which wash over her like the bountiful sense of pride she could never really could express in you.

A favorite spot with my friends, we've had many birthday dinners here. I usually get the empanadas with the beef being my favorite. The atmosphere of the restaurant is very fitting but the location can be hard to get to by public transportation; involves some walking and we usually opt for an uber. My biggest grievance with the place is that they don't split the bill when you go with a group of friend so you end up having to split everything equally.

There's really nothing I can say about this place that hasn't been said already. Amazing tapas restaurant known for their sangria and paella, everything is good on the menu, an absolute MUST eat here for anyone in Chicago

Came here on a Monday night and it was the best thing because of the $5 cocktails!! which we didn't know about before coming here (bonus :D). Everything on the menu is around $6-$8 and I recommend 2 dishes per person. We ordered spicy potatoes with tomato alioli, rioja-braised short rib, and galician empanada of bay scallops all were pretty amazing. The tab came to about $20 per person (super cheap for tapas) :)  I would definitely come back and try everything if I can!!!
Absolutely love the food here. It's great for a night out with your friends or on a date!  I have to stay the pitcher drinks are pretty great too.  I'll be for sure coming back

I love cafe ba ba reeba - the sangria is delicious, as are most of the dishes.  The first time I came I had a set menu already set up, but I recently returned and did most of the ordering. The octopus was delicious, as was the shrimp and sausages. The paella was the only thing I didn't love, because it was a seafood paella with not much seafood. Was still great though! I really liked the spinach and manchego stuffed mushrooms.  Don't need to leave too much room for dessert because the portions are get small, so you can still try all of it!

Words cannot express how much I love this place! Everything we ordered was super delicious: Croquettas, sangria, aceitunas, patatas bravas ... there is no wrong choice. It tastes like back in Madrid. I'd give 10 stars if I could.

I've been here several times and it never disappoints. A few must-have menu items:  Dinner Menu:  -patatas bravas (the aioli has a little kick and is delicious!) -bacon-wrapped dates (no explanation needed) -goat cheese baked in tomato sauce -fried green peppers (trust me on this) -shrimp -scallops -white peach sangria Brunch menu:  Pintxos:  -short stack of pancakes (the cutest, tastiest stack you'll ever eat) -waffle-battered chicken stick I don't recall my other brunch selections, and I'm sad to say I've never had any of the paella selections, but that's definitely on my list. Make a reservation, they're always busy--and for good reason!

I love love love this place. I wish I lived close so I can eat here  every.single.day ! I have been coming here for years and every time I go-this place never disappoints. The sangria is great!!! The people that work there are all hard working. I suggest trying as much of every dish you can.

I've been coming here for years and I love, love love it.  Of all the tapas bars in the city, I find the food here to be the most consistent and delicious, and the atmosphere the most fun.  Grab a bunch of friends and make a party out of it!  This is a great place for any type of celebration. My favorite dishes on the menu (I've tried basically everything!) are the patatas bravas (best I've ever had outside of Spain), shrimp in garlic, bacon wrapped dates, goat cheese baked in tomato sauce, spinach & manchego stuffed mushrooms.... I could go on and on.  That's why it's best to go with a large group, so you don't feel weird ordering 12 dishes (though I've gone with one other person before and done it... you'll just have a lot of leftovers!). The sangria is also delicious, with the white usually being my favorite (they will have different fruit options available depending on the season). The only reason I am not giving them 5 stars is that they recently started doing delivery.  Having dined at the restaurant for many years, I know the food and the portion sizes, and though the prices were the same, both times I ordered for delivery the portions were greatly reduced.  I've seen other restaurants do this and I think it's fucking rude - just because they don't have to look you in the eye when they drop off the food, they think it's okay to cheat the customer?  I ordered the tomato goat cheese and it literally came with two tiny pieces of garlic bread, for $10 bucks - when you order this at the restaurant, it's like a cauldron of tomato and cheese with a whole basket of bread.  Anyway, I spent about $100 bucks on a delivery order for several people and we were all hungry when the food was gone, which is just a shame.  So, for that reason, I remove one star to punish you, Cafe Ba Ba Reeba!  Don't cheat your delivery customers! But if you go to the restaurant, you'll be in tapas heaven!

We had the traditional red sangria- not worth the 25$! It tasted like cold 10$ wine. The food, however, was reasonable and tasty. We would probably return, but would not spend the money on the alcohol. Our favorite dish was the goat cheese and tomato sauce.

I came here on a Thursday night with an old friend of mine. The average wait was fourth five minutes to an hour but the bar seating was immediate. The only difference from what I saw was that the bar area lacked natural light. However, it had a really nice date ambience with the candles and dim lighting. We of course sat at the bar tables.  We started off with the white peach sangria which was amazing. Not too sweet and perfect for a hot night. A half pitcher was enough for the two of us. We ordered six dishes. The deviled eggs(5/5), calamari (3/5), cooked salmon with dill (2/5), beef empanadas(5/5), the steak with chimichurri (3/5), and the spicy potatoes (3/5). My favorites were the deviled eggs and the empanadas hands down! The rest were delicious but I'd probably order something else my next time around to try something new.   The service was a little slow and you had to get the waiters attention at times. But it wasn't enough to put a damper on the night.  Overall, I'd definitely hit this place up again for tapas and delicious sangria!
Best. Food. Ever. We ate everything. And everything was amazing! The beef empanada was stupendous, and if you can, commit the paella!
Went here for my cousins rehearsal dinner in 9/2015/ Private room with great food and great service. Really close to Marquee Lounge and The Store.

After hearing a ton of hype, I have to say I was let down. The food, while being interesting, was nothing special (with the exception of the stuffed Mushrooms which were amazing!). The service was pretty good and the ambiance is unique.  There are a lot of options for vegetarians as well.

Talk about a well oiled machine.  Never seen tapas fly out of a kitchen so fast even on a Saturday night.  Everything was delicious at a good price.  Great place for a girls night out, first date, or double date.  Just watch your step near the pass...saw a lady bite it.

I loved the idea of making your own Bloody Mary at the bar. Everything is setup for you at the bar. They bring you a glass of vodka on ice and the rest is up to you. Tapas for brunch is not something I'm accustomed to having because I love breakfast and I don't like to share my food. I tend to be a picky eater. But this place changed my mind about it because I enjoyed everything we ordered. Food is great and the patio side of the restaurant is nice. I believe the roof of the patio opens, but it was not nice enough that day to see it I guess.

Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba was my first tapas restaurant experience and I was overly impressed. The paella was amazing and the sangria was perfect. I haven't been in a while but when I'm in the mood for tapas, Cafe Ba-Ba Reeba will be my first choice!

More like a 3 1/2 star review here but we rounded up on this one. The enclosed patio where we were seated was very nice. We ordered a number of tapas here; the patatas bravas, brussel sprout salad, pickled vegetable salad, the meatballs, spanish tortilla, chicken empanada, a kids mac and cheese, and a chocolate almond bar for dessert. We came during happy hour but were disappointed to find out it was only served at the bar. As we were dining with our 2 children, we couldn't take advantage of it. The restaurant has a nice kids menu and they give the kids crayons and wiki sticks. The mac and cheese was not great with neither of our kids really caring for it. Out of the tapas, the highlights were the patatas bravas and the meatballs. I like the brussel sprout salad while my wife found it too strong on horseradish.  Both the patatas, tortilla, and empanada came with a goopy sauce which seemed to be just a flavored mayonnaise. Service was good and prices are fair.

I have visited Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba many times!  A great place for a group, a date or just with a friend.  The Paella is awesome and I order it every time along with the Spinach with manchego stuffed mushrooms, beef tenderloin with blue cheese.  Mmmmm I can also not resist the Sangria.  It is delicious!  Can't wait to go back! :-)

When you think about tapas/small plates you may think you'll not get enough food, or that you have to get a lot tapas to be satisfied, but not here. I ordered few, like two or three tapas for two, and was more than enough. I've been here couple times, and the food was always good.
Great tapas! Wish we tried the paella but didn't save room. Really cool dining room with a hip crowd.
One of my favorite places for tapas!  The taste and quality of the ingredients are excellent and the service is always spot on!  Great for groups also!

I've never been to a tapas/small plates restaurant before (gasp!), and this was definitely the place I wanted to give my tapas virginity to.  I came on a Tuesday with some friends, so getting in wasn't an issue. We split a pitcher of sangria which was amazing. I easily could've drank an entire pitcher by myself (one woman did. She was throwing up in the bathroom. Happens to the best of us). I would recommend the berry.  We got a variety of different plates-some of my favorites were the Brussels sprout salad, chicken with peri peri sauce and steak with mashed potatoes. My favorite was hands down the burrata: the bread was crispy and light, the spread, which was sweeter than I anticipated, complemented the fresh mozzarella perfectly. Its like biting into a little cheesy piece of Heaven. The chorizo dates, which are $2 for one, are worth a try as well. They were warm and amazing and I probably could've eaten 5 more.
