I got the butterscotch dessert tapa, and it was rich and perfect. I tried the dessert ones my friends ordered and we passed around, and we all agreed the butterscotch was best.  I know there are a million more tapas restaurants to try, but I will definitely be back here soon!
had a lovely time, bright my parents there.
omfg... Some of the best food I've had in chicago! Don't hesitate to eat here and drink sangria!  ... I'm going to need to wear sweatpants tomorrow I'm so full!

Great food and great service. I highly recommend for brunch (not well enough known as a brunch place!). The brunch tapas are surprisingly well priced and delicious- the citrus French toast is to die for.  Dinner also good, but a tad pricey for the simplicity of the food you get.

Loved Cafe Ba ba reeba so much I returned the same day during Happy Hour with 3 of my girlfriends. The beef empanadas are a MUST try and $16 for a pitcher of Sangria is just too good to skip. I will surely be back.  PS - I wish they offer authentic Valencia Horchata ;)
Yummy sangrias and great tapas...but tell the waitstaff to stop taking dishes away before they're finished..

This place was everything we hoped...and then some!  The ambiance has a very cool feel and the staff was absolutely fantastic.  We had a couple of different plates and each one was great.  The pitcher of sangria was also fantastic.  Can't wait to go back!!!

SO. GOOD. I ducked into Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba before a show at Second City and sat at the bar with a yummy Mezcal Mule and dinner. I ordered: deviled egg (pintxos--good), grilled squid (tapas--delish), marinated boquerone anchovies (tapas--amaaazing) and 2 desserts: sea salt caramel custard and natilla flan. The flan was just like any flan but the custard was to die for. I would order the squid, anchovies and custard again in a heartbeat. Next time I'd like to try the croquette pintxo as the person next to me had it and I was jealous. Dining for one, it was a little too much food. I recommend 1 tapa, 2 pintxos and 1 dessert.

A cute tapas restaurant located in Lincoln Park. Love the surrounding neighborhood. Tapas that I tried: -devil eggs (5/5): one of the best deviled eggs I've had; love the crispy ham on top! -chorizo with pepper: (3/5) -potato and onion omelette: (2/5)   -spicy potatoes with tomato aioli: MUST ORDER loved this even though i don't like potatos (5/5) -wood oven veggies with pine nuts: (3/5) -bacon dates with apple and vinaigrette: (4/5) i've had better bacon wrapped dates -beef empanadas: GET THIS! love how puffy the pastry was and how decadent the beef filling was (5/5) Order the deviled eggs, spicy potatoes, and beef empanada. And of course, try one of their sangrias! I ordered a pitcher of the classic red sangria, and it was a bit too much for 2 people. But the sangria was strong and good.

This place is too fun!  I love bringing out of town guests here.  They have an excellent Spanish wine selection, and knowledgeable staff.  They are prompt with service... and also the drinks? Did I mention the drinks... they have great Sangria.  The blood orange was fantastic.  Also, definitely have the bacon wrapped dates.

One of my favorite Lettuce Entertain You chains! The sangria is the best I have ever had... basically to die for! The food is great because it's tapas style and you can try as much and as many options as you want! Love the patio area!
We had a private party here once and it was great. Their service and food are impecable. We also been here for dinner and brunch.
Great place for a larger group of people! Cool atmosphere and good sangria!

Cute little place serving Spanish style tapas. The serrano ham and the burratta are great, and so is everything else, but the surprise winner for me was the brussel sprout salad. Shaved, raw brussel sprouts with manchego cheese, dried berries, and a nice vinaigrette...yum! Good place for groups, but definitely make a reservation.

WOW.  We got introduced to this place and can't believe we went 4 years in Chicago without trying it.  Atmosphere is great, food is probably the best tapas in the city, and it's not going to break the bank like a lot of other places.  Nice way to eat........
I always have a great time when I'm there! Start out ordering slowly, the small plates really add up!

This place is perfect for dinner out with friends. I have been here for birthdays, work, family, and girls night out dinners. Always a hit. First off the ambiance is great. It's trendy and a lively, maybe a little too loud for grandma. You can get dressed up or show up in jeans and a comfy old T-shirt and fit in just fine. The menu is small plates and is best shared.  The staff is great at making suggestions both about specific dishes and the number you need for the size of your group.  Definitely get the bacon-wrapped dates. Huge hit, even for people who aren't sure they like dates. The paella is good for groups but I'd skip it if it's just two people because there are other things I like more. Obviously get a pitcher of sangria. This place is popular so definitely make a reservation. I have come here without one and sat at the bar, but I called ahead of time.
Yum, yum, yum!! Food comes out fast. Gets really busy on the weekends, so make sure you have a reservation. It's a fun place to take out of town guests.

I had heard great things about this place and happened to end up there for dinner during happy hour on my first visit. The happy hour menu was an incredible deal - each small plate was only $2-3 and we got a pitcher of sangria for $16. All of the tapas were great with the bacon wrapped dates, ham and chicken croquettes, meatballs, and beef empanada most notable. They also have pretty decent bread and olive oil at the table as well which is a nice touch. To top it all off, every staff member we interacted with was extremely nice and added to the enjoyment of the meal. Definitely recommended.

I've been dining here for over 27 years and they absolutely have the best Spanish food this side of España, and it keeps getting better. A glass or two of fino sherry to start with cold tapas, and wine throughout the rest is a more traditional way to dine. The sangria is the best anywhere but I have CBBR's recipe so I make it at home. The Gambas a la Plancha, Calamares a la Parilla, Tortilla Española, Pincho de Solomillo and many others from the original menu NEVER disappoint. I'm still awaiting the return of the Pastel de Cordero, though. I miss the Spanish or pseudo-Spanish music the likes of Julio Iglesias, Azúcar Moreno and the Gipsy Kings. (If my favourite Madrileño was crooning, I couldn't hear him.) And I'm not a fan of the 'ordering by number system' although I understand its purpose as the menu can be intimidating to the uninitiated. That's when knowledgable waitstaff will make your night. Request Tabitha to be your server, let her order for you and your experience will be fabulous!
Bleach!  That's all I can say from beginning to end. Yuck and yucky. No thanks.
Pretty tasty food, expensive for what you get, but we would return..

Love, love, love!!! Best tapas place in the city. The sangria is legit fire. Portions are pretty big so 3-4 plates is more than enough for 2 people. I love their weekend brunch menu to be specific. Make sure you order the bacon wrapped dates and spicy potatoes. Servers are awesome!

My last experience was so good but the server today ruined it. Last time was my first time dining here, and everything was perfect (the food and excellent server)! I was soooo looking forward to coming back so I recommended this place to my friends for one of us's farewell dinner since she was leaving town.  Okay, checking on us is good. But coming and asking too frequently whether we need anything else/ whether we're gonna order some more is a little uncomfortable. To me, experience is the second important thing (of course, the first thing is food) when I evaluate a restaurant but it was bad today. It felt like she wanted us to either order more or eat quickly and just leave. Yeah, more people started to come in for dinner but it wasn't that busy like last time when I came during the weekend. There were still empty tables. Also, when we got out receipt I wrote down my LettuceEats number on the receipt but it seemed like she didn't add it so I asked her and she said she'll add it later. I checked and it's not added. The supposedly warm/hot tapas dishes we ordered were generally quite cold when it came out. Seems like it was sitting there for a while before it was served to us.  Also, I told my friend that grilled octopus tapas they have here is so soft but what we actually had today was hard to chew. Since I had a really great time last time, I was really disappointed. I felt sorry to my friends for recommending. Before today I always recommended this place when people asked me some good places to dine but I don't think I will anymore. Well, they might have a good experience like when I first came, but I'm afraid they'll have a bad experience like i had today so I don't want to take that risk.

Overrated - but good dessert.  The food came out incredibly fast, all at once and on top of that it was all cold.  The octopus was overlooked, probably the worst I have had in the city.  I will say the atmosphere is great especially on the patio area when you walk in to the left.  And the desert was great!
I went to this place for my birthday and it was great. It's good for small or large groups. The have excellent Spanish food with great seafood. Very authentic place with a great theme.

My wedding shower was held in the private room here, and everyone had so many positive things to say about the food and the service!! Shout out to Hector, who kept all of the guests happy and knew what we wanted even before we did!

came here for a Monday dinner with my boyfriend,  he'd been here before but I had never been. We ordered plenty of tapas and all were delicious!  I really want to thank our two servers for the night Eduardo and katlyn (sorry if I misspelled your names). My boyfriend and I had no clue who was training, I had even suggested maybe they always have two servers. They both were very helpful and everything they recommended I loved ( keep in mind I'm not the most picky person but still).  My boyfriend and I were really impressed with the service, as well as them letting us know about the specials on Mondays! 1/2 off cocktails! There's really no words to describe how great they made our night that night ! Thank you again, keep up the great work! :)

Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba never fails me. I've been a multitude of times, and always give it as a recommendation to those visiting Chicago. It's a tapas place, so diners are meant to share a bunch of small plates around the table. Everything I've tried has been delicious, but in particular I would suggest: - Roast dates with bacon and apple vinaigrette - Goat cheese baked in tomato sauce - Brussels sprout salad (which is actually quite large) - Red wine sangria I love that their menu is so extensive, with lots of options for vegetarians and pescatarians. Also, if you check in on Yelp you get a free dessert tapa!  The service is always good, and very attentive. This restaurant is popular though! So expect it to always be busy and a little loud. Many people come here for special occasions because they can accommodate larger groups and the atmosphere is lively. You can make a reservation ahead of time on Opentable, or try your luck just walking in. Either way, make sure to check out this awesome eatery!

I wanted to have a bridal shower for my future daughter in law who has been a vegy since birth . I also needed vegan gluten free options . I couldn't of asked for the perfect day. The private room we had was beautiful . The menu was perfect . Our server Hector was kind and wonderful a true professional . Alison the head of events always followed through with me and was lovely to work with . All the options where labeled . We had white sangria and an alcohol free punch that everyone loved . This is a wonderful place for showers and party's . I was able to have a wonderful time as a hostess without any concerns .
My husband and I love this restaurant SO much! We go here every time we have something to celebrate, and I always bring family here when they are visiting. The foods great and the sangria is AMAZING!
Bacon wrapped dates and garlic shrimp with a pitcher of sangria is so much better than a bar on the weekends.  Friendly service, outdoor seating area, and shopping and ice cream down the street!

Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba has amazing sangria. I can't wait to visit again! I absolutely love tapas. The food was so tasty, I practically had everthing! The restaurant is very cute it doesn't look as big as it actually is from outside. Its very dim and relaxing. Large tables and friendly staff! Loving it!
One of the best Spanish meal I have ever had every one of the tapas were outstanding can't wait to taste the paella I stopped in the middle of my meal to review this meal that's how good it was

This place is alright for like a first date.  The food is ok not exceptional.  You can however always count on it having great service and the food will always be cooked well.  The main reason for that is because it is a Lettuce Entertain You restaurant and they always have their stuff together no matter what.

Great place for tapas! I had the goat cheese and tomato sauce dip and the patatas braves and both were delicious. The service could use a LOT of work. We kept having to look for the waiter and wave him down - it was a little annoying because we didn't want to have to do that, but he would not come by us and we had no choice. The food is great though and I don't want to fully rate a place on bad service. Check it out!

When I get tapas I like to pretend I'm an angry giant being fed by villagers who are scared I'll ruin their crops. Four stars - while the food made me feel giant, there was a lack of people wielding pitchforks and screaming about the harvest.

An excellent place to take visitors for a fun time, good buzz, and full stomach - all without breaking the bank! First of all, sign up for their texting service- about once a month, Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba issues a special free food item. You can log on to their website and sign up directly there (right panel). Secondly, there's almost always a Yelp checkin special - also for free food. There used to be a foursquare one, but foursquare..is no more. Third, if you're going during a popular time..PUT IN A RESERVATION. You and your guests will thank you. Now...before you order any food. Get some sangria in ya! It's tapas for goodness sakes! They normally have a seasonal, but I love sticking to the traditional red - Not overwhelmingly sweet and shared among a few friends, a decent value. I've been here more times than I can count. Without writing an essay for you, my recommendations:  - brussel sprouts salad, marcona almonds, manchego cheese ($6) - spicy potatoes with tomato alioli (patata bravas) ($6) - rioja-braised short rib, manchego mashed potatoes, roasted seasonal vegetables & rioja wine glaze ($12) - grilled hanger steak with charred green chili chimichurri & fingerling potatoes ($10) - grilled octopus with green harissa, smoked potatoes & olives ($12) - buttermillk-fried chicken thighs, piri-piri sauce & shaved vegetable salad ($7) Now keep in mind, these are tapas so the portions are far from big. Normally when I go with a big group I get a few servings of the Paella to make sure we're all full. I normally go with the seafood paella with shrimp, monkfish, clams & green beans ($17 per serving) PS: They also have a happy hour. Last I checked, it was $16 pitchers of sangria, and select tapas at 1985 prices. M-F 4-6. Go get'em.
One of my favorite restaurants. The bacon wrapped dates are to die for.  I can eat a whole order myself.  Always have great service and have not had a bad thing to say.  Good for dates and groups.
Not great for vegetarians, but good if you eat seafood and fish. It's loud, lots of TVs with sports on, big bar area. Can be fun, but it's loud. Waiter service was good even at the bar.

Everybody rants and raves about this place and I don't seem to understand why. When I dined at Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba (dined-in twice to confirm), the food presentation was sloppy, some of the warm plates were colder than expected, and the overall quality of the food was "meh". This place seems to have a cult following and advertises all over the city. If you live in Chicago, try it to say you tried it since one of your friends will eventually mention their "mind-blowing" experience at Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba.

Went here for happy hour with my girlfriend a few nights ago. Ordered a beer before she got there, then we shared a pitcher of red sangria. Ordered a few pinxos and tapas, everything was quite good. Left for a very reasonable price and felt comfortably full and content from the sangria. The only reason I can't give five stars is due to a post dining customer service reason. I left my sunglasses at the bar and realized later that night that I had not picked them up. Being a few miles away already without a car, I decided to wait until the morning to call for them. The next morning I called shortly after they opened. I was told they were very busy and to call back. I thought this was fine, I'd rather have them be honest then just pretend to look. Calling later on during the later afternoon I was greeted with a similar response, but this time I said I'd wait on hold until they had a chance to look. Not 40 seconds later I was told they didn't have them and they were sorry. Maybe they looked, maybe they didn't. Either way I retraced all my steps and that was the only logical place for the sun glasses to be. The knock is for potential employee honesty issues, other than that keep doing what you're doing. I'm sure it was just one bad egg that decided to swipe them.

I love this place, it's  one of my favorite restaurants and also the best Tapas restaurant I have ever been to. You wouldn't think the same items at different tapas restaurants would be so different .. but it is very noticeable to me, that this place just does everything a notch better. You definitely need a reservation though. Even though the place is huge, it is always packed.

Love Ba Ba Reeba so much, it's one of the few places I'll go to over and over.   Great ambiance for various settings. Good for both group outings and dates.  This place is also a great option for vegetarians and pescetarians.  I definitely recommend the patatas bravas, the tortilla espanola, the citrus cured salmon, the peppers, and stuffed mushrooms.  I'm not a sangria fan but every time I've gone the people I was with liked it. Definitely make a reservation if you can, we waited 2 hours.

Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba is hands down one of my favorite places in Chicago. It can get pretty busy so it is nice they take reservations. Try to snag a seat outside in the first room as the natural lighting makes for a perfect afternoon/early dinner. The back is a little more crowded/but oddly romantic if you're looking for that atmosphere. I find that when I go here it's the best when the table orders a pitcher of sangria to share (possibly more depending on the size). Then we each order two tapas, one for ourselves only and one to split with the table (if you're trying to pay for a normal cost meal). And a dessert to split (despite the small portion) is actually quite perfect to tie it all together. Here are all the items I've tried.  DRINKS: Sangria is a must, and I highly recommend the White Peach. I've had their Blood Orange Special, and the Passion Fruit, but they don't compare to the White Peach. I could drink a pitcher alone. FOOD: Vegetables  -Brussel sprout salad (#22) not a fan of brussel sprouts but it was pleasant (not filling though) -Wood Oven Roasted Veggies w/Pinenuts (#28) very tasty, good for vegetarians  -Spicy Potatoes (#30) not super spicy but a perfect amount of kick and flavor -Spinach & Manchego-stuffed Mushrooms (#31) I order these every time! Must have -Goat Cheese baked in Tomato sauce (#32) great for group sharing but they give you bread anyways so I kind of pass this one unless someone else from my group orders MEAT: -Beef Skewer, horseradish (#54) DO NOT SHARE. You will regret it because it is so good you just want it for yourself. This is one of my favorite items! -Shrimp with garlic, olive oil (#44)- Other favorite if you like seafood, this is good! Just make sure to flick off the red pepper flakes if you aren't into spicy! DESSERTS: -Caramelized Banana- Probably one of the most underrated options at the restaurant. THIS IS AMAZING. Probably could make it home but so worth $3.  -Butterscotch custard- small portion, but again just melts in your mouth and the perfect bites. DISLIKE: -The only menu item I haven't really enjoyed was the chicken & ham croquetas (#63)- unfortunately my experience was like a few sad soggy corndogs.  -The paella is alright, but honestly I don't find it all that exciting and definitely not worth how much it is.
Super delicious tapas and house made sangria. Great atmosphere for brunch, dinner or late night drinks.
Delicious and great service. Had a wonderful dinner here while visiting family in Chi-town.

My favorite restaurant the city. Never had a bad meal here and no one I've brought here has disliked it. Their sangria is top notch. I've not tried the paella but all of my friends love it. The tapas are scrumptious. I love the goat cheese and tomato sauce with garlic bread; the bacon-wrapped dates; the spinach and manchego stuffed mushrooms; the potato omelette; beef tenderloin; and the empanadas. The staff always is so nice and friendly. I came here for my birthday one year and our server was so kind. She absolutely made my day and everyone had a wonderful time. I tipped her an extra $20 because she was so great.

Selection alone makes this worth a try, of the 6 pintxos and 5 dinner tapas and 5 dessert tapas, I can honestly say I enjoyed them all. My favorite was probably the short rib. We ordered all of the above for two people and it was really too much. They suggest 2-3 per person and I agree. Be prepared for a leisurely meal, I liked that they didn't bring all the tapas at one time, but it did make the dining experience long. I thought the staff was great, really quick to clear plates making room for more. Had a good cocktail selection and a reasonable beer list. Would like to come back next time I'm in town.
Great taps and sangria always at a consistently high level. I've never had a single item I didn't thoroughly enjoy

A friend of mine has been trying to get me to go here for years, but it wasn't till I got a Lettuce Entertain You gift card that I took the plunge. The hubby, some friends and I decided to go check it out. Half a block away we could already smell the amazing food. We started with a pitcher of peach sangria. Lovely! One friend got the grilled squid with olive and garlic. I'm not a fan of arugula or tons of garlic, but this dish was perfectly balanced! So yummy. The shrimp skewers and cheese plate were good, though I didn't care for the guava cube or the orange marmalade. However the absolute BEST thing we had was the shrimp paella. I'd heard of paella, but had never had it. We ordered the smaller portion to split 4 ways, and it was FANTABULOUS! I'm talking lick the plate clean and think about ordering some more... The server was excellent, keeping tabs on us, but not hovering too much. Also, because there was a Yelp coupon, I got a free butterscotch pudding which was frankly the best I've ever had.  The ONLY problem with Tapas is that its so good and you are having such a good time that is is really easy to rack up a big bill. I will TOTALLY be back again. I had no idea what I was missing.

Always a great choice for large group parties, birthdays, and events. Such a fun ambiance, prices are decent, and the food is consistently good. Paella is an absolute must. I'm a vegetarian and I always find enough to eat - would recommend the veg paella, Brussels sprout salad, baked goat cheese, and stuffed mushrooms. The almond caramel bar for desert is also delicious.

Such a fun place to get dinner with friends, not to mention the sangria options are amazing! The tapas are average size and price but they are delicious.  I recommend the 'Handmade Beef Empenada' and the 'Beef Skewer', they are my two favorite. However, I have had plenty of other options there as well and they are all amazing! The food comes out quickly so definitely order in sections and don't be deceived by how little they look, they will fill you up quickly! If you are a tapas lover and in the Chicago area, I definitely recommend.
Fun environment, but very long wait. Make sure to have reservations on a Saturday night! Other than that the food was good! I got the sampler plate, fried calamari and the stuffed mushrooms.

The food here is very tasty. I came here on a double date. For food we had the bacon wrapped dates and they were probably the entire table's favorite. We next did the goat cheese baked in tomato sauce which was paired with garlic bread- no complaints there! The short rib was very tasty and cooked tenderly-we all loved this one too. We all also enjoyed the shrimp with garlic. I really liked the calamari since it was really crispy.  The chicken empanada was also very flavorful and we all liked that more so than the beef one. We finished with the meatballs which were nothing special and not worth it with so many other delicious items on the menu! The portions were small but it was sufficient for 4 of us to taste everything and still leave stuffed. I had a virgin sangria which I thought was very good and I couldn't tell the difference. The boys felt the drinks were a little too fruity since sangria is pretty much the only option here. The other downside was that the food came out super fast and our meal went very quickly so take your time with ordering if you want to relax and spend time with your friends/family. One tip we would give to this tapas restaurant is to provide serving spoons for the dishes. We were luckily seated next to the food service area and could grab spoons as we pleased but it really is a necessity when you are sharing plates.

My friends and I were very hungry so we tried a lot of food. We were pleased with all of the chosen tapas except for the pork belly. We expected to get crunchy pork belly, but all the fat (we like that on pork belly) was removed and it was rather soft. It might not have been the description on the menu for that specific item, so I don't fault them for it. Our expectation was just different. The sangrias we ordered were divine. We loved the atmosphere and the good service too.

Friendly staff. Great place to have brunch on Sundays. You can get items off of the dinner menu if you ask. Beef dishes are always a sure thing such as the blue cheese crusted filet or the beef skewer with grilled onions and horseradish sauce. Croquettas are far better than Cafe Iberico. Great place for a group.

Food is really good.  All small portions except the paella its huge and very authentic.  The variety of vodka sangria pitchers is delicious. The plates are tiny but food is very filling.make a reservation ahead of time.  Decor is good. Music is loud and enclosed patio get hot in the winter with heaters shooting vapor at you.   Food comes out pretty quick.

So we are driving  around d trying to find a place for brunch as we just happened upon this gem. Great bloody Mary  bar, awesome tapas and a perfectly inviting ambiance. Excellent glad we found this place, do check it out!

The tapas selection is great and the food is good. On a busy saturday night though, service can be a little slow. We had a large party of about 15, so I'm taking that into consideration. Definitely a Good date night or group outing spot. It looks small on the outside, but has room indoors. Though they cram you in.

Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba is one of my favorite tapas places! I've only been there once but I already can't wait to go back. I had the baked goat cheese in tomato sauce, spicy potatoes with tomato alioli, and shrimp with garlic olive oil and red pepper flakes. Everything was so delicious, and the staff was very nice. The service was pretty quick even though the wait was long. I would definitely recommend going!

I am 100% OBSESSED with this restaurant. I am not one to go to the same place again and again unless I find it exquisite, which I do. First let me start with how you need to go on a day that they serve brunch. I can't go to ba ba eeba and not get one or two deviled eggs with crispy jamon serrano. They are out of this world!!! Second, do yourself a favor and get the passion fruit sangria. Amazing. You really can not go wrong with any of the tapas. If it is your first time I recommend getting the goat cheese baked in tomato sauce, but again every tapa I have ordered I have thoroughly enjoyed.  The only reason I didn't give five stars is because the service is always slow. It always takes my server a long time to get to my table, which means that you should put as many tapas as you can in right away because they do not all come out at the same time.  Cafe ba ba reeba i loooooove you and i am sure ill see you this weekend.
I always come here with my best friend. Every time we come here we order something different and each dish is always so delicious!!! This is one of my favorite restaurants in lincoln park.
Love the spicy potato and beef skewer. Spicy potato has a flavor of hummus and chili, for which my friend refer to as Chinese spicy source "Lao Gan Ma".  Nice environment and good neighborhood

Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba is an excellent tapas bar and Lincoln Park standard bearer for over 30 years. I've been a number of times in my years living in Chicago, for both weekend brunch and dinner. I was in for dinner again last night and am very happy to report they still certainly know what they are doing.  The sangria menu is extensive - and they were featuring a white pear as the special of the day. Seeing as we like red wine - we went with the Classic red. Unfortunately of the 6 or so sangrias on the menu, 5 of them are white... that's probably the only complaint I can find about this place.  On the menu there's a ton to pick from - the baked goat cheese in sauce, buttermilk chicken, dates, and beef with blue cheese are some of my favorites. The paella is also good, granted I've only tried the seafood one - but they're a bit more of a commitment (30 min wait, minimum two serving order per table). Also, I tried the calamari on the most recent visit and was kind of disappointed, it wasn't bad by any means but it wasn't anything special. In the seafood section - either of the scallop empanada or the garlic, red pepper, oil shrimp are very good.
The ambiance and sangria were great! The place is relatively inexpensive for tapas and they are able to accommodate large groups.

Go here! Reservations are highly recommended, quite possibly required since we couldn't get a table for 2 days on Opentable. Once in however, we were in awe of all the well plated dishes. I still crave the food we explored. It was worth the trip outside the loop to enjoy a laid back eclectic vibe. It was a bit noisy but this seemed to be a popular place for group eating. There were 2 parties going on around us.. so much fun!

The highlights of this meal were the chorizo wrapped dates, shrimp pinxtos, pork paella. Everything on the tapas menu was worth a try and was well priced. Truly tapas sizes where the goal is to try as many tiny dishes as possible. The sangria was also fantastic. Service was wonderful as well. All around best meal in Chicago!
Wow. What a good Reasturant.  Each and every order we have was really good.  The combination or "supporting" flavors to the main dish was great success.  We WILL be back

Such a fun environment and the food/drinks are amazing. I went with a group on a busy Friday night and we enjoyed Sangria and Tapas (Empanadas, Chicken Skewers, Brussel Sprout Salad, Steak, Meat and Cheese and more but I forget) Would absolutely return - it's always crowded and they have a beautiful patio

Our group of 5 came here for dinner and it was my first time here, I instantly fell in love. The setting was beautiful, it was romantic and the lights were dimmed. Love the variety of food and they were tapas style! Fun little dinner party place. We order red wine and a few of everything on the menu, the beef skewers and blue cheese were my favorite. I could've ate 5 more orders of it! yum! Can't wait to go back!
I love this place! The food and drinks are great!! It is reasonably priced but make sure that you make a reservation - this place is busy all the time.
Very good service, solid food and a great value for money. No mater how hungry you may be the paella is worth the wait.

Lived in Chicago for 3 years and already been here at least 15 times. It's incredible! Fun atmosphere, great for dates or big groups (went for a bachelorette party and they easily accommodated 15 people at one table). The tapas are amazing and inexpensive ($5-10 on average per tapa, plan to get about 2 per person, served family style), cheaper during happy hour at the bar.  Must try the sangria (pitchers around $20 easily serve 4-6 people), patatas bravas, bacon wrapped dates, and empanadas. Brunch is also delicious.
I cam here for a Christmas party for work and let's just say this place didn't disappoint. The food --- So, so good! And the white Sangria --- on point! Mmm, Sangria.

I came here with 2 friends who love this place and come often. We made reservations ahead of time and were seated immediately. It was a Wed night at 730pm. They were pretty busy but seemed to have some free tables. Drink. We started with white wine sangria.4/5.  Yum! Lots or oranges and lemons with the rinds so don't expect to really eat any of the fruit though.  Food. We got the appetizers sampler. 4/5. The deviled egg was surprisingly good and the bruschetta with Apple and sausage was decent.  Seafood paella. 5/5 A must have! Save room for this and don't order too many tapas! It's one of the best paellas I've ever had with lots of seafood and yummy crispy rice. They serve it to you straight from the skillet.  Sausage tapas. Okay. 3/5. Maybe not a fan of sausage but it wasn't anything special.  Bacon wrapped dates. 4/5. Very good. I was already expecting it to be quite amazing, given the Yelp reviews. Not disappointed. I would order again. There are about 6-7 to an order. Dessert. 3/5. I ordered the caramelized bananas tapa. It was a nice small size - good for one person who just wants to finish off the meal with something sweet. However, it's pretty ordinary. The banana could have been warmer too. I would probably try a different dessert next time.  Overall, great service and food. I would go back if I'm in the Chicago area.
Great ambiance and delicious food! We got a pitcher of their classic red sangria and several vegetarian tapas to share. They were all delicious!
Get the bacon wrapped dates, your life will be forever changed.  Always amazing food and service.
The dates and the salad were my favorite. Delicious desserts! Sangria pitcher is a good deal for a group. Yum!

I think it was more the awful service that put me off on this place, the food is ok and good if you go with a lot of people so you can try many things. The drinks and weak at best and the service was bad, don't know if our server was having an off night but it was not good.

Quick service,  decent tapas,  and nice space.   However,  forget about a peaceful meal.  During their usual busy lunch it is much louder than we cared for.  Another issue is the very salty squid.. it would be nice to taste the squid, not the ocean it came from.  Pretty good,  but for the price,  one could certainly do better.   A solid three stars.

Reservation for Monday were easy for 6 people. They sat us right away even though the entire party wasn't present.  They had half-off cocktail specials (the Barca Blues was my favorite). This was my 1st visit but I have tried their food before as my office catered from here for special events. The food was all pretty good.  We had the...  - Serrano wrapped date from the pinxtos menu  - batatas bravas (can't go wrong) - the super tender short rib - octopus (Mmm), and  - the ever indulgent garlicky shrimp.  - the only dish that was sub par was the pork shoulder with apples and chestnuts...it was an odd flavor compared to the rest of the dishes.  - For dessert, we girls shared a salted caramel butterscotch custard and the glazed bananas.  The service was attentive and aimed to please. Overall, this is a great place for pretty much any occasion or non-occasion. I can see how this place can get busy. The space is big with nice décor and great food and service.

I've been here twice now and the food has been delicious both times.  My favorite dishes are: Braised Shortrib Goat Cheese in Tomato Bacon wrapped Dates I'm sure there are many more delicious tapas but these stood out. Great sangria as well!
Always on the hunt for tapas where ever I go. Traveling to Chicago and heard about the spot from locals. Delicious, great atmosphere and very attentive staff. Grab some chorizo!

The food is really good here. Also,the ambience is beautiful. You need to make reservations ahead of time. This place is always packed and hence if you are planning for a quiet dinner, you should think of some other place. The sangria and goat cheese is a 'must-try'.

Comfortable, low key atmosphere; good prices. More importantly, great food, atmosphere and service. Tonight we had Corinna who gave thoughtful recommendations, took care of under seasoned + overcooked calamari, and kept a genuine smile throughout the evening. Great experience - thank you :)

Took my now girlfriend to here for first date.  She loved the food, and so did I. We held hands for the first time after the meal. Thanks ba-ba-ree-ba. We've now been dating for almost 2 years. We still talk about this place.

This restaurant is alright. It's highly likely that I'd never come here again. Service is great and the atmosphere/decor is really nice. However, one ultimately returns to a restaurant for the food. And the food just isn't cutting it for me. Not impressed. We ordered a few tapas plates to share. I wish all of the food came to the table at once but that's not the case here. The food is plated very well (although the portion sizes are ridiculously small, even for tapas) and gets you really excited to dive in and taste. But when you do taste the food it's nothing special. It lacks salt, the food is cold, mostly everything was nasty, even the desserts we tried. The only thing I enjoyed was the fried chicken bites and the braised rib (which could still use some salt). I just think the flavor was lacking. Idk maybe a bad night? Also, I think this place is overpriced for the mediocre food :/ eh!

This is a really fun place for brunch just because there are so many tapas options that you can go with! At the same time, the menu can be quite overwhelming, again because of the number of options. My favorites were the citrus french toast, the short rib sliders, the serrano ham eggs benedicts, and the spinach and artichoke crepe. We got a ton of other tapas which were also fantastic but these were probably the ones I would definitely order again. A few of us also split a pitcher of the pear sangria which was a sweet sangria but it didn't really taste very much like pear unfortunately.  The best part is you get a free dessert tapas with each person who checks in on yelp! We ended up with a couple of desserts from the check ins including the caramelized banana, natilla flan (which has a really great saffron flavor), the almond caramel bar and the chocolate truffle cake. All were really yummy!  As usual with tapas, keep track of how much you're ordering because it can easily get out of hand with the amount and dollar signs!

This was my first time here and overall this place succeeds with tapas. I was part of a large group for a friend's birthday and we ordered a ton of food. Some plates that I enjoyed included: grilled skewer of marinated pork belly and pork loin, beef tenderloin and blue cheese, grilled hangar steak with mojo picon, spicy potatoes with tomato alioli, goat cheese baked in tomato sauce, roasted dates with bacon and apple vinaigrette, garlic potato salad, catalan bread with ripe tomato and the chef's artisanal cheese selection. I was quite full after sampling everything mentioned above. The white peach sangria washed everything down quite nicely.  The restaurant is large and had some nice mood lighting which I appreciated. Service was just ok. Even though our server managed to have the tapas spaced appropriately he did forget a few dishes and a couple of us had to remind him about drinks we ordered. He was lacking a personality. I've noticed over the years that many LEYE restaurants have delicious food but noticeably sullen, robotic or easily agitated servers.  It's one of the greatest mysteries of the modern world. All in all though, this fun place is still worth a visit. xoxo

I was definitely very satisfied with my first visit to Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba! and am looking forward to my next visit because I really liked the food.  Firstly, I had no trouble doing my reservation through Opentable, and we were taken and seated immediately when we got there. It is really easy to get to the place, although I do not recommend going with your own car because parking might be hard.  The exterior of the place is not very enticing but once you are inside it is a whole different story. The place was packed and the atmosphere was great. We did not wait long to be served, and the server made some really good recommendations. She was very nice andcattentive overall and answered all of our requests pretty quick. Me and my companion decided to drink sangria with the dinner. I would say it was ok.  For the food, I wanted to order some really typical Spanish stuff so we went with Tortilla, Croquetas, Calamares, and Jamon. Overall, they were really good and they were close to the flavours of my country. The only one that fell a bit short was the jamon, but it was still good. It certainly met my expectations.  I will definitely go back, considering how much I miss Spanish food and how good this place is, and also I highly recommend it.

Love love love Cafe BaBaReeba! They are always booked, which is very much a representation of their popularity! My faves are the bacon wrapped dates, patatas bravas, jamon iberico. Great food and ambiance!

I was very impressed by Ba-Ba-Reeba! I'm not sure what was better - the pitchers of sangria, the excellent staff service or the food. With an 8pm reservation we were seated by 815 and had some sangria while we waited. Our server (whose name escapes me but was a delight) was extremely knowledgeable and made wonderful suggestions. We had baked goat cheese, short ribs, olives, spicy chorizo and chicken skewers, stuffed mushrooms and the almond desert.  For the size of the tapas I was impressed - it was honestly a lot of food for just two people and we couldn't finish everything. The exterior of this restaurant is deceiving, because this place is huge. While it may be large, latin and loud, this is a fantastic late night/date spot still maintains a great level of intimacy.  Would absolutely go back.

Took my mom here for her 60th birthday. EVERYTHING was excellent! The short ribs PHENOMENAL! The butterscotch custard OMG!!!! Our server Joe was equally awesome with his explanation of the menu and his recommendations on the drinks and food. Will most certainly visit again!
Love the tapas here. Small plates of Spanish offerings. Set is wows here. Haven't tried anything I don't like.

Was walking around Lincoln Park looking for a place to eat with some friends and ended up trying this place on a whim, and I'm so glad we did! This place is great! The restaurant is huge and even on a Monday night was packed! We were only told a 10-15 minute wait which was great, but what was even better was that we ended up actually getting seated right away. The staff is super friendly and our waiter (I think his name was Daniel?) was awesome. He was so nice and really knowledgeable about the food, and they have a pretty extensive menu. One of the people I was with ended up not getting one of her plates, which wasn't a big deal, we just wanted to bring it to their attention so she wouldn't be charged for it. But he did us one better and actually took the item off the bill and also brought her the missing order to go! Great staff, environment and food! If you're in the area, definitely go!

This is by far one of the best tapas places in Chicago! Located in the vibrant Lincoln Park area, it is only a short walk from the CTA brown line. Although parking can be hard to come by depending on how busy the time of the day is, you might get lucky scoring street parking on one of the side streets.  The prices and portions of Café BabaReeba's foods are quite good. Note that it is a tapas place and hence most items are small portions and are meant for sharing. Please be sure to come with a few friends so that you can make the most of your experience by trying a bunch of different items without breaking bank. And given the wide variety of food offered here, it is well worth trying a handful of different items.  These items are probably my go-to, all time favorites:- Chorizo-Wrapped Medjool Date & Cheese  Perfect combo with the date bringing the sweetness and chorizo bringing the bold richness. Spicy Potatoes with Tomato Alioli  MY FAVORITE!!! So, so good!! Spinach & Manchego-Stuffed Mushrooms  Light but delicious veggie item. Grilled Hanger Steak  I got mine medium rare and it was done just perfect! So juicy and tasty. Seared Lamb Loin  Seared to perfection. Meat was super tender. Seared Sea Scallops  This was excellent! Perfectly seared but soft and juicy on the inside.  Grilled Octopus  Typical but delicious. Skewered Chicken & Chorizo Sausage  A good filler as the meat helps curb your appetite especially if you're there to try a bunch of stuff but not stuff yourself. This is truly an amazing option for tapas (and note that their sangrias are pretty freaking awesome too) - I can't wait for my next visit =)
Great place! Food is terrific, staff is friendly, and they take reservations. Parking can be a bit rough, but it's worth the hike. PS: Their spicy potatoes are amazing!

My favorite place for date night! And they have great sangria. The bacon wrapped dates are a solid go to plate. We love the small plates because it allows us to try something new without over committing.  And we are never disappointed with our choices! The restaurant has good ambiance too

I really do love this place, I've been so many times. It is a cute spot, tons of seating with smaller, more intimate rooms. Great sangria, so many flavor options. Bacon wrapped dates, the goat cheese and tomato sauce, curried chicken salad and the ham and cheese croquettess are my favs. That chicken salad is seriously awesome. Plus with Lettuce Entertain you, you always know you will have a great experience. My family also hosted my baby shower here! It was so nice. We had our own private room with exposed brick walls and tons of space. The service was excellent! Always find myself coming back again and again:)

One of the best meals that I've had in a long time! The tapas were ridiculously good and everything on the menu was delicious. The potatoes were my favorite tapas that we chose, but they all were outstanding! The food was hot, flavorful, and delicious! It's the perfect place for casual dining, spending time with friends, or even a casual date! The servers and staff are SO friendly and definitely knowledgable and helpful when it comes to giving recommendations. I will definitely be coming back!

Every time I came to Chicago, I always made sure to make a stop here, whether it be for the amazing Bloody Mary bar at brunch or tapas for dinner, everything has always been delicious. Now I live here and look forward to being a regular!

The food is amazing. The service was good. And the prices aren't bad! I went here for my 25th birthday dinner and was very happy when I left. I would recommend making a reservation a week or so in advance to guarantee a table.

This place was awesome. We had the Brussel sprout salad, spicy potatoes, ham and cheese croquettes and the bacon wrapped dates.  Everything we had was delicious. 4 plates was more than enough food for 2 people. I also had the butterscotch custard dessert, so good. Still thinking about it. Great atmosphere.

By far my fave Spanish tapas restaurant, consistently, for over a decade. A great hit born out of Lettuce Entertain You and there's a reason why this spot is jam packed weekday through weekends. The sangrias are delightful and the wide range of tapas offers something tasty for just about everyone. I highly recommend reservations, especially on the weekends. My go to tapas are: gazpacho, spicy potatoes, the garlic potato salad, beef skewers, seared scallops, seafood paella,fried chicken thighs & bacon wrapped dates. I also order a "michelada" which is  a Bloody Mary with ice cold beer instead of vodka. This place is very consistent and never disappoints. Very lively atmosphere, not a place to go for intimate conversations.

I thought the food was fine but nothing fantastic. My heart and stomach are not called back to Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba. We had shrimp, scallops, bacon wrapped dates, and the spicy potatoes (probably the most memorable dish out of them all). Portion sizes were reasonable for the price, and the two of us were pretty stuffed with 4 dishes. Not a bad experience by any means but I would say this place is quite average. Not really much to write home about.

I can not wait to come back!! By far one of the best dinners I've had in a month! Can't even get over the prices! Ask for Johnny! He's amazing and couldn't be more accommodating and amazing if he tried! All in all, go! Have fun and enjoy!!!

Yummmm tapas and sangria. Never been a better combination!  I've been here a few times, both with small parties and large groups. The restaurant is great for both options - huge space, but has more intimate seating as well. Things I love: spicy potatoes (crispy potatoes with this amazing tomato-based sauce), bacon-wrapped dates (duh), goat cheese baked in tomato sauce (the most succulent goat cheese atop a ridiculously good tomato sauce, served with bread), buttermilk fried chicken thighs.  Service could be better, taking a star off for that. But all in all, delicious food and the rotating seasonal sangrias are always fabulous!

I give it two stars because the waiting times are ridiculous and the food is mediocre, nothing special like the other yelpers rave. I'd come here again because I live near by but I will not wait five minutes to be seated.
Good Spanish food. Not great, though. Ba-Ba-Reeba caters to high volume for profit.

Tapas + sangria = PERFECTION. This is the perfect place to go with your girlfriends. You can't really go wrong with any of the tapas but you should definitely order the spicy potatoes! They also have a happy hour everyday at the bar during a specific time with $3 select tapas (they have a pretty decent selection for happy hour including 5-6 different tapas I believe). AND THE SANGRIA!! You must order the sangria (whatever special they have at the time). Beautiful ambiance with string lights as well

Amazingly delicious food! I always get the spicy potatoes, bacon wrapped dates, meatballs, and shrimp. The sangria is delicious too! Any one you choose won't let you down. The wait staff if so attentive, not just the waiters. I've been there countless times and I'm never let down.

This is a great find and a must visit on the weekends !! A little far away from the Michigan Avenue downtown , however  it's a must visit as u'll just love the ambience And would love to visit it again And again ! And yes the variety of sangria 's are to die for :D the stuffed mushroom , meat balls ,chicken and shrimp are worth having with the pitchers ! Also they have happy hours for the food after 10pm !!
Go every  birthday, Valentines day, wedding anniversary,  and any time I want to celebrate  something - always good and always get two  pitchers of sangria.

Always delicious. I don't dine out very often these days, but - in the decades I've dined here - the food is always wonderful and the staff is professional (and very nice)! I especially like the 'outdoor-ish' patio section.

Classy but fun Tapas restaurant. The food is soooo good, even though they have small portions, you only need a couple plates to feel full. I've been here for a range of events, from birthday parties to class reunions to touristy meet and greets, this place is perfect for any occasion. They even have valet!

The tapas were excellent! My first time at this location and I will be back. The wait was really long but the server next to the bar greeted us and sat us at the bar tables. The bartender that served us was excellent. He was very knowledgable of the menu and gave great choices . The food came out very quickly to my surprise and was delicious, fresh, and hot. Great place to dine on a date, casual dining, and just hanging out.

We went for restaurant week and had a great time! The sangria is plentiful, creative, and tasty. My favorite thing we tried was the seafood paella-- it's exactly what paella should be: crispy rice, bold flavors, and plenty of shrimp, scallops, and fish. We'll be back!!

I had a friend in town and he has never been to a tapas restaurant and we were in the area so we found a seat at the bar at Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba.  We were served quickly and received all of our small plates as they were ready from the kitchen.  Every plate we received was delicoius - some portions larger than others.  The bartender who was serving us gave us some tips on which items were larger than others!   I would highly suggest giving this place a try whether its for a girls night out or a romantic date night.

I used to go here back in the 90s and it was like no other place I had been before. Of course, it was my first experience with tapas. The fact that they let you sit there and enjoy your food (which was excellent) and drink for hours without rushing you out was completely novel to me. The last time I went there, everything was awful. The food was barely passable (overdone, lacking flavor). We had to be moved from our original table because the noise was absolutely deafening. The service was also barely passable. I have no desire to go back. Not when there are tapas places now that provide an enjoyable experience where you don't have to feel your head vibrate from the screeching drunk women surrounding you and you can get fresh, flavorful food.
Went here with a friend on a weekday night. A huge fan of the small plates available. Sangria was great. Paella was pretty flavorless.

This place lives up to its name. The food was really placed at a good price, the food was fantastic and the service/ambiance was wonderful. Great place to impress your significant other! The only thing I recommend is to make reservations asap. It gets really busy fast.

This place is great! I love the bacon covered dates their always on point. And my cousin has gluten issues and a lot of the items on the menu are gluten free, which I thought was really cool. Great for big parties! The only reason I don't give it a 5 star is because I make reservations there and you still have to wait a decent forty min. Not including the time it takes for your food to get to you.

When we visited Chicago from Kentucky, I just KNEW I had to eat at Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba!  It's located in a really cute neighborhood and the restaurant itself is a lot of fun.  We tried a variety of things:  cheeses, deviled eggs, olives, hams, roasted dates, crusty breads, SANGRIA, and other deliciousness.  My favorite was the coconut flan (OMG, can I PLEASE have this recipe?) and the sangria!  I took off one star because I think it's really expensive to make a full meal here, but I would come for a snack and drinks the next time we find ourselves in Chicago.
The food is good but the restaurant was to full to provide a good service. Nice ambience for a casual lunch.
Great drinks, great food. The paella is AMAZING (and if you can't eat both servings, take one home. DO NOT MISS OUT.)

Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba! is a fun and affordable spot to go with a group for dinner. This past Saturday my fiance and I grabbed dinner there with another couple and had a really enjoyable evening sharing small plates and drinking the Blood Orange Sangria that was on special.  While the food didn't wow me there's no doubt that there were some good dishes including the Burrata, Spinach & Manchego Stuffed Mushrooms, and Spicy Potatoes with Tomato Aioli.  Service was a bit spottier than I would've liked. We had a good twenty minute period where we were planning to order more that we spent waiting for the waitress.  While I know this review is no rave I cannot stress how affordable this spot is and what a great spot it is for a group dinner.

Love, love, love this place!!! I have been here twice, once with just the hubby We went with a large group for a gluttonous dinner and tried a huge variety of tapas. All of them were fantastic. While there, we also sampled 4 types of sangria. My favorite was the raspberry. Service was excellent and the price was more than reasonable.
I love the gluten free options offered.  The food is always perfectly presented and delicious, I forget what a great place this is, always consistent.

This place is definitely one of my favorites, I have not had a bad dish at this restaurant. The meats have always been juicy and tender and nothing has ever been dried out or over/under cooked.  I came here for my 3rd time over the weekend. We had a half pitcher of their blackberry raspberry sangria and their seasonal blood orange sangria. Both were a great combination of fruity and just a little tart. We had the flank steak, spicy potatoes, beef tenderloin & blue cheese, and my favorite the chicken paella. *Note - order the paella first because it takes awhile!* We also had some desserts which were perfect small plates (what else would it be?) so we got to try a few and they did not disappoint. Great atmosphere, quiet and romantic! As a side note - make sure you make reservations a little in advance. This place packs up FAST and I usually make mine about 2 weeks out for a Saturday night.
Wonderful place!! We love the Spanish wine :-) food selection is amazing, leaving us with full bellies.  Will for sure be coming back again!

I can't say enough about this place! My husband and I have been coming for years and it never disappoints. The service is excellent, the ambiance is fun and intimate, and the food is to die for! Three words. Pitchers. Of. Sangria.

My only complaint is how busy it gets and how loud it becomes. The food is delicious and the sangria (get the pithcer) is to die for!! Better off making a reservation and willing to spend a bit of money since you may end up ordering many tapas.
We just love this place. The food is excellent and reasonably priced. The sangria is also very good!

This is hands down one of my favorite restaurants in Chicago. I always bring out-of-towners here because I know they'll have a great experience and enjoy amazing food. I have never had a dish here that was bad. My favorites are the spicy potatoes and the bacon wrapped dates. My fiance's favorite is one of the steak dishes.. I believe it's served with gorgonzola? I don't even like beef that much but always enjoy a few bites of his! The sangria is always great, as well. And, if you have room for dessert, they're reasonably priced and always delicious. Service is always top-notch. I've never had any complaints about this restaurant (except maybe the long wait that is inevitable on the weekends!) Have had brunch here, as well, and it's very good. Love spending a couple of hours eating and socializing at Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba!

Dark interior and frequently crowded, and the tapas are a mix of classic Spanish and some americanized variety. The food is good but overpriced--skip the scallops but get the mushrooms. The location is nice though, there are lots of bars to hit up afterwards.
Awesome place. Its always fun to celebrate here they treat you like royalty !

My husband (and friends) frequent Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba! Love the food here!  Everything is amazing... haven't really had anything noteworthy horrible.  Recently it has been kind of difficult to get a reservation.  Which is good for the restaurant, but bad for the restaurant goer.   My husband and I have been sitting at the bar (first come first serve seating with full menu).  It's pretty legit to sit at the bar.  If you thought the food came out quick in the dining area - it is like lightning speed at the bar!  We will definitely be going back time and time again. The food never gets old!    I need to apologize to those of you that are reading this review.... I have a rule - when I review I must say what I ate and what I thought about the dish.  I think it is pretty pointless to write a review and not talk about the food at all.   My sincere apologizes... I haven't dined here in a while.  I will write a more detailed review next time I feast on their amazing tapas.   I can tell you this, our go-to dishes are: #30 - spicy potatoes with tomato aioli #32 - goat cheese baked in tomato sauce #43 - grilled octopus, fingerling potatoes, garlic chips, & pimenton vinaigrette #67 - roast dates with bacon & apple vinaigrette The one thing that I definitely will NOT order again is #3 - crispy morcilla sausage, house baguette with apple butter.

After visiting Spain my heart has been yearning for paella and tapas. Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba has stepped up to the plate! Their menu is fantastic! Super authentic!  The ambiance is laid-back yet festive. Their service is great as well. You get waited on the right amount of times, so you can have a conversation without constant interruptions.
bacon-wrapped dates. sangria.  I really don't  have to say more than that. Just go there. It's FIVE STARS good.
Best Tapas place in Chicago! Dim lights and beautiful table settings. The chairs are a little uncomfortable though. The food came out extremely fast for a table of 6!

Have I seriously never reviewed Babareeba?! This is probably one of my favorite go-to restaurants in the city. Good sangria, great bacon wrapped dates, beautiful space, and nice service. Perfect for date night or a girls' night. I have never had a bad experience here and I will continue to visit as much as possible!

Love Tapas! The place looks small from the outside, but its huge once you get in.  We came here for Restaurant week, but the R week menu was pretty lame so we just ordered off the regular menu. It was Sunday brunch, and there was a Bloody Mary bar which was pretty cool. The bacon wrapped dates were my fave, followed by the patatas bravas, that orange chipotle mayo is to die for. The jamon eggs benedict was surprisingly good. I would pass on the hanger steak it had a weird after taste. We finished the meal off with some French toast with jam and goat cheese, not too sweet and a great savory dessert. Overall great tapas, great brunch!

My husband and I came here for one of his work events, and we fell in love with this restaurant. I loved the dim lights, the huge space and most, importantly the amazing service. Everyone was so welcoming.  I highly recommend ordering the paella and the sangria. The paella is spectacular! It's one of the best I've ever had. The sangria is super fruity. Get the white sangria, and it will completely knock your socks off.  This is wonderful place for a date night. I can't wait to come back here again!

Love love love this restaurant!! EVERYTHING is SO DELICIOUS, service is very good, and the ambiance is really nice.  Some favorites: -sangria! -baked goat cheese in tomato sauce -spicy tomatoes with aoli -bacon wrapped dates -beef tenderloin with blue cheese -garlic shrimp -sea scallops -beef empanadas -chicken croquettes

We had a blast tonight! Our good friend visiting from Japan,  wanted to try something new and we decided to take her to one of our favorite restaurants, Cafe baba reeba! And she really enjoyed it! Moreover, there was no waiting this time for our seats and the service was excellent as always. This place is still one of my favorite places to have tapas. I definitely would eat here again and I definitely would recommend them to my friends and family.

Honestly, I am so sad to be giving this restaurant this low of a review. I chose Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba! because I know the food here is excellent. They have a tortilla española here that is so good, it reminds me of the ones I ate while living in Spain. I chose this restaurant for my birthday dinner exactly for this reason however, the service I received on this night was so poor - I'm not sure I'll be returning again. The hostess was wonderful and polite, but after being seated our server was another story. Our first interaction was a "hello, be right there" said in passing as he went to other tables. I wrote it off as him being busy, I understand how hectic restaurant week can get. But as time passed and tables left, it didn't get any better. Every time we were ordering, his eyes were darting around the room like we were wasting his time.  The only positive thing I can say about him is that he politely switched our drinks after we ordered the wrong one. I didn't come to the restaurant for a free dessert on my birthday, I came to reminisce on the Spanish food I love so much while enjoying a pleasant dinner, aided by a helpful server. I definitely wasn't "entertained" at all by this restaurant that is a part of the Lettuce Entertain you group. This service just turned me off so much - something you don't want to experience on a special day.  If you're looking for a dinner where the servers are there to actually help and serve...I would go somewhere else. If you want the delicious food - I'd just go to the bar. If you can find a seat.
Delicious tapas and friendly staff. It's definitely a fun, enjoyable place to be.  They have some great sangria also.
Went here for my bachelorette party dinner. Can't go wrong with tapas, and definitely a enjoyable experience on the whole!!!!

There are many great reasons on their menu, why they are jammed packed every weekend of the year. I love the atmosphere as well as the food and drinks. Its worth coming here for the hearty Spanish style bread alone. Crusty dense and soft inside transport me back to the Iberian peninsula. I could live on this bread. This place and Eatly are neck and neck for best bread in the city. Their imported wood burning oven from Spain in the hands of the cooks here is priceless. Therefore, don't just have the tapas, enjoy some of the perfectly cooked items out of the oven. You won't regret it (for example the tender fall off the bone lamb).  Hands down this place is very worth the splurge!

Went here for brunch and really enjoyed the experience! I love the tapas style. It's a great way to try a variety of things, especially when everything sounds so good and you can't decide what to order. The DIY Bloody Mary station is awesome too! The space is huge so this is a great spot for brunch to avoid having to wait forever to be seated.

The environment and the service are really good, severs are very polite and sweet. It is all small plate tapa, some such as beef and seafood are very yummy. I came especially for paella, the paella here is not as good as I expect, it taste a little undercook. But overall, it is a good restaurant.

This place is so much fun and the staff is really helpful on suggestions and super nice. The vibe is cool and the food is to die for. HOWEVER, it is super expensive and my one friend and I spent about a hundred dollars or so easily in one sitting. So only go if you're ready to lay down your wallet. I go rarely because of the prices but honestly from the way the food tastes I am not surprised by how much it costs. The food is honestly so good that I once had a dream about it.... seriously.
The passion fruit sangria was delicious, and literally every tapas I tried (16+ for a large group) was delicious, melt-in-your mouth good.

My bestie and I came here for a brunch outing. This turned out to be the perfect place. They didn't have any mimosas or Bellinis but they had a Bloody Mary bar and amazing sangria. I tried the blackberry sangria (or maybe it was black raspberry), it was refreshing and not too sweet and was made with real fruit, not syrup! We tried the vegetable eggs Benedict with patatas bravas, the berry buttermilk waffles, and the bacon Mac n cheese. Everything was outstanding. I'd highly recommend this place!

No need for a long review - we keep going back for great food and service.    Bartenders, Nico and Patrick, are fantastic. We had ordered Potato Salad, Short Stack, Berry Waffle, Croquetas and Chicken Piri - all excellent. Would highly recommend and looking forward to my next visit.

We stopped in today, a Sunday, for lunch to celebrate a family member's birthday. In addition to being busy as a weekend day, it's in the second week now of Restaurant Week, so I know that's a crazy, harried time for all the staff. Despite that! our server (Daniel) was fantastic. Knowledgeable, prompt, and very friendly. The food itself was delicious - I particularly recommend the Seared Salmon with cucumber crema and squash. It was melt-in-your-mouth good, and the crema plus roasted squash was an awesome combination. The serving sizes are bigger than we all expected, to boot! Daniel even took it upon himself to bring my brother, whose birthday it was, a dessert on the house with a little candle in it. Adorable. Basically: Awesome, delicious food for totally reasonable prices for the quality, plus charming, friendly staff who are invested in your having a great visit. Easy, accessible location right off Armitage and Halsted. Definitely going back here for more.
Was there Thursday PM; the Dodd is amazing(per usual). Thanks for the terrific service, Amber!!

Had lunch here today. Enjoyed breakfast paella (what a brilliant idea) as well as some tapas. Everything was great - wish I had sampled some of their sangria as well. Good prices for excellent Spanish food in a comfortable and cool environment. Will be visiting again!

Went and had the paella, 3 tapas and one the sangrias. The paella was great and with the other tapas we had plenty of leftovers for the next day.  And the leftovers were still just as good the next day.  The half pitcher of sangria was perfect for two people.
I have been to this restaurant a few times. they have great tapas and dishes to share. The only down side about this restaurant is it is very over crowded and the service can be slow.
good food! nice staff. the beef empanada was my favorite tapa. definitely recommend if you want to try different sorts of tastes.

Won't bother with the paragraphs because those are too hard to sort through when finding your next favorite restaurant. Here's why cafe ba ba reeba is my new go-to: Service: kind, quick, accommodating Drinks: delicious sangria with seasonal favorites.  I stuck to sangria but looked around me and saw sizeable cocktails! Spectacular food: everything we had was great! Some favorites include Patatas Bravas (you could eat the potatoes plain! They were wonderfully seasoned and the tomato aioli doesn't hurt one bit) Goat cheese baked in tomato sauce (I've never seen such a healthy serving of goat cheese at a restaurant so well priced! Delicious) Shrimp with garlic (great garlic oil which you'll want to dip every thing you can find in) Plato de la case charcuterie plate (comes with pon con tomate it's amazing) For dessert I had the chocolate truffle cake, it was tiny but incredible. It's worth 3 bucks without a doubt! It's so rich and delicious that you can make it last :)

Bartender was pretty cool. Octopus was delicious. Sangria pitchers are a pretty good value. Good vibe. Good people. Long wait on a Saturday night though for a table. Almost 2 hours... comparable to many other spots in the area.

We take friends and family here every time they are in town. Very easy to get a table, and seating at the bar is usually available. Chorizo Wrapped Dates!!! The sangria is on point, just get the big pitcher, you know you will finish it. Very comfortable and fun atmosphere, not too loud, casual and fun dining experience.

Came here on a Saturday for brunch for restaurant week, but we decided to order off the regular menu instead. I mean it's a tapas place so options are a must!  We ordered 6 items between two people, which was just a tad too much food for us. I enjoy leftovers though, so I was perfectly fine with bringing home an assortment of goodies that I could snack on later.  1. Sausage fried paella rice with poached egg (off the brunch menu, everything else we ordered was from the dinner menu): This was good but not really a paella. I mean it was honestly a glorified fried rice at best. Don't get me wrong, it was freaking delicious and there was nothing left over from this, but when I order paella, I look for that metal skillet and a crust of rice. This definitely did not have that. 2. Spicy tomatoes with tomato aioli: This was my boyfriends favorite dish. The tomatoes were bomb. Aioli was more bomb. Just bombs all around.  3. Spinach and manchego stuffed mushrooms: Good but pretty average. You get 4 decently sized mushroom. I don't even really like mushrooms so in hindsight, not too sure why I ordered that.  4. Seared sea scallops with leaks, torched oranges, and jamon serrano: Soooo yummy! This was the most expensive thing we ordered, but it was worth it! You get 4 scallops but they were perfectly balanced with that buttery scallop texture cut with the citrus from the oranges. [insert 2 thumbs up emojis] 5. Rioja braised short rib: Okay this was probably one of my favorite things. The meat was sooooo tender and just ugh tres magnifique! The sauce was good, the mashed potatoes were very buttery (maybe a little too buttery?) but meat and potatoes is just such a classic dish. It's hard to go wrong with something like that. 6. Grilled skewer of marinated pork belly and pork loin: I remember this being good, but I guess it wasn't as memorable as the other ones.. Overall, enjoyed a fantastic lunch! Excited to try other dishes next time :)
I've been back a couple times with fine service. The food is always great... That's what really matters.
One of my favorite tapas places! I love their Sangria and food! I have been for brunch and dinner and loved both. I also went when they had a flamingo show which was great!

I have heard a lot about Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba! for a while.  My boyfriend used to live right by there and said it was his favorite place.  We finally went a few weeks ago and I'm so glad we did.  I'm not a huge tapas fan, but decided to try it anyways.  My boyfriend demanded we get the Potatas Bravas since those are his favorite (and that he got his own order).  let me tell you, if you're going to make a good decision, it's going to be getting these.  They're spicy with a tomato aioli sauce to dip.  I could've eaten only those and been happy.   We ordered a lot of stuff, but nothing really stood out to me like the Potatoes & Eggs Benedict (Beef Tenderloin)...honestly this was amazingly good.  We also ordered the Buttermilk-Fried Chicken Thighs.  This one is deceiving, mostly because it is little boneless chicken tenders with a buffalo sauce on them.  Also, pretty darn good.  Now, if they just said "Buffalo Buttermilk Fired Chicken Thighs" instead of being super fancy, then I think a lot more people would be intrigued to try this.   Overall the two times I've been here have been fabulous.  No matter how busy the waiters and waitresses were, they were always around if needed.  Just go.....and get the potatas bravas
Went there before a night out on the town when visiting Chicago.  Sangria, lots of good portioned tapas, and delicious paella.  Wonderful experience.  Went with a group of 9.

Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba (CBR) is one of our go to restaurants when we want to eat Tapas. We were celebrating my son's birthday last Saturday and made reservations online thru Open Table. This restaurant gets SUPER busy, even at 5:30 pm, so be sure you make reservations. Parking is permit only in the neighborhood and there is no garage. CBR does have a valet service for $13. Totally worth it, Lincoln Park is super busy on the weekend and it's very hard to find street parking. We began our evening with cocktails; they offer many flavors of Sangria. I usually order 1/2 a pitcher of red wine Sangrias. You get about 3 full glasses from 1/2 a pitcher. It's more economical than individual glasses. CBR also offers full pitchers. My sons ordered a margarita and a mojito. We discovered that many places offer a mojito but there is an art to actually making a good mojito, CBR fell short on this mojito. Not mixed correctly. Margarita was fine. Tapas is a great way to try several dishes with your companions. Tapas are appetizer sized portions of Spanish dishes and arrive at your table in no special order. We usually start off with 2 per person, keep a menu handy and order more as the night progresses. We've been to CBR a few times and have tried pretty much everything on the menu and have been happy with taste, quality and quantity. If you order the paella, allow some extra time for it's preparation.  Our waiter, busboy and servers were very efficient, even thought the restaurant was packed! They never forgot about us and were quick to refill our water glasses, clear dishes and bring new dishes to our table. When making the reservation on Open Table I did note that we would be celebrating my son's 22nd Birthday but, no complimentary dessert was offered to him :(. Note: The noise level does get loud due to the high ceilings, kinda hard to hear your diner companions sometimes.

Great experience. I was celebrating my birthday & had a great time.  We made a reservation at 11am for Sunday Brunch. Once we arrived we were right away seated in a packed restaurant. The ambience was perfect!  It was our first time going to Cafe Baba-Re-Ba. The waiter explained the menu and our food came out really fast.  We ordered: -Waffle-battered chicken sticks - (do not recommend. It was like a corn dog) -Mac N' Cheese - (AMAZING) -Buttermilk Waffle with marcona almond nutella and bananas - (Pretty dry & not sure if that was nutella) -Spicy Potatoes with Tomato Alioli - (AMAZING) -Goat Cheese Baked in Tomato Sauce - (AMAZING) -Shrimp With garlic, olive oil, red pepper flakes - (Really good) -Beef Skewer Horseradish Cream & Red Onions - (Really good) -Chicken Skewer - (The chicken was kind of dry) Asides from the waffle battered chicken sticks & waffles, I definitely want to come back for the spicy potatoes & goat cheese.

It's restaurant week and I've been going to different places in Chicago. Most of the places are high end restaurants but nevertheless not so impressive. But I felt that I have to write a review for Cafe BabaReeba. We went for brunch and had to make a last-minute time change and they gladly did it for us over the phone, even though on Open Table it was completely booked. We were seated right away.
