Ambience was OK , cool decor, and service was great. Several servers came by to ask how everything was, and the  waiter patiently explained the menu to us. Food came fairly quickly, and the tapa-style brunch was really a fun experience. The portions were OK. The citrus French toast was really good but expensive ($2 for one small piece of French toast) . Towards the end, one of the tapas came a little late, and they gave it to us for free! Overall the brunch cost us $26 with 2 leftover tapa dishes. I would definitely come back.

Solid tapas (though many other fantastic tapas options in the city), and always a good time dining here, but getting a table during prime time can be tricky. With advanced planning and reservations, this can be a good place for larger gatherings.
This was a great place for tapas. Fun dining experience and one of the best desserts I've ever had. Very busy place as well!

This is one of my go-to's in Chicago. I've come here multiple times with a group of girlfriends, and Baba never seems to disappoint. Their tapas are delicious and the ambiance is light and fun. I always start with a pitcher of the sangria(all of the flavors are good!) and a mini pinxtos plate. I love that you can get a mini sample of many things at once!

I came here for brunch on Sunday (and maybe that was my mistake), but I didn't think the food was that spectacular.  The service was okay, but they were kind of slow and not very friendly or engaging.  We had the sausage-fried paella rice with poached egg, iberico ham hash, beef tenderloin eggs benedict, and grilled octopus.  Nothing special to write home about.

This is by far my favorite tapas place in the city. I've been going for 3 or so years now and it really can't be topped. Everything is amazing and the service is always top notch. I always make a reservation on open table or over the phone. They do often have a decent wait time for tables if you walk in, but this is easily avoided with a bit of planning.  I really recommend the bacon wrapped dates, goat cheese in tomato sauce, and the blue cheese beef tenderloin.  This evening there was a snafu with our reservation (this has NEVER happened in three years) and we had to wait just a bit. They were very honest and helpful with updates and in the end comped our entire meal. That was completely unexpected on our end and we now love this place even more. We're already booked for Sunday brunch :D

I have to say, we waited over 45 mins for our reservation tonight and I was very frustrated. By the end of the night, not only the food was amazing (as usual) and our server max was one of the best I've had. He was so kind and recommended the BEST food. I would come back for him alone- also the manager was very apologetic for the wait and was so kind. Would highly recommend for the food and customer service - worth the wait :)

this place is always consistently good.  my favorite time to go is for brunch, and i've even recreated some of their brunch dishes at home because i enjoy them so much.  it's great to sit out on the patio in nice weather, too.  the sangria is always amazing.

I had an early-ish dinner here with my fiance last Thursday, and we had a great meal. We were able to be seated right away arriving around 5:30. We chose the chorizo-wrapped date and the laughing bird shrimp for a bite-sized pinxto ($2/ea.) Hubs enjoyed his date; my shrimp was good, but I wasn't prepared for the actual strip of chewy white fat adorning the top of the skewer, which I removed and didn't eat. When they said "topped with fat" I guess I assumed it was drizzled with a little grease or something; I personally don't eat solid pieces of fat like that.  We shared the goat cheese baked in tomato sauce, which was really delicious ($8), and had a plate of soy-orange duck wings which were the special that evening and should go on the permanent menu, they were so tender and tasty. We attempted to order 1/2 a pitcher of the blood orange sangria (also a special for the evening) but apparently the server heard "HAVE a pitcher of sangria," and brought us a full one, which we didn't figure out til we looked at the bill. I thought it was a little generous for a half, but didn't ask! Oh well. Guess someone's gonna have to drink all that extra sangria. Shucks!  We also ordered 2 portions (the minimum order) of the seafood paella with shrimp, scallops, and monkfish. I could only find a single piece of monkfish in the entire pan, but there were a more reasonable number of shrimp and scallops. The paella takes about 30 minutes to cook to order, so they ask you to be prepared that it will take a little longer than the tapas orders. Though we were stuffed by this point, my Yelp check-in earned us a free dessert tapa, so we chose the caramelized banana with vanilla ice cream and pistachios, the perfect sweet but not too heavy ending to our delicious meal. We ended up spending about $85 for the meal, which earned us 1 point per $1 for the Lettuce Entertain You group's frequent diner reward program - there are so many affiliated restaurants, it's a great program to enroll in! We would definitely eat at Ba-Ba-Reeba again for the delicious food!
Excellent food! The waiter was attentive and food cane out fast. Some choices were smaller portions than anticipated for the price but everything was excellent.  Highly recommend the veggie paella.
THE FOOD PORTIONS ARE TOO SMALL!!! I hate when I get dragged here when I visit Chicago. So hungry....

I see why this restaurant has such a long and rich history in Chicago, because it is truly outstanding. My friend and I came for brunch recently, and really loved our experience here. Making reservations was easy since they are on Open Table, and I was able to snag us a table the day before our Saturday brunch. During brunch you have the options of choosing between the brunch items, or the dinner items on the other side of the menu. The fact that there are so many options is dangerous, because everything sounds delicious. I decided to focus on items from the brunch menu, because I know I'll come another time to try the dinner items.  Our waitress was very attentive and answered our questions about the menu well. My friend and I both didn't order any cocktails, since we both were more in need of caffeine, but I hear their sangria is amazing.  To eat I ordered the citrus french toast  stick, deviled egg, and baked eggs.  Citrus french toast stick: It had a light citrus taste, and the flavor was not overpowering . The outer texture was crispy, and the inner part was soft. I almost wish I had ordered two instead of one, because it was my second favorite item from my visit.  Deviled egg: It was good and had a little bit of a kick to it. Baked Eggs: I am head over hills and in love with their baked eggs. The eggs are covered in cheese,  a tangy sauce and are  perfectly baked.  The tomato bread is seriously some of the best bread I've ever had, and it paired perfectly with the baked eggs. If you enjoy eggs, tomatoes, and cheese, then this dish is for you.  The price point is excellent for the quality of the food here. My whole bill before tip was a little over $12, which wasn't bad at all.
AMAZING food. Will come back with a bigger appetite so we can enjoy dessert as well. Every tapas we ordered was extremely succulent and very filling. I highly recommend this restaurant!

I'm not sure what a Ba-Ba-Reeba is, but Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba! offers some of the better tapas options that I've had in the Chicagoland area. The highlights were the potatoes with tomato aioli, seafood paella, and the short ribs. Book early! We called in to put our names on the list an hour in advance and still had to wait 45 minutes to get seated. The dimly lit and smokey atmosphere probably would offer an intimate experience if I hadn't come to the restaurant with my goofy friends. A couple huge slabs of meat hung from the ceiling near the bar area, making things feel somehow more authentic.  Once we put in our orders, the food came out surprisingly fast and well timed. We got our peach sangria first and though it didn't taste too boozy, it offered a solid sugary supplement to the free bread. The short ribs came out right away and WOW was it tender. It came out in one slab of meat and melted to the cut of my BUTTER KNIFE. That's when you know... The dish was pretty amazing and probably my favorite of the night. The potatoes with tomato aioli came out after, followed by the chorizo wrapped dates and the duck special. Everything was well seasoned and delicious. The paella came out last, and although it would have gone well with the other dishes, it was a solid finisher to fill us up. We were stuffed but because we checked in on yelp, we all got free dessert! That was an awesome deal - go Yelp. We shared the butterscotch custard, flan, pumpkin empanadas, and the glazed bananas. The pumpkin empanadas were kind of whack because they were salty, but everything else was tasty. I left in a food coma, which is why I had to wait until today to leave my review. I'd come back.

This is one of my most favorite place to eat in Chicago but the reservation people maybe should learn something called courtesy in the restaurant business. I called tonight to make a reservation and it was fully booked only had 10pm available I told her politely that I'd take it and if there is any cancellation if they could let me know, but she said in a not so friendly voice that they are probably more busier than me ??? ... I understand it's a busy place but high class customer service is expected by patrons no more no less . #PhoneEtiquette
We were fortunate enough to have 2 meet and greets at Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba!  The room set up was great, the food was spectacular and the staff was so attentive to our needs. Will definitely go back!

Excellent!! Our service was friendly and efficient. The food was so good and moderately priced. We tried the spicy potatoes (awesome), the fried green peppers (weird, but tasty), the Brussels sprout salad (best salad I've ever had), and the tomato bread(my personal favorite!). We will return again!!

Went here with a few girl friends right before Christmas time for brunch. The tapas here are really yummy and the sangria options are spectacular as well.  It's good to get a mix of savory and sweet tapas for the brunch and while the portions are not too big, it's exciting to be able to try the different options.  Their paella was good but I preferred the smaller tapas plates.
Love Babareeba! Especially good for big groups or celebratory events. The Sangria pitcher was delicious and really affordable.

Went here on a visit to Chicago - a great spot to check out, close to transit.  The food was of course, amazing. The patatas bravas were a favorite, as were some of the by piece tapas.  Also, both red and seasonal sangrias were fantastic. We had a group of four, and thought they were very busy, service was on point and friendly.

Amazing food! Went here for a friends birthday and can't wait to return. I did not experience any items I didn't like. Food was delicious and sangria was amazing as well. We had friendly service as well which was nice! I would definitely return!

My fiancé and I have been here multiple times.  First time we visited this great restaurant was 6 years ago.  The experience was so great we have a tendency to go back at least once per year.  The food and service are as good as they always have been.  Need to try their spicy potatoes and ham puffs.

It is amazing how a brief phone call with the" Manager on Duty" at Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba changed 7 years of wonderful meals and experiences at Cafe BA-BA-REEBA to such strong dislike that I will never again go to this restaurant.  I called on Jan 11 to cancel a reservation for January 27 (made on Jan 1) and was told my credit card was already charged and there were no cancellations permitted, End of story- no cancellations! How can a restaurant charge me 16 days before I eat the meal? I was never told there were no cancellations permitted and i called to cancel more than 2 weeks before the date of the reservation,

Unfortunately, in Chicago there is not a great selection of Spanish food. In my opinion, I feel that Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba offers the best paella and patatas bravas available in town!  The rest of the tapas are ok. I went there several times and I think I have tried a large varieties of their tapas. I feel they are ok, but I would not go crazy for any of them. I like the cuban sandwich a lot!! It is really good. The environment is really nice, large, spacious, you can see the big jamon cerrano hanged as in Spain!  The sangria is pretty tasty too!
Absolutely love this restaurant, one of my favorite places to eat in Chicago. There's something on the menu for everyone, and I've yet to try something that isn't delicious.

I ate at Café Ba-Ba-Reeba for brunch this past weekend. I really liked the idea of breakfast tapas! It was nice because I could order a couple of the "Pintxos" or bite-sized tapas and they're enough for one if you order a couple. I ordered the yogurt Pintxos and the citrus French toast and that was too much food! The vanilla yogurt and granola was SO good, I cannot describe it with justice. Who knew that simple yogurt could be so delicious! It was a thicker Greek yogurt, with just the right amount of sweet. I got the entrée size of the French toast and I regret it. It was good but I didn't need that much of it. I did like the goat cheese "butter" that came with the entrée though, and doesn't come with the Pintxos. In general though, I didn't think it was that great and I don't think I'll even be ordering a Pinxtos version of it in the future. In hindsight I wish I had ordered 3 Pintxos. I would also count the egg Benedict as essentially a Pintxos, maybe 2 bites instead of one though! My friend ordered it and it looked amazing, I will definitely be ordering that when I return! It's also definitely on my list to come back for dinner.

I love this place!!! It's very very popular, so if you want a table, you need a reservation (otherwise bar seating works out eventually!). The grilled squid and the bacon-wrapped dates are my absolute favorites. The portions are pretty good for the price. I love bringing friends and dates here, this place is good either way. Highly recommend.

If you come here and don't get the bacon wrapped dates, you're doing it wrong.  Seriously, this place tops my list of Chicago tapas spots--it's THAT good. I've been here on several occasions, in different sized groups, and have never been disappointed.  The service is amazing, and each time the server has made helpful recommendations on dishes to try, amount of food that will be enough, etc.  My favorite dishes include the beef tips, garlic potato salad, paella, and of course, the bacon wrapped dates.  The desserts are adorable little nibbles, just enough to satisfy the sweet tooth after a savory meal.   The ambiance is boisterous and fun, very lively and entertaining.  The people watching is fantastic, and you won't be disappointed in the fast-paced, exciting operation that Ba-Ba-Reeba boasts.   This is the perfect date night place, but obviously, since it's tapas, it's amazing for group outings and parties.

I wasn't expecting much of this place, but Café Ba-Ba Reeba knocked me off my feet! Out of all the restaurants we ate at during our 4 days in Chicago, this restaurant came out in 2nd place! Our party of 4 arrived 5 minutes after the restaurant opened. We were seated towards on the left which looked almost like a covered patio. Beautiful brick walls with red chairs to accent. Our server was great in assisting us. After a few recommendations and selecting what we thought sounded good... Full sized breakfast paella, patatas bravas, eggs benedict, nutella banana waffles, hash, flan, and a slice of chocolate cake (free dessert with Yelp check-in). You really can't go wrong ordering anything off the menu!  Great service, excellent food, nice atmosphere.

My boyfriend and I wanted to stay in Lincoln Park for dinner it had been over a year since I went to Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba so we decided to go back. I like tapas and it was pretty good the first time (but try sharing tapas with someone that hates all vegetables... ugh limited choices) Anyway, our waiter was incredibly friendly and knowledgeable. We let him know about all my allergies right away (gluten, nuts, shellfish ... yes my life sucks) and he immediately offered me gluten free bread, gave me the gluten free menu, and let the kitchen know about all of my allergies. It is SO nice when restaurants are this accommodating to allergies.   We started with a pitcher of red sangria, which was delicious and a really good deal. You get nearly 4 glasses each out of that and for a good price. Normally gluten free bread is not the greatest and it really makes me miss regular bread, this was actually pretty good! Especially with the olive oil they provide on the table.  For tapas, we ordered: 1) serrano ham, salchichon, chorizo & manchego platter - really good, the ham is definitely the best and it even tasted good with my gluten free bread  2) spicy potatoes with tomato alioli - way too good... probably could have eaten the whole thing myself  3) seared salmon, dill crema, roasted squash & caramelized lemon - delicious  We also got the chicken paella, which was amazing. That's saying a lot since the last time I had paella was in Spain, so they really did a good job. Obviously we had leftovers because it was huge, so we got to enjoy it the next night too. I really like the ambiance of the restaurant because you can dress up in a long dress or wear jeans and either way you fit in. I will definitely come back to this restaurant! (especially in the summer when the front windows are open)

I have fun every time I eat at Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba!  You can try so many new things--different cheeses, differently prepared meats, and the bacon dates are outstanding.  The white sangria is refreshing...all the sangrias are good.  I like to take our of town guests here (and we can avoid the usual tourist spots).  They even offer gluten-free options on their menu!

Stopped by here on the way to the Zoolights! We made a reservation, having heard great things but were sad the "latest" time they had for dinner was 3:30pm! We picked this, assuming they were busy and considered it an early dinner. We arrived however and noticed a few empty tables, even past 4:30pm-5pm. Do they not reserve the whole restaurant? Made us feel a little cheated by the system. (Although I guess we could have called in to check.) While the food was excellent and with great taste, we were a little disappointed by the experience. We were seated at a table right next to the bathrooms and I constantly found myself drawing my chair back and forth to let people pass. The small plate (tapas) experience is indeed unique. Perhaps I'm just too used to the conventional style of dining (starter, main, dessert), but for me, I wasn't a fan of getting each small plate spaced out 5-10 minutes apart. Two tapas plates would show up, followed by a Pintxo ("starter") plate, then a 10-minute wait before another plate. Just seems oddly spaced out. Due to the portion sizes, I just found myself wanting all the plates at once. However, reasonably priced and great flavour in the dishes we tried. We did get a free dessert since we checked in through yelp which was a big bonus!! Would give it another shot, but perhaps with a bigger party. They seemed to have a few of those on our visit.

I came to tapas because me and couple friends where just sitting at home and kind of getting hungry but didn't want that much food so we suggested to head out to tapas because of the small portion of food, I really loved the stuffed mushrooms and the tomato and garlic bread brusetta, definitely a top choice to go and it's not that really expensive

BabaReeba was excellent. This was our first time here so we didn't know reservations were a must. We were told there would be a 2hr wait, ugh. But we were able to snag seats at 1 of the 2 bars in a matter of minutes and just ate and drank there. Our bartender was very attentive and courteous. The food was all great as well. We had bacon wrapped dates, grilled squid, shrimp. The sangria was awesome as well. I highly recommend BabaReeba, just be sure to make reservations.

Excellent tapas and paella. We had a group of seven on New Year's Day, several of whom have been to Spain. We were all very impressed. Great food. Great service. We sampled probably half the tapas, all the pintxos, and the seafood paella. Everything was delicious! Octopus, lamb, meatballs, wrapped dates were notable. The paella was perfect. Dessert tapas were great fun, a little sweet bite for everyone. Blood orange sangria and terrific sourdough bread rounded out our meal. Go hungry and explore.

This place is so delicious. We tried.. Bacon wrapped dates ( best I've had) Burratta cheese - pretty good Chorizo wrapped date- get like 5 of these... Spicy potatoes - reallll good Stuffed mushrooms - I'm not a huge mushroom fan, but they were pretty tasty  Beef empanadas - good, not great Pork paella - YUM YUM YUM Oh, and make sure you check in on Yelp for your free dessert. I got the banana and it was delightful.  One tip on the sangria, it tastes like fruit juice. I'm pretty sure there was no alcohol in there, and for that price, I should at least feel a little buzz. Next time, I'll stick to regular wine.
Popped in here for a great dinner the other night, I heard that it has been here forever.  Delicious food, and sangria's with solid service.

The tapas here are delicious. I checked in and got a free appetizer, gotta love free. I would definitely come here for someone's birthday dinner, but for a date--not so much! It's much better to have a big group so everyone orders 2 dishes or so to share. Want to come again!

Great experience with 2 other couples. Start with a pitcher of sangria and 2 appetizers. Move in to several other things to share. So filling. DO NOT RUSH.  Order more as you go; more fun that way. They do try to push you for more but I would take a few suggestions on what is popular. Dress very well but cool, if ya know what I mean.

One of my favorite Chicago restaurants! It can be tricky to get a table here because of how great it is but if you are reading this and are in Chicago, head on over.  This is a great place to go with a group where you can split multiple tapas. To start, I recommend a pitcher of sangria (about 6 glasses!)  Food recommendations:  Chorizo wrapped dates- This is just a serving for 1 person which is why it is only $2 Brussel sprout salad- Nice flavors and refreshing paired with the heavier entered and tapas Spicy potatoes- Good portion size for sharing Goat cheese baked in tomato sauce- #1 seller! So good and they give a crispy bread to dip  Chicken and ham croquettes  The empanadas are so good. The meat inside tastes like it comes from a slow cooker. Yummy  The paellas are good but big so require a bigger group of people!  The banana dessert is also great! Make sure to make a reservation as this place is always busy!

I've been here so many times , This place has the best Paella I've ever tried in Chicago, I also like the batata brava its so yummy   Their food is so delicious and clean . The price is ok  The patios looks nice
Really one of the first tapas places in Chicago.  great neighborhood.  The food here is always solid.  It's never totally over the top awesome, and it never is bad.  Sangria pretty good too.
We went with a large group and it was a neat setting because it's a fairly large place with lots of small plates to choose from for every taste. Pitchers of sangria also never hurt ;)

I love Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba! The food is great (brunch AND dinner); the service is fantastic; the ambiance is neat, and the sangria is perfect. Not a lot more you can ask for in a restaurant! It's a blast to go here with a group of friends, because you can try a lot of food and share pitchers of the different kinds of perfect sangria. Menu highlights: - bacon wrapped dates - Goat cheese and tomato sauce - Spicy potatoes with aloili - Grilled octopus - Scallops  - Sea food paella (One of my low moments from 2015 was leaving my leftover container of this on the table.)

What can I say about this place? The food, ambiance, and service is amazing. The moment you walk in you can smell the amazing spices and food. We made reservations the day of for 10pm, but we were able to be seated at 9:30. We got a half pitcher of sangria (delicious), 4 tapas, and 3 desserts for $75. I highly recommend the garlic shrimp and the fried chicken. The desserts are fantastic as well. This place is great for date night or enjoying with friends-so you can try everything on the menu. Definitely worth it for the price and the quality of food!

Such a fan. Went with a group of my coworkers and everyone got to try a little bit of everything. You can't leave here without trying at least one sangria, because I swear they are so good that you'll want to go back just for the sangrias.

Fun lively environment, the interior of the restaurant is much nicer and bigger than the exterior would make you think.  Staff was friendly, they had a small gluten free menu and bread which was nice, although gluten free bread was nothing special. Pork shoulder was not too impressive for $14 for 4 small slices.  However the beef tenderloin and seared scallops were really good, worth ordering again.  Brussels sprout salad and roasted veggies were also nice and refreshing. Next time I'll want to try the jamon plate. Overall great, I'll be back!

This was my first visit to Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba and I will definitely be going back. I went for a date night and this was the perfect spot for that. We made reservations and were seated right away. I enjoyed the atmosphere - very cozy and well decorated. We ordered sangria, the marinara with goat cheese, and seafood paella. Everything was delicious, and we received generous portions. I highly recommend this for a special dinner out!

I've been coming to Babareeba for a loooong time, and I really truly love it. Some of the favorites include: -bacon wrapped dates -goat cheese and tomato sauce -meatballs -cheese plate -beef and blue cheese -red sangria or the sangria of the day! They also have small plate desserts so you can order a few (or all of them) and (maybe even) share.  Bonus tip: check in on Yelp and get a free dessert!

I planned my office's holiday party and made a reservation at Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba for 12 people.  I worked with Alison and she was great!  I made small changes in the weeks before the event, and even a few right up until the day before and she was very accommodating and easy to work with.  When we got to the restaurant, we were seated even though the whole group had not shown up yet.  The server, Carl, was on top of his game!  Because of the planning Alison and I had done beforehand, he knew we had a few people in the group that needed Gluten Free options, and he was very good about making sure they knew which items were GF-friendly.  I had previously set the menu with Alison, and the tapas were brought out with perfect timing so that we always had something to much on.  I can't stress enough that this is a great place for a work event.  The food and atmosphere are great!  Thank you so much, Alison & Carl!
food is not bad at all, flan was too plain, paella too heavy.

I've been here a few times as it is my favorite Tapas spot in Chicago, and I have yet to be disappointed in any way. It is no wonder that Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba! is so popular.  Having spent a considerable amount of time in Spain, and having eaten a considerable amount of food in Spain, I can say with conviction that the food is authentic. If you are familiar with the cuisine, you will realize that nothing on the menu surprises you in terms of creativity, and that is OK, considering:  The tapas are quick to come out in an order that makes sense to the palate. They are always soooo tasty. The Sangria is phenomenal. And the best part of all of this is that everything is reasonably priced.  The space is deceptively massive, and it is rare that you will be waiting in line for a large amount of time, even if you don't have a reservation.  I'll come back whenever I am feeling in the mood for tapas and Sangria!

Used to be the top place in town for Tapa's, recently it's just carbo-load central with a lot of salt and cheap sangria.  Will do in a pinch, but now that the "shared plates" scene is in full swing, there are much better options around town.  Nothing too daring on the menu, pretty run of the mill choices.

Great for groups and larger gatherings. I love Tapas style eating with a big group and the dishes here never disappoint. Food is good, good location, good ambiance and not too loud - the space is pretty large. The menu is expansive and people can generally find something that makes everyone happy. Good group drinking options as well (the sangria was good!).
Great place! You would need to have a reservation for this place. I went here to meet with some friends and we enjoyed the brunch menu while enjoying a pitcher of sangria.
Great Spanish tapas, love the croquettes and traditional Spanish paella. This Spanish restaurant never fails to impress.

This restaurant is one of our favorite spots in town. You can can come for a casual bite, spend a small amount and walk away satisfied OR you could come for an extravagant meal, spend a bit more and walk away brimming, fat and happy! We can for an extra special night and took the extravagant route! ;)  We started with the half pitcher of the classic sangria for $17. It was the perfect amount for us...and so delicious! If you are a sangria fan, you have to try it here!  We ordered six tapas and loved each and everyone. From the veggies and appetizer section we had the Brussel sprout salad and the spicy potatoes. I preferred the Brussel sprout salad because it was so finely chopped, lightly drizzled with oil and enhanced with sweet almonds. My partner preferred the spicy potatoes with the spicy tomato aioli. It was a perfect split for the two of us, but we enjoyed both! From the beef section we ordered the short rib and we ordered the fried calamari from the seafood section. The short rib was decadent, flavorful and heavenly tender. I could have eaten five of them, they were so good. The fried calamari were also good, but the mixture of the red Fresca salsa and cream sauce was the highlight of the dish! From the pork menu we ordered the assortment of cured pork meats and olives as well as the dates wrapped in bacon. The cured meats were a great starter and way to try some of the restaurants house cured meats. The dates, however, were my favorite dish. Paired with a sweet vinaigrette and apples, it was simply to die for! We ended the evening with the $3 dessert a.) because they are only $3 and b.) because Yelp checkin provides a free dessert tapa! Perfect! We both got the chocolate truffle which was amazing! However, it was sooo sweet that I had to give half of it to my partner. But he loved it! We walked away with all of that food for a decent price. The servers were great, the ambience was warm/inviting and the service was quick. All this to say, we can't wait for the next excuse to return!
On-point tapas place. Go here for dinner, then kingston mines for drinks and live music. Didn't get 5 stars because they don't have goat cheese baked in tomato sauce.

The place exceeded my expectations. The place was packed but me and my friends (we are visiting from NJ/NY) were able to sit at the back bar right away and food came in fast. The service was outstanding and the food itself were delicious.

Amazing.  Had a group of 8 and ate at the back bar.  Service was super friendly and fast, bartender took good care of the group.  Food was perfect, had a smattering of tapas.  Good time, fun atmosphere, loved it!

One of my all-time-favorite girls-night-out spots, date-night-spots, group-spots, you name it. Never had a single bad experience.  Recommendations: Bacon wrapped dates (mouth is watering), queso de cabra, and shredded brussel sprout salad. Keep it up Cafe Ba-Ba!
Perfect spot to catch up with friends or colleagues.  I did not find a tapa that I did not like.  Great, energetic atmosphere as well.

Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba is a tapas restaurant in LP. I came here once for Sunday brunch, and continue to come back. Its a place where food is meant to be shared and they accommodate large parties exceptionally well. I celebrated a birthday here last week, and CBBR accommodated our party of 8 and didn't hesitate to split the check 8 ways. My only complaint is that if you order pitchers of sangria, they don't replenish water. My friend and I had to ask for a water refill.  I like how they space out the tapas, and their initial recommendation to order 1-2 tapas per person. This provided enough food for everyone to share.  At my most recent dinner experience, we ordered the following: chorizo-wrapped medjool dates and cheese-a popular tapa that reminded me of Avec's prosciutto-wrapped dates.  spicy potatoes with tomato aioli-one of my favorite tapas here and at Mercat a la Planxa. I prefer M a la P's patatas bravas over the spicy potatoes at CBBR, but for the price point, CBBR hits the spot.  grilled octopus-this was one of my favorites tapas at CBBR and I would order this again. Don't be afraid to try octopus. It's not fishy tasting at all! scallop empanada-flaky crust, generous scallop filling.  buttermilk-fried chicken thighs-Mmm. Not what you'd expect if you're a Nando's fan. This is a marriage of fried chicken doused in peri peri sauce.  grilled hanger steak-sliced for sharing, moist and succulent meat.  seafood paella with squid and squid ink-Our entire party's favorite dish, this is a special that should be made into a regular offering. Instead of rice, this dish contained vermicelli noodles, with a generous seafood portion. Highly recommend ordering this before its no longer offered!

I stopped in to grab a quick bloody and was blown away by the sports bar vibe this tapas spot had! The bartender, Ryan, and was beyond awesome and instantly makes you feel like a regular. The menu was amazing. The people at the bar next to us came from Michigan just to eat here again. I'm definitely coming back hungry and thirsty for a bears game SOON!!

My favorite restaurant in Chitown! Make a reservation ahead of time and pay attention to the featured items on their menu (in red); those items and everything are awesome! Order the peach sangria and enjoy!

We waited 20 minutes even tho we made a reservation. They were running behind so that part was a little annoying but overall great restaurant. Good atmosphere. Got two pitchers of sangria both were great. Would recommend the bacon wrapped dates! The bar is open seating but if you want a table be sure to make a reservation.

First off, this place is crazy packed! But for good reason. Make reservations way ahead of time or good luck. The wait for two on a Saturday night was 2.5hr! But you can get full service at the first come, first serve bar areas or high tops which is what my girl and I did. The service is quick and efficient! Since this is a tapas place, I suggest ordering 1-2 things at a time and when those come, order your next selection. That way just as you're finishing your first order, your next order is coming right out! The food is wonderful and very flavorful. I highly suggest EVERYTHING! Seriously, there are so many good choices, it's hard to go wrong here. We ended up ordering like 6-8 plates total, not including our two dessert tapas - save room for dessert!!!! All in all, I would give this place 5 stars for service and quality of food. Some plates can be a bit pricy like the shrimp but it is well worth it!! Others are a fair/good deal, like the patatas bravas which had the right amount of spice and salt but was a big filling plate PS - we had a WBEZ member card which our waiter told us entitled us to buy one, get one tapas for free. Well they only took off one single tapas, so it wasn't buy one, get one free. That kinda left a sour taste in our mouth having a much higher bill than expected.
One of the best places for tapas in Chicago and that is saying a lot. I came here with a big group and we ordered probably 700 tapas and 100 pitchers of sangria and left as very happy customers.

Tapas with a twist! I try something new everytime and everything is good to awesome. His place has the best atmosphere - with a wide assortment of clientele in the best way possible. I always bring people here if they are visiting. I have been seated in both the patio and bar areas - love them both. Whether you just happen to be in Lincoln park - or you want a good meal with a group of friends - you won't be sorry you came!

This place has gone down significantly since it opened i found a piece of glass in my onion jam and didnt even get a apology just oh we will take it off the bill. Really it was glass i almost ate!!! I ordered the calimari it was over fried like eating rubber bands.i would not spend any money here again.

I will cut right to the point. This place has a great location and ambiance but the food we had was just average at best. Pinxtos Platter - This was the best tasting choice with a variety of small bites. Nothing stood out as being wonderful, but it was tasty. Cream of Mushroom soup - So apparently the mushroom baby food idea didn't fly and Café Ba Ba Reeba bought the entire stock of this apple sauce textured extremely weak attempt at soup. Good news babies, no "soup" for you! Grilled Octopus - Cooked very well but had a fishy taste which they tried to cover up by coating it in smoked paprika, nothing more here...just an over load of smoked paprika Seared Salmon with Dill Crème - That's about it. Just a piece of overcooked salmon with dill sauce on the side. Just not exciting at all. No additional flavors on the salmon besides "dry" And I think we got something else forgettable, but they did make sure to include that same dill sauce that the salmon had. I mean, why not just cover everything up in dill sauce, right? I do have to say that the desserts were good and our server was excellent. He was super attentive and the best part of the meal. I will never go back here unless they realize that location doesn't mean your food tastes good. I also have to ask all the positive reviews here. Are you seriously smoking crack or just have no idea what good food is? Maybe you were drunk?

This is one of my family's favorites in the city. Everything is always incredible. If you're getting drinks, tapas & dessert plan for around $40 a person- not too bad for amazing drinks& foods in a great setting. I am impartial to Spain since I studied abroad there & being at cafe babareeba brings me back to my days of living the Spanish lifestyle. The brick lined walls and dimly lit Interier is swanky and perfect for whatever the occasion. Sangria was strong and not just juice. Dessert was on point. Tapas were all served hot& in good spacing time-wise. We will be returning time & time again.

Terrific Tapas! Definitely try the $2 Tapas on the top of the menu. We did the platter of all 6 for $11. What fun to have two bites of 6 different things. The dates and the beef/apple bruschett were our favorites. Garlic Shrimp is my favorite Tapas always. Theirs was good. The Paella was okay, be warned it's a full pan, not a small plate. The atmosphere is very festive and fun. Service was terrific
We tried all the sangria sand they were delicious. My favorite tapas was by far the goat cheese baked in tomato sauce.

Came back and was unfortunately quite underwhelmed this time around.  Scallop empanadas: Again, the standout of the night. A rich, flaky puff pastry with a delicious scallop filling. Short ribs: Tender and loved the flavors; however, I wasn't a fan of the side of mashed potatoes, which seemed suspiciously like they came from powder rather than real potatoes. Pomegranate salad: Solidly executed but lacked any special flavor or combination of flavors that would have made it worth writing home about. Pork belly and loin skewer: The weakest dish of the night. I'm pretty certain the skewer came with only loin cuts, which were extremely tough and dry. The sauce that came on the side alleviated the dryness, but I really would've preferred to see a sauce that was made for the dish than what seemed to be a generic dollop of mayonnaise-type sauce that was also used for the scallop empanadas. Seared scallop: I found this rather salty, although I thoroughly enjoyed the sweetness and acidity that the grapefruit brought to the dish. However, I definitely thought that the dish was not worth its price. Flan: Interesting combination of honey and what seems to be cinnamon, but definitely erred on the sweeter side. Service this time around was extremely slow, and I was rather disappointed that I didn't find any more tapas that I loved aside from the ones I discovered last time. Given the variable quality of food, it might be a while before I venture back here.

This is now my favorite restaurant in Chicago. The place is MASSIVE and we still had to have reservations for a Tuesday night. It was completely packed, and for good reason. The atmosphere is great, definitely an ideal place for a birthday/celebration dinner. As for the food, amazeballs. My favorite tapa was the buttermilk fried chicken. We also ordered a garlic shrimp dish, flank steak, and the potatoes with aioli sauce. I would recommend all of them.
I always think, "they're little plates. I need to order a lot." I leave happy and stuffed and a bit buzzed on the excellent sangria.
If one wants too book a party for 20 guests this an awesome Tapas restaurant Quality at Lincoln Park best.

We recently dined at Café Ba-Ba-Reeba on a Saturday evening. Our server was very attentive, and all of the other people involved on serving our table were very friendly and concerned we had a great experience. The tapas menu was extensive, and our server very knowledgeable of all of the items. The restaurant quickly filled up, so we were glad we got there early. We enjoyed everything. The only negative was that it was noisy and crowded.
Very meh. Food was okay, especially compared to what you can get in Chicago. Definitely overpriced. We ordered 6 dishes that came out right on top of each other.

What a fantastic tapas place in Chicago.  The restaurant space is huge and there is a wide variety of seating options, ranging from big group tables illuminated by skylights in the front to the dimmer, date-night candlelit areas further back.  Our server was extremely friendly and helpful; no complaints whatsoever.   Since it was our first time here, we decided to go with the more popular items, which were helpfully highlighted in red on the menu.  We ended up ordering at least one thing from every category, and they were all delicious.  Thankfully, the food also came with enough time in between each dish to enjoy each one properly. Burrata (vegetables & cheese): very creamy cheese which contrasted nicely with the fresh sweetness of the roasted corn, tomatoes, and other vegetables. Rioja-braised shortrib w/ mashed potatoes and vegetables (beef & lamb): the shortrib was tender and flavorful, and mashed potatoes were satisfying (as they always are).  However, the vegetables were somewhat overcooked and a bit soggy due to the red wine sauce. Seared sea scallops (seafood): normally I'm not a big fan of scallops due to their somewhat fatty taste, but the citrus and the leeks helped to balance out the flavor and provide a nice bite.  Not quite sure it's worth $13 though. But the highlight of the meal came in the form of the bacon wrapped dates (under the label chicken & pork, for some reason).  Oh my gosh, they were so good!  Sweet, salty, and rich, hitting all the reward systems that are a part of human taste.  No regrets. Total cost: $42 w/out tax or tip.  This was enough food for two people, so I ended up paying around $26-27.  Not very cheap, but given this is a popular restaurant in the middle of Chicago, it's to be expected.   I would definitely recommend coming here for a delicious experience.

It was a wonderful spot to come to after a stressful day at work. I was immediately greeted with smiling faces and a great waitstaff. The atmosphere was full of great energy and people seemed happy to be there.  The food was fantastic. This is the type of place that's great to come with a group of people. Mixing and picking at each other's tapas is the best way to experience the menu.  I definitely recommend the Roasted Dates wrapped in Bacon and Apple Vinaigrette. The Chicken & Ham Croquetas were incredibly tasty as well. I mean, I was pretty much crying at my table.  Also, don't forget to try dessert. I got the caramelized banana and wasn't disappointed one bit.

This place was recommended by a friend and we enjoyed our meal and the experience very much.  The style is Spanish Tapas, and the choices are seemingly endless.  With so many options, we were thankful for a server and a manager who made awesome recommendations.  We started with an appetizer sampler, the highlights being the variety and freshness.  Next up goat cheese in tomato sauce with insanely good croutonish slices of bread.  The cheese was smooth and the sauce was flavorful and hot.  A great blend of textures and elements.  We finished our main meal with the Rioja-Braised Short Rib.  It is served over Manchego mashed potatoes with baby root vegetables & rioja wine glaze.  Some of the best mashed potatoes I've ever had in that dish, and the short rib was tender and juicy.  We finished with a small dessert, the macona almond caramel bar.  2-3 bites of bliss.

Attracted by the ridiculously cheap prices displayed on the menu outside, my friend and I wandered in thinking this was a nice up-scale cafe in which we could both order a plate and be satisfied. Unfortunately we failed to realize how tiny the portions were because the main focus were the tapas. There's nothing wrong with that, and the small dishes we ordered (spicy potatoes and brussels sprouts salad? or something of that nature) were absolutely delicious. The tapas themselves take a long time to bake and prepare because they make them fresh, but overall really great atmosphere and lovely service.

Good raspberry sangria and some red wines.  Love the goat cheese tapa with tomato sauce and garlic bread.  The chicken empanada is good and so is the Spanish omelette (tortilla Espanola).  The stuffed mushrooms were just ok.  The fried calamari was good but spicy.  Some of the tapas had too much sauce, but otherwise most of the food is good.  Overall a fun time with a group of friends in a lively place.

One of the first....if not THE first...pioneers of the Tapas movement when it opened in the early 90s. And while many such places have come and gone since then, Ba-Ba endures. Always packed and bustling....huge colorful fun place....bring a large group and sample a ton of things. Food is quite good......not spectacular.....but many things are really delicious (the beef with horseradish is my fave......shrimp dishes are good too) Sure there are many restaurants that may have lapped  them in terms of authenticity, etc.....but it's a great escape on a cold Chicago night in a cute vibrant neighborhood. Will always have a soft spot for it.
Unique, creative, and delicious dishes. Sangria with fresh fruit by the pitcher. Romantic ambiance. Need I say more? The perfect place for any occasion and a guaranteed great experience every time.

Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba is my go-to for birthdays and group dinners. There's a lot of fun energy, but it's not too loud or out of hand. Tapas are great for groups because you get to taste lots of dishes, but it also makes splitting the bill so easy, not to mention that Ba-Ba-Reeba is very reasonably priced. On top of that, the food is AMAZING.  Some of my favorite dishes are; the spicy potatoes, the goat cheese, the bacon wrapped dates, paella, and the pork shoulder. You can't forget a big pitcher of sangria and absolutely must finish with the butterscotch pudding -- it's out of this world! I never would have thought of Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba as a brunch destination, but I only needed three words to be convinced -- Bloody Mary Bar!

Where do I begin? Make sure to make a reservation early, especially on the weekends. Atmosphere: Very busy, crowded, and loud Service: nice, friendly and attentive staffs Food: beef tenderloin & blue cheese ( cheese overpowering the taste of beef)           grilled hanger steak with mojo picon ( perfect medium rare)           roast dates with bacon & apple vinaigrette (DELICIOUS! crunchy bacon and super sweet dates, but thought the apple vinaigrette was not necessary to be added in the dish)           rioja-braised short ribs, manchego mashed potatoes (SO GOOD!, really tender short ribs and really good mashed potatoes)           Seafood Paella (better than Carnivale's, good amount of seafood, but it was a bit salty for me. It tasted better after adding lemon juice and sour cream) Desserts: caramelized banana (good, but might taste even better if banana were pan-fried too)                 natilla flan (very rich and sweet)                 chocolate truffle cake (THE BEST! the dark chocolate was bitter, but very smooth. The cream on the side was very light and delicious. The bitter chocolate combines with the cream=perfect combo)                 vanilla bourbon chai ice cream with pedro ximenez sherry (ice cream was very light and refreshing and the cookie was just ok) Recommend: rioja-braised short ribs, manchego mashed potatoes & chocolate truffle cake

Came here with a large group recently, which I believe is the best way to experience the restaurant due to the tapas style. We were able to sample a large amount of the menu and overall were very impressed. I wouldn't say I was wowed by anything, hence the 4 stars, but would definitely return. Some of the memorable dishes included the pan seared scallops, grilled squid, and the beef tenderloin. We also ordered the seafood paella, which I thought was delicious, but it was my first time eating paella so I have no basis for comparison. The portion size on the paella was also very generous so if you're planning on ordering this I'd go with a few less tapas dishes. One other let down was the jamon iberico, which again I have no basis for comparison, but considering the legendary status of this holy grail of the pork family I was expecting something much more flavorful. I guess this means I will have to plan a trip to Spain to conduct a proper comparison.

Sorry Chicago-ans.. if this is your version of a top tapas restaurant... I'm not sure what else there is to say.  If Ba-Ba-Reeba were located in a small town, I'd rate it higher (3 stars)... but it's located in one of the largest cities in the US, so the quality, flavor and freshness should be compared with places like Boqueria (Flatiron) and Olea (Ft. Greene) in NYC. Or even Spain? I've only lived in Andalucia (Southern Spain) and I think the comparison is similar to Chinese food in the US (babareeba) vs. Chinese food in China...  The Bloody Mary bar should be avoided at all costs. Even their "spicy" mix is just a tad spicy at best. Plus, the choices are overwhelming... your drink will just taste like tomato juice with random spices in it.  The food was just off. I felt like I was at a commercialized chain restaurant eating processed food (The Cheesecake Factory was the first place that came to mind).  1) Patatas Bravas: They put a coating on the patatas (paprika?), which make them taste funky. I appreciate that they don't want to serve up traditional patatas, but this iteration tasted starchy, processed and strange.  2) Brussel sprout salad: This was admittedly the best dish from what I tried. However, the ratio of cheese and dressing to sprouts was off... So I felt inundated with the fixings, I could barely taste the sprouts.  3) Octopus: Check out my picture, does that look appetizing? It was overly oily and rubbery. My cousin had never tried octopus and I convinced him (Since I savor the octopus at Taverna Kyclades in Astoria, Queens and even Boqueria). Our server said "it's everyone's favorite..." (This dish reaffirmed why I left Chicago after living there for 3 years).  4) NOW for the worst part of the meal... DESSERT. I received a free dessert through Yelp and our server recommended the marcona-almond caramel bar. It's basically a glorified snickers bar, but worse... So we looked on Yelp and saw that folks reallllly liked the butterscotch custard. So for sh*ts and giggles we ordered that too... #fail. It tasted like overly sweetened condensed milk with flavoring.  Silver lining? I got to hang with my cousin, who I haven't seen in a few years... so I did enjoy the company, thus the 2 star rating.

I really enjoy Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba. The bacon wrapped dates are the best. The potatoes brava are also amazing. The white and red sangria are both good. Everyone I go with likes the bloody mary bar and it looks great but I'm not a bloody mary fan.  The paella is also great and a good meal to share. I've always had friendly and efficient service. It has a nice atmosphere and is good for small or bigger groups.
Phenomenal. That's it. That's all I have to say. Oh. And get the butterscotch dessert.

The food here is excellent. They have a great selection and everything so far has been delicious. Of all the times we've been in, we've always had a friendly and attentive waiter.  I would just definitely recommend having reservations, unless you don't mind waiting 2 hours at a nearby bar... but it's worth the wait

I thought it was pretty good. My GF, who spent 1.5 years in Spain, wasn't quite as impressed (she says she is very picky about Tapas).  The wine was good and food was very reasonably priced. Four of us had 2-4 drinks each and all the food we wanted for ~$45 a person.

One of my favorite restaurants in Chicago! I'm new to the city and I can't get enough of this place. Everything i ordered was amazing- from the sangria to the bacon wrapped dates to the marinara goat cheese dip... Everything!

Ate here last month,bringing out of town friends. It had been a few years since we had been to Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba.  It was a let down in terms of food quality and atmosphere.  Perhaps the place simply grew too large over the years and management has become complacent?  We had about 10 different items from the menu, including a few recommended from the waiter.  Without specifying any one, all were of mediocre quality, based on both the presentation and taste.  This place is dark and has become blah. While this used to be a cool place to meet or bring friends, I do not think it shows well for Chicago any longer.
great atmosphere. most of our dishes were great. loved the green peppers - simple and delicious. loved the dates. sangria just ok - not very potent but worth a try if you like sangria.

Every time I decide to visit the Windy City I decide to visit somewhere new, since there's so many great places to eat! Then again when you waste your dinner at some place mediocre, it's not that fun.  We were seated promptly and was served fresh bread. We ordered 2 pitchers of sangria the peach and passion fruit white sangria. Very sweet but nothing too remarkable. Our server was sweet and recommended anything in red is popular. Therefore we ordered about 7 different dishes. The short rib and beef dish was the only thing we liked! Out of 7 dishes Paella- not worth the price and not amazing  Calamari- very soft and not chewy but nothing remarkable  4 other bread and cheese dishes that were not even pallet savory! All in all this place has over 2k reviews and it's worth a 3 stars at most. Would I come back no, am I glad I went sure... Would not recommend!

AMAZINGLY! I can't wait to go back.  The croquetas were amazing! The sangria to die for! Everything I tried I was obsessed with!  Only con was that I felt pressured to leave towards the end and it wasn't even closing time
Very fun atmosphere and decor I always like eating somewhere the feels like I'm outside.  The food is great, fun and inventive.

Make reservations or prepare to wait! Sangria is very good here. Loved all the tapas we got, goat cheese was the best. We sat at the bar and the bartender was really friendly and quick. Would go again and recommend.

I'd typically rather have big meals than small bites, but this place completely changed my mind and I sure left with a full belly! We got the spicy potatoes, the short rib, the burratta and the paella. I ate every last bit, it was so good. I would recommend this as a go-to for all visitors of Chicago!

My boyfriend and I had our last dinner in Chicago here thanks to the recommendation of our Airbnb host. I love Spanish tapas so I had high hopes for this place... and they most definitely delivered. Here's what we tried: -Chorizo-wrapped date & cheese - the best $2 you can spend in all of Chicago. -Pork belly skewer - outrageously flavorful. -Garlic potato salad - not wowed by this, but it was good, especially with the chives on top. Huge serving. -Grilled octopus - I love octopus, so sorry to report this was rather bland and a little too chewy for my liking. -Buttermilk fried chicken thighs - another super flavorful dish and another huge serving. -Bacon wrapped dates w/ apple vinaigrette - I'm not sure which I liked more - these or the chorizo wrapped dates. The fruity vinaigrette is a lovely accompaniment. I could have eaten the entire plate of these babies. -Deviled egg - a good deviled egg, but save that $2 for another chorizo-wrapped date instead. -Ham & cantaloupe salad - Sweet and salty, not heavy, refreshing. Loved this. -Desserts - we tried the caramelized banana, butterscotch custard, and almond caramel bar. Not bad at all, but nothing to write home about. -Margarita - they make a really nice margarita here, strong, but not overbearing. Service was quick and attentive and the atmosphere was lively yet laid back. A couple misses on the food so I can't give Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba 5 stars, but some outstanding tapas have me wishing my next trip to Chicago is sooner rather than later.

Authentic tapas at their best.  Garlic shrimp, mushroom toast, garlic/tomato bread and the short rib were some of the highlights.  We topped the night with every dessert on the menu and were NOT disappointed - especially the butterscotch pudding and the Marconi almond bar - crazy.  This place is deeeeee-lish.

Great tapas with my boyfriend and not too expensive. We had an awesome waitress too... I think her name was Cherie. It was pretty packed for a tuesday night which obviously shows how good the place is. We got the meatballs (delicious and full of flavor), the meat and cheese plate (YUMMMM), the pinxtos platter which had a nice variety but not much food and the calamari which my boyfriend enjoyed (I don't like fish). Definitely will visit again soon!

I have been here three times.  Each time just as excellent as the others.  As most have mentioned, if you eat pork, the bacon wrapped dates are a must. I was also very happy with the fish, especially the grilled octopus and seared salmon.  The grilled hangar steak is also a solid choice.  The atmosphere is nice and cozy with a warm feel, even though it is a rather decent-sized restaurant in terms of capacity.

Oh my god.  What an amazing place.  Great service.  Great drinks.  Great food. Words cannot express how much I loved the experience here.  Definitely somewhere I recommend to my friends and definitely somewhere I will repeatedly go back to!

I always make reservations when i eat here and never have to wait. Its a good environment for a date or group of ppl. My go to is the Spinach & Manchego-Stuffed Mushrooms, spicy potatoes, and goat cheese baked in tomatoe sauce.
So good! Expect a longer evening, as each tapas comes out 1 or 2 at a time, so if you're eating multiple, it'll be a longer night. But, great sangrias, a fun atmosphere- HIGHLY recommend!

Wow! Every time I come to Chicago to visit my daughter, I think the food can't get any better but this place is really the BEST! Every single bite was perfection.  For drinks we got a half pitcher of the seasonal special sangria apple cider flavored. We each got two glasses from that size. We got the Brussels sprout salad, goat cheese in marinara (my daughter's favorite), the omelet, and chorizo and chicken skewer.  The dessert was almost free because of the amazing check in offer. We decided to get the seasonal sorbet (mango), caramelized banana, and butterscotch custard. My daughter ordered the custard (I don't even like custard) but I had to try it...it was even delicious!  The waitress(Meredith) and atmosphere were fabulous!! We will be back!

Came here with high hopes as I have heard good things. Waitress was very short with us, friendly, but very little interaction. The food all came out quickly as it should for a tapas experience. We ordered a pitcher of sangria, 7 tapas, and 2 desserts. Sangria was large for the price and tasted good. Food was a let down, only really good dish was Brussel sprout salad. Empanada and patatas bravas were ok. Hangar steak was  very bland and calamari mediocre. Desserts were both good.  Cafe Iberico will be the move next time.

Loved the food! I came here with three people and we ordered eight tapa dishes and all of the 6 pintxos. My faves of the night were the grilled octopus, the seared scallops, fried green peppers (so surprisingly good), and the grilled hanger steak.  In terms of portion, I'd say I was satisfied after the first five dishes+pintxos (which were bite-sized and not particularly shareable), but my party chose to order more. Everything we had were delicious and we finished every bite. At the end of our meal, the manager (?) came by and presented us with four free desserts because "it was our first time here." What a pleasant & sweet surprise!  All of the desserts were delicious, but my fave was the butterscotch pudding shooters. Would most definitely come back here!

I've been coming here for a while. I've never had a bad experience or bad service until today. Not only did we make reservations and our table wasn't ready but the service was not good. Hopefully it was just a bad night but tonight was a real let down. The goat cheese which is my all time favorite did not hold the same taste or consistency as the times I've previously been here. We had to wait for our waiter, literally searching for him to get the check to leave. I love this place but tonight just blew. We rarely go out for dinner but it was for our anniversary. We might as well have stayed home and ordered in.
Love this place. The food is great and the atmosphere is fun. You should try to make reservations or else it's hard to get a table unless you are there early.
Very nice and cozy place. Sangrias are delicious. Wasn't impressed by food though. I just compared it to Spanish tapas restaurants and Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba didn't hit the spot.

Our plan was to go to Tanta. We waited too long for reservations and had to find a short notice solution. Fortunately, a friend suggested Baba Reba.  It was a wonderful experience.  Order about three plates each, or two plates and some paella. Everything was so good. Get the chorizo wrapped dates, any of the meat options, the seafood paella, shrimp, patatas bravas, and sangria.  It was all authentic, it was all very good, and it was reasonably priced. A great double date. It's casual and fun. Drinks are good, food is great, servers are helpful.  If I could bring you with me, I would; just because I want to go again.  6 stars

I'd heard so many good things about this place, so I was super excited to try it.  The tapas were insanely delicious, and came out super quickly - the fried chicken, the garlic shrimp, and the scallops empanada were some of my favorites.  A friend recommended the sangria, but it didn't live up the hype - a bit watery and not enough alcohol.  I will definitely come back - this is a great place to go with a group and try a bunch of different things on the extensive menu - but I'll order beer or wine instead.

Would be 5 stars if our service would've been better. Love the idea of breakfast/brunch tapas and these did not disappoint! We tried the eggs Benedict, spinach & artichoke crepe and spicy potatoes and were perfectly satisfied. Didn't have drinks, but the build your own Bloody Mary bar looked good from what we saw at other tables and the sangrias on the menu also sounded really yummy. Atmosphere wasn't anything to write home (or Yelp) about, but that may be because we were seated in the back of the restaurant a bit removed from the main action.
This place is so consistent it is ridiculous. Great food.  Adequate service and generally the same place that started the Chicago tapas revolution 20 years ago.

Passion Fruit Sangria - I recommend! Seafood Paella - Order this first cause it takes time, and keep this in mind before you order as this portion is very healthy.  Burrata - Good cheese, good blend.  Roasted Dates with Bacon & Apple Vinaigrette - Interesting blend, tasty dates!  Beef Empanada - I liked the flour of the empanada!  Grilled Octopus - Octopus wasn't extremely flavorful  Serrano Ham - My god, this was some amazing meat.  The service was top notch, the atmosphere was energetic, and the experience was great.
Bacon wrapped dates delicious.  Fun place to go to and enjoy with a group.  Parking difficult unless you valet.

Ba-Ba-Reeba is exactly what I imagine enjoying tapas is all about. The atmosphere is casual, inspires conversation, and allows you the pleasure of sitting for hours as time breezes by. Servers offer incredible food and drink recommendations, and make you feel like you are their only table. Tip 1: Time flies, so make reservations early (both in the night, and ahead of time) Tip 2: TRY THE SHORT-RIB

I live right around the corner from this place and go quite frequently. It's perfect for a night out with girlfriends. The sangria is amazing. The paella is hit or miss (sometimes it's a bit bland). The gambas al ajillo and Spanish tortilla are dream worthy. Great brunch, too. Never too crowded.

I used to love this place. Somehow portions got smaller, flavors blander, and prices higher.  Paella is just ok. The sangria is just ok too, a bit water down. The patio is a great space in the summer. Very goo ambiance.

Yummmmmm tapas. Food is good, the atmosphere is fun and inviting, and the brunch on weekends is great. I wish they were open more hours of the day but I love it either way. The staff is polite and put up well with kids. My kids particularly like running around like lunatics dancing to the music playing and it's ok here. It surely wouldn't encourage anyone to try it out but they won't throw you out or make you feel weird that your child isn't behaving. The portions are small and they come out fast so you can order slow and keep ordering until your full. Great for sharing.

I don't know if I would say their tapas is the best around, but this is a very popular place. As a result the wait on the weekend is always crazy,so if you're looking to do something quick I probably  avoid it then.  A favorite among the Lincoln Park Trixie's , always in full force and drunk off sangria. Just sayin.

Great food, great service, reasonably priced. I went with a few friends and we each got two plates and the sangria. We got everything pretty quickly. The spicy potatoes and bacon wrapped dated were amazing. Portions were just enough to be filling. Definitely worth going to.

I've been here before, great service and amazing food. I came here tonight and I can't even get seated when I had a reservation and everything. the reservation was for 7:30 and we were not seated until 8:05 - with no apologizes or updates while we waited. we waited 35 minutes for a reservation. just told to stand in the corner. what's the point of a reservation if you're just going to stand around and be ignored?

Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba is such a fun tasty place to go. It's great for a date night and for a bigger party with friends. There are choices on the menu for everyone and here are some of my favorites: 1. Potato salad. It has a nice zest to it but it's not too spicy at all! 2. Anything they make that is baked with cheese. They have a baked goat or feta dish that is amazing with crostini. 3. The meatball dish 4. Their black raspberry of black berry sangria is the best! So fresh, fruity, and still actually tastes like wine unlike some artificial tasting sangria. I've heard the brunch is great as well!

Went here for the first time the other night and it definitely lived up to the hype! Had the pintxos platter to start (the bacon/chorizo date was the best!). We got the spicy potatoes, hangar steak, the fried chicken thigh (so good, tasted like fancy wings!), and the shrimp. And drank the classic red sangria and passion fruit sangria. Everything was great and our waiter was so knowledgeable and attentive.

Immediate reaction after eating: Eat the octopus and buttermilk chicken, get the paella to fill up and take home. Service is professional and attentive and not overly friendly which is actually how I like it , glad I went and I ate it all and am taking paella home. Full Review: Stopped in at 2pm on a Sat, busy but we (party of 2) was seated immediately. I really wanted a paella and though the menu was half brunch and did not list the regular paella, had no problem ordering the chicken paella. Also we got the octopus, spicy potatoes and the buttermilk chicken. the tender octopus and the buttermilk chicken....whoa whoa!!! I started closing my eyes while eating those, the dishes were off the chain, I could have passed on the potatoes but they were great with the sauce...the paella came and was hot and the chicken was tender, too much Lima beans but that is just me....we also did a check in and got the free dessert and we picked flan from the dessert list. Nice small tapas size of flan perfect for 2 people to share, I am glad it didn't taste lipgloss cause flan sometimes can do that. We also had the passion fruit sangria and it was solid but not something I will likely remember..if you want good sangria go to nandos

There are a million great things to say about Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba! From their drinks to their wide variety of tapas plates, every thing is fantastic. It is tough to get a reservation on a weekend, so book in advance. I recommend the chef's artisanal cheese selection, warm potato and onion omelet, grilled squid, chicken and ham croquetas, sangria (red and white) and their mojitos. I have only been here for dinner, but I can not imagine them doing any thing sub-par. Amazing restaurant!

A day full of bests. My girlfriend and I took the L over to CBBR and man, it may have just made our entire weekend.  The bloody mary bar itself is probably worth the trip, but literally every thing we had was insane.  I'm a giant dork for Eggs Benedict, and it was probably  the best i've eaten.  And i've had it everywhere.  Super simple, but with a spanish twist.  Delightful.  The deviled eggs were fantastic, the coffee was delightful.   If you're the type that does brunch, you know who you are.  And you LOVE places like this.  Go.  Get the fattening stuff "for the table" and eat it before they can.  You were going to anyway. Can't wait to get back to Chicago, so we can get back here.

With over 2,000 reviews you don't need me telling you to go there. Expect great food but frenetic service. Food is amazing, as usual, but the dishes/drinks are hastily placed down on the table which is a bit distracting. Must-order items: Bacon-wrapped dates, Potato & onion omelette, spicy potatoes, goat cheese in tomato sauce, beef tenderloin & blue cheese, shrimp with garlic, and the sea scallops.

Omg this experience was EPIC. I mean I did send my food back twice but they fixed it so whatever. Used to live in Spain for three years and needed this moment here so yes, 5 stars for this place. Please come here. Tapas, pinchos, and vino (wine).

Absolutely divine.  Careful and don't order too much!  Those little dishes add up money wise and food wise.  The brunch is also awesome.  It's like I have to make sure all my friends have been here.  I've come here alone and ordered their seafood paella to go.  It's so good.  Avoid peak times.

We are here visiting friends and they wanted to try out the tapas, so we came for happy hour in the bar. We loved the bacon wrapped dates, chicken empanadas super yummy. We then had a butterscotch custard for dessert. We highly recommend coming here, waitstaff was very friendly.
This place is truly great! I recommend it for all. Delicious food and amazing sangria. Make sure to try the paella! It is one of a kind!
I've been in Chicago for 5+ years and its a restaurant I keep coming back to. I try to make reservations in advance via Open Table (:
AMAZING Tapas, and really good for group get togethers! This is definitely one of my favorite places to go when I go out in the city
Best Brunch in Chicago.. order the spinach and artichoke crepe, and the citrus french toast.. they are to die for!
Ba-ba-reeba.... You and I have a love hate relationship. I love your sangria and hate when the night is over! Great tapas, get sangria. Try the Peach- it's my favorite!

Amazing staff!!! Service was spot on. I only had to wait for 5 min for my table , on a packed Saturday. The food was beautifully prepared and presented. Or server was so nice and knowledgeable and he did not once try to rush us despite us taking our own sweet time.

The food here is very good and the service as well. It's a bit pricey but very good. They are not generous with the tapas portions so if with a larger group expect to order double or triple of everything and a entree for each person to really fill up. Their red sangria is very delicious and if you order a pitcher expect a nice buzz. Some of their other sangrias not as strong. They do have a brunch with a Bloody Mary bar that's amazing. It can get crowded so I would recommend a reservation or atleast call first before heading over for a walk in.

My bestfriend and I seriously had a great time here. The service is exceptional and the food was great and flavorful! To me, it's a bit over priced for us college students but there really should be some sort of discount for us students.

My boyfriend and I returned for Sunday brunch and were very pleased with our experience here. The specialty mango sangria was incredibly tasty. We split some veggie-friendly dishes such as the potato omelet, the eggs benedict, and the stuffed mushrooms. Though my boyfriend isn't vegetarian, he thoroughly enjoyed these dishes alongside me. Jane was our server and was very attentive and friendly. We're happy we gave this place a second chance and will likely return.

This bustling tapas restaurant is larger than it looks from the outside, and is consistently busy. The menu has a reasonably broad selection of tapas and also paella. There is also a substantial wine and sangria list, and a separate cocktail menu. I particularly enjoyed the house smoked salmon.  Bacon wrapped dates were nice and crisp on the outside without being mushy on the inside.  Buttermilk chicken thighs seemed mis-named, and were more like chicken tenders with a wing sauce on them.  Beef skewers were tender and nicely charred on the outside, although the horseradish sauce could have used more kick. The empanadas had a delightfully flakey pastry. Service was friendly and attentive. Dishes are delivered by runners, and come out as they are ready, so don't order everything at once or you will be inundated in food!

Went out to dinner here with 4 friends and everything was delicious! The mango sangria was awesome, and we really enjoyed the chicken paella, bacon wrapped dates, and baked goat cheese with tomato sauce (among like 7 other items we got, it was all great). The service was great too, very prompt and attentive!
Check-in and you get free dessert! Anyway, the food tastes average and it takes sooooo lonnngggggggg to get all the orders.

They have the best sangria I've ever had! My favorite tapas are their horseradish beef skewers, goat cheese, and potato and onion omelette. I've been here a few times and they never disappoint. It's definitely one of my favorites in Chicago. The only reason I give them a 4 is because this place is pricier than most tapas places. Also I've tried a few dishes I didn't care for, but the best thing about tapas is you just get to keep ordering more!

Everything about this place is just perfect.  The food tastes so good, I had to stop conversing with my friends and just finish off the plate. I prefer being seated outside in the patio. More roomy, bright and lively.  Tried the Spicy potatoes, Chicken Empanada and the Buttermilk Fried Chicken Thighs. Loved all three dishes. The portions are not small, that was a bonus.  Service was great. I can see myself being a regular here.

Simply delicious! Had a early dinner here this evening with a few friends. Ordered a pitcher of their classic sangria, good stuff, and stiff. Got some yummy bread and olive oil to snack on while we decided ..  We went all out and ordered a bit of everything.. Chorizo wrapped dates were to die for, the lamb, pork shoulder and beef empanadas were my favorite. Food came out quickly, the servers were very attentive .. They cleaned up quickly and made sure we had everything we needed, fresh plates, water.. Etc. good music. Good atmosphere. Will definitely return!

Let's get one thing straight from the get-go.  Pan con tomate means Bread with tomato.  It doesn't mean bread with tomato, arugula manchego, anchovies, iberico or whatever other Spanish ingredient you can think to put on top of it.  It means bread with tomato.  The success of such a dish depends on having high quality super ripe tomatoes, combined with bread that has been toasted after being brushed with a scant amount of olive oil and just lightly rubbed with a bit of garlic.  When you have pan con tomate on the menu and you bring out this abomination that has all this extra bull s*** on it you embarrass yourself.  This is not Spanish food.  I wanted what I ordered, and what the menu said it was.  Simple refreshing bread with tomato.   The kind that is so good that you marvel at how something so simple can be so tasty can be so elegant and delicious. Furthermore,  I don't understand how the Patatas Bravas at Tall Boy Taco which is owned by the same company and also happens to be a Mexican Joint rather than a Spanish one can be so much better than the ones here.  The decision the coat them in paprika prior to frying and then do so in such a way to burn the paprika takes away from all the positive notes you can get from the tasty aoili. While we're on the subject of burnt food, let's talk about my croquetas, which upon arriving at the table I thought looked a little dark.  But before tasting them I gave them the benefit of the doubt and assumed that it was overcooked which it was.  How obviously burnt food makes it past the line cook, expediter, and runner to the table, shows a pretty blatant lack of care and concern when it comes to the quality of the food.  It's not like I couldn't have waited on a refire, there was plenty of food at the table already and the only reason I didn't send it back is because I was already food.
